original: tu sabbāva savisaye’ti, te panaññeheva paṭikkhittā. Dūraṃ maggo, antikaṃ maggoti
analyzed: tu sabbā ava sa visayā iti te pana aññehi iva paṭikkhittāḥ dūram maggo antikam maggo ti
translated: and that all are locatives when they are preceded by a word denoting existence. But they are contradicted by the following passage: ‘The path is far’ and ‘The path is near’ .🔽‘Far’ and ‘near’ are second-case locatives in a special verbal noun …

original: kiriyāvisesanaṃ… bhūdhātussa gammamānattā. Visuddho lobhanīyehi dhammehi, parimutto
analyzed: kiriyā visesanam bhū dhātussa visuddhaḥ lobhanīyehi dhammehi parimuttaḥ
translated: ‘He is purified from states that breed greed’ and ‘He is freed from states that breed greed’ .

original: so dukkhasmā vivicceva kāmehi, gambhīrato ca puthulato ca yojanaṃ, āyāmena yojanaṃ,
analyzed: so dukkhasma vivicca iva kāmehi gambhīrataḥ ca puthulataḥ ca yojanam āyāmena yojanam
translated: ‘He, having secluded himself from sense desires, far and wide, for a league in depth and a league in breadth,

original: tato pabhuti, yato sarāmi attānanti savisayeva vibhattiyo.
analyzed: tatas yatas sarāmi sa visayā iva vibhattiyaḥ
translated: from that time on, as long as I remember myself’ . The locative case is used in all these passages.

original: 27. Apaparīhi vajjane.🔽Vajjane vattamānehi apaparīhi yoge pañcamī hoti. Apa sālāya āyanti vāṇijā, pari sālāya
analyzed: apaparīhi vajjane  vajjane vattamānehi apaparīhi yoge pañcamī hoti apa sālāya āyanti vāṇijā pari sālāya
translated: 27. Apaparīhi vajjane.🔽When apa and parī are used in the sense of ‘going away from’, the fifth case is used. The merchants go away from the hall, the merchants go around the hall. The meaning is: ‘having gone away from the hall’.

original: āyanti vāṇijā, sālaṃ vajjetvāti attho. Vajjaneti kiṃ? Rukkhaṃ parivijjotate vijju.
analyzed: āyanti vāṇijā sālam vajjetvā ati atthaḥ vajjane ti kim rukkham parivijjotate vijju
translated: Vajjaneti kiṃ? The lightning flashes around the tree.

original: Āpāṭaliputtasmā vassi devoti mariyādā-bhividhīsvavadhi visayeva pañcamī, vinā pāṭaliputtena
analyzed: āpāṭaliputtasma devo ti pañcamī vinā pāṭaliputtena
translated: Āpāṭaliputtasmā vassi devoti mariyādā-bhividhīsvavadhi visayeva pañcamī, vinā pāṭaliputtena

original: saha veti viseso, evaṃ yāva pāṭaliputtasmā vassi devoti.
analyzed: saha vā iti visesaḥ evam yāva pāṭaliputtasmā devo ti
translated: saha veti viseso, evaṃ yāva pāṭaliputtasmā vassi devoti.

original: 28. Paṭinidhipaṭidānesu patinā.🔽Paṭinidhimhi paṭidāne ca vattamānena patinā yoge nāmasmā pañcamī vibhatti hoti. Buddhasmā
analyzed: paṭinidhi paṭidānesu patinā  paṭinidhimhi paṭidāne ca vattamānena patinā yoge nāmasma pañcamī vibhatti hoti buddhasma
translated: . Paṭinidhipaṭidānesu patinā.🔽When paṭinidhi and paṭidāna are used, the fifth case is used with the word patinā. Sāriputta is the counterpart of the Buddha, he gives the pot to them as a counterpart.

original: pati sāriputto, ghatamassa tesasmā pati dadāti, paṭinidhipaṭidānesūti kiṃ? Rukkhaṃ pati vijjotate.
analyzed: pati sāriputto pati dadāti paṭinidhi paṭidānesu iti kim rukkham pati vijjotate
translated: Paṭinidhipaṭidānesūti kiṃ? The lightning flashes around the tree.

original: 29. Rite dutiyā ca.
analyzed: r ite dutiyā ca
translated: . Rite dutiyā ca.

original: Ritesaddena yoge nāmasmā dutiyā hoti pañcamī ca. Rite saddhammaṃ, rite saddhammā.
analyzed: yoge dutiyā hoti pañcamī ca rite saddhammam rite saddhammā
translated: When the word rite is used, the second case and the fifth case are used with the word nāma. Rite saddhammaṃ, rite saddhammā.

original: 30. Vinā-ññatra tatiyā ca.
analyzed: vinā aññatra tatiyā ca
translated: . Vinā-ññatra tatiyā ca.

original: Vinā-ññatrasaddehi yoge nāmasmā tatiyā ca hoti dutiyā pañcamiyo ca. Vinā vātena, vinā vātaṃ, vinā vātasmā, aññatra ekena piṇḍapātanīhārakena, aññatra dhammaṃ, aññatra dhammā.
analyzed: vinā aññatra saddehi yoge tatiyā ca hoti dutiyā ca vinā vātena vinā vātam vinā vātasma aññatra ekena piṇḍapāta nīhārakena aññatra dhammam aññatra dhammā
translated: After ‘together with’ and ‘apart from’ and ‘except’ the Locative is used in the sense of the Instrumental and Dative. Apart from the wind, apart from the wind, apart from the wind, except for one alms-food giver, except for the True Idea, except for the True Ideas.

original: 31. Puthanānāhi.
analyzed: puthanānāhi
translated: . After ‘different’ and ‘various’.

original: Etehi yoge tatiyā hoti pañcamī ca. Puthageva janena, puthageva janasmā, janena nānā, janasmā nānā.
analyzed: etehi yoge tatiyā hoti pañcamī ca puthak iva janena puthak iva janasmai janena nānā janasmai nānā
translated: After these words the Locative is used in the sense of the Instrumental and Ablative. Different from the people, different from the people, different from the people, various from the people, various from the people.

original: 32. Sattamyādhāre.🔽Kiriyādhāra bhūta kattu kammānaṃ dhāraṇena yo kiriyāyādhāro tasmiṃ kārake nāmasmā🔽sattamī hoti. Kaṭe nisīdati (devadatto), thāliyaṃ odanaṃ pacati, ākāse sakunā, bhilesu
analyzed: sattamī ādhāre  bhūta kattu kammānam dhāraṇena yaḥ tasmin kārake nāmasmai  sattamī hoti kaṭe nisīdati devadattaḥ thāliyam odanam pacati ākāse sakunāḥ bhilesu
translated: . After a Locative base.

original: telaṃ, gaṅgāyaṃ vajo.
analyzed: telam gaṅgā ayam
translated: The Locative is used in the sense of the Nominative, Objective, and Objective of Verbal Action, in the case of a Locative base. He sits on the ground, he cooks rice in the dish, birds in the air, oil in the sesame seeds, a ford in the Ganges.

original: 33. Nimitte.
analyzed: nimitte
translated: . In the sense of a sign.

original: Nimittatthe sattamī hoti. Ajinamhi haññate dīpi, musāvāde pācitthiyaṃ.
analyzed: nimitta atthe sattamī hoti ajinamhi haññate dīpi musāvāde pācitthiyam
translated: The Locative is used in the sense of a sign. A leopard is killed in the hide, in telling a deliberate lie there is an offence of Expiation.

original: 34. Yabbhāvobhāvalakkhaṇaṃ.
analyzed: yat bhāvaḥ bhāva lakkhaṇam
translated: . The characteristic of non-existence and existence.

original: Yassa bhāvo bhāvantarassa lakkhaṇaṃ bhavati, tato sattamī hoti. Gāvīsu duyhamānāsu
analyzed: yassa bhāvaḥ bhāvantarassa lakkhaṇam bhavati tatas sattamī hoti gāvīsu duyhamānāsu
translated: The Locative is used in the sense of the Ablative, when the existence of one thing is the characteristic of the existence of another. When cows are burning

original: gato, duddhāsu āgato. Bhāvoti kiṃ? Yo jaṭāhi so bhuñjati. Bhāvalakkhaṇanti kiṃ? Yo
analyzed: gataḥ duddhāsu āgataḥ bhāvo ti kim yaḥ jaṭāhi saḥ bhuñjati bhāva lakkhaṇanti kim yaḥ
translated: “What is the characteristic of the state?🔽He who eats is Devadatta” .

original: bhuñjati so devadatto, “akāle vassati tassa, tāle tassa na vassatī”ti visayasattamī.
analyzed: bhuñjati saḥ devadattaḥ akāle vassati tassa tāle tassa na vassati iti visaya sattamī
translated: “It rains out of season for him, it does not rain on his palm” .

original: 35. Chaṭṭhī cānādare.
analyzed: chaṭṭhī ca an ādare
translated: And the sixth case is used in the sense of disregard.

original: Yassa bhāvo bhāvantarassa lakkhaṇaṃ bhavati, tato chaṭṭhī bhavati sattamī ca anādare
analyzed: yassa bhāvaḥ bhāvantarassa lakkhaṇam bhavati tatas chaṭṭhī bhavati sattamī ca anādare
translated: When disregard is intended, the sixth case is used and also the seventh:🔽“He goes striking with the king Sivirāja looking on” ,

original: gamyamāne. “Ākoṭayanto so neti, sivirājassa pekkhato”, “maccu gacchati ādāya, pekkhamāne mahājane”.
analyzed: gamyamāne ākoṭayantaḥ saḥ na iti sivi rājassa pekkhataḥ maccu gacchati ādāya pekkhamāne mahājane
translated: “Death goes taking with the great crowd looking on” .

original: Gunnaṃ sāmīti sambandhe chaṭṭhī, gosu sāmīti visayasattamī, evaṃ gunnamissaro, gosvissaro,
analyzed: sāmi iti sambandhe chaṭṭhī gosu sāmi iti visaya sattamī evam
translated: “Master of cattle” is the sixth case in the sense of relation; “master of cows” is the seventh case in the sense of domain. So too: “Ruler of cattle” , “ruler of cows” ,

original: gunnaṃ adhipati, gosu adhipati, gunnaṃ dāyādo, gosu dāhādo, dunnaṃ sakkhi, gosu sakkhi,
analyzed: gunnam adhipati gosu adhipati gunnam dāyādaḥ gosu dāha ādaḥ dunnam sakkhi gosu sakkhi
translated: “lord of cattle” , “lord of cows” , “heir of cattle” , “heir of cows” , “witness for cattle” , “witness for cows” ,

original: gunnaṃ patibhū, gosu patibhū, gunnaṃ pasūto, gosu pasūto, kusalā naccagītassa, kusalā
analyzed: gunnam patibhū gosu patibhū gunnam pasūtaḥ gosu pasūtaḥ kusalā nacca gītassa kusalā
translated: “counterpart of cattle” , “counterpart of cows” , “begetter of cattle” , “begetter of cows” , “skilled in dancing and singing” , “skilled in dancing and singing” ,

original: naccagīte, āyutto kaṭakaraṇassa, āyutto kaṭakaraṇeti.
analyzed: nacca gīte āyuttaḥ kaṭa karaṇassa āyuttaḥ kaṭa karaṇa iti
translated: “engaged in making a bracelet” , “engaged in making a bracelet” .

original: Tathādhāravacanicchāyaṃ sattamī, bhikkhūsu abhivādenti, muddhani dhumbitvā, bāhāsu
analyzed: tathā ādhāra vacanicchāyam sattamī bhikkhūsu abhivādenti muddhani dhumbitvā bāhāsu
translated: In the desire to speak thus, the seventh case; they salute the monks, having bowed down their heads and raised their arms,

original: gahetvā, hatthesu piṇḍāya caranti, pathesu gacchanti, kadalīsu gaje rakkhantīti.
analyzed: gahetvā hatthesu piṇḍāya caranti pathesu gacchanti kadalīsu gaje rakkhanti iti
translated: Likewise in the desire to express the meaning of the container, the locative is used in such passages as “They pay homage to the bhikkhus, having bowed down their heads, having taken them by the hands, they walk for alms in the streets, they go on the paths, they guard the elephants in the banana groves.”

original: Ñāṇasmiṃ pasannoti visayasattamī, ñāṇena pasannoti karaṇe tatiyā, evaṃ ñāṇasmiṃ ussukko ñāṇena ussukkoti.
analyzed: ñāṇasmim pasanno ti visaya sattamī ñāṇena pasanno ti karaṇe tatiyā evam ñāṇasmim ussukkaḥ ñāṇena ussukkoti
translated: “He is pleased with knowledge” is the locative of the object; “he is pleased with knowledge” is the instrumental. Likewise “he is eager for knowledge” is the locative, “he is eager with knowledge” is the instrumental.

original: 36. Yato niddhāraṇaṃ.
analyzed: yatas niddhāraṇam
translated: . The source of the extraction.

original: Jātiguṇakiriyāhi samudāyatekadesassa puthakkaraṇaṃ niddhāraṇaṃ. Yato taṃ karīyati,🔽tato chaṭṭhīsattamiyo honti. Sālayo sūkadhaññānaṃ pathyatamā, sālayo sūkadhaññesu🔽pathyatamā, kaṇhā gāvīnaṃ sampannakhīratamā, kaṇhā gāvīsu sampannakhīratamā, gacchataṃ
analyzed: jāti guṇa kiriyāhi puthakkaraṇam niddhāraṇam yatas tam  tatas chaṭṭhī sattamiyaḥ honti sālayaḥ sūka dhaññānam pathyatamā sālayaḥ sūka dhaññesu  pathyatamā kaṇhā gāvīnam sampanna khīratamā kaṇhā gāvīsu sampanna khīratamā gacchatam
translated: The extraction of a part of a whole by way of its arising, quality, or function is the extraction.

original: dhāvanto sīghatamo, gacchantesu dhāvanto sīghatamo. Sīlameva sutā seyyoti avadhimhiyeva pañcamī.
analyzed: dhāvantaḥ sīghatamaḥ gacchantesu dhāvantaḥ sīghatamaḥ sīlam eva sutā seyyā iti pañcamī
translated: From that source the sixth and seventh cases are formed. “Rice is the most wholesome of the grains” is the locative of the object; “rice is the most wholesome of the grains” is the instrumental. “The black cow is the best milker of cows” is the locative of the object; “the black cow is the best milker of cows” is the instrumental. “Of those who go, the runner is the swiftest” is the locative of the object; “of those who go, the runner is the swiftest” is the instrumental. “Only virtue is the best companion” is the locative of the object only.

original: 37. Paṭhamātthamatte.
analyzed: paṭhama a ttha ma tte
translated: . The first meaning.

original: Nāmassābhidheyyamatte paṭhamāvibhatti hoti. Rukkho. Itthi pumā napuṃsakanti liṅgampi
analyzed: nāmassa abhidheyya matte paṭhamā vibhatti hoti rukkhaḥ itthi pumā napuṃsakam ti liṅgam pi
translated: The first case-ending is that of the mere name of a noun. Tree. Woman. Man. Neuter. Gender is

original: saddatthova, tathā doṇo khārī āḷhakanti parimāṇampi saddatthova, eko dve bahavoti
analyzed: tathā doṇo khārī āḷhakanti parimāṇam pi ekaḥ dve bahavaḥ ti
translated: also the meaning of a word. So too: a doṇa, a khāri, a āḷhaka. Measure is also the meaning of a word. One, two, many.

original: saṅkhyāpi saddatthova.
analyzed: saṅkhyā api saddattha uva
translated: Number is also the meaning of a word.

original: 38. Āmantaṇe.
analyzed: āmantaṇe
translated: . The vocative case.

original: Sato saddenābhimukhīkaraṇamāmantaṇaṃ. Tasmiṃ visaye paṭhamā vibhatti hoti. Bhopurisa, bhokkatthi, bho napuṃsaka.
analyzed: sato saddena abhimukhīkaraṇam āmantaṇam tasmin visaye paṭhamā vibhatti hoti bho purisa bhokkatthi bho napuṃsaka
translated: The vocative case is the making of someone face oneself by means of a word. The first case-ending is used in this sense. Master man, master woman, master neuter.

original: 39. Chaṭṭhī sambandhe.
analyzed: chaṭṭhī sambandhe
translated: . The sixth case-ending is used for the relation.

original: Kiriyākārakasañjāto assedambhāvahetuko sambandho nāma. Tasmiṃ chaṭṭhī vibhatti hoti.
analyzed: kiriyā kāraka sañjātaḥ assa idambhāva hetukaḥ sambandhaḥ nāma tasmim chaṭṭhī vibhatti hoti
translated: The relation is called the state of being a means to the occurrence of an end. The sixth case-ending is used in this sense.

original: Rañño puriso, sarati rajjassāti sambandhe chaṭṭhī, rajjasambandhiniṃ satiṃ karotīti
analyzed: raññaḥ purisaḥ sarati rajjassa ati sambandhe chaṭṭhī rajja sambandhinim satim karoti iti
translated: The king’s man. He remembers the kingdom. In the sense of relation the sixth case-ending is used. The meaning is: he makes his memory related to the kingdom.

original: attho, kammavacanicchārantu dutiyāva sarati rajjaṃ. Tathā rajakassa vatthaṃ dadāti,
analyzed: sarati rajjam tathā rajakassa vattham dadāti
translated: But in the second case-ending, which is used for the object of a verb, the meaning is: he remembers the kingdom. So too: he gives cloth to the dyer,

original: paharato piṭṭhiṃ dadāti, bālo pūrati pāpassa, amacce tāta jānāhi, dhīre atthassa
analyzed: paharataḥ piṭṭhim dadāti bālo pūrati pāpassa amacce tāta jānāhi dhīre atthassa
translated: he gives his back to the striker, the fool fills up evil, know the wise, dear sir, in a matter, the fool is not fit to be a counsellor, the fool is not fit to be a friend, the fool is not fit to be a companion, the fool is not fit to be a companion on a journey, the fool is not fit to be a relative, the fool is not fit to be a blood-relation, the fool is not fit to be a friend, the fool is not fit to be a companion, the fool is not fit to be a companion on a journey, the fool is not fit to be a relative, the fool is not fit to be a blood-relation, the fool is not fit to be a friend, the fool is not fit to be a companion, the fool is not fit to be a companion on a journey, the fool is not fit to be a relative, the fool is not fit to be a blood-relation, the fool is not fit to be a friend, the fool is not fit to be a companion, the fool is not fit to be a companion on a journey, the fool is not fit to be a relative, the fool is not fit to be a blood-relation, the fool is not fit to be a friend, the fool is not fit to

original: kovide, divasassa tikkhattuṃ, sakiṃ pakkhassa, pūraṃ hiraññasuvaṇṇassa kumbhantvevamādi.🔽Kitakappayoge kaktukammesu bahulaṃ sambandhavacanicchāyaṃ chaṭṭhī, sādhu sammato
analyzed: kovide divasassa tikkhattum sakim pakkhassa pūram hirañña suvaṇṇassa  kita kappa yoge kaktu kammesu bahulam sambandha vacanicchāyam chaṭṭhī sādhu sammataḥ
translated: and three times a day, once a fortnight, a jar full of gold coin, and so on.

original: bahujanassa, suppaṭividdhā buddhānaṃ dhammadhātu, dhammassa gutto medhāvī, amataṃ
analyzed: bahu janassa su paṭividdhā buddhānam dhammadhātu dhammassa guttaḥ medhāvī amatam
translated: In the case of the use of the word kitaka, in the case of the word kaktuka, and in the case of the frequent use of the word sambandha, the locative is used in the sense of the dative: in the case of many people, in the case of the well-penetrated Dhamma nature of the Buddhas, in the case of the guarded Dhamma, in the case of the wise, in the case of the deathless,

original: tesaṃ paribhuttaṃ, tassa bhavanti vattāro, avisaṃvādako lokassa, alajjīnaṃ nissāya,
analyzed: tesam paribhuttam tassa bhavanti vattāraḥ a visaṃvādakaḥ lokassa a lajjīnam nissāya
translated: in the case of what is enjoyed by them, in the case of those who say this, in the case of the non-deception of the world, in the case of the shameless,

original: catunnaṃ mahābhūtānaṃ upādāya pasādotvevamādi.
analyzed: upādāya
translated: in the case of the four great entities, in the case of the clear-sighted, and so on.

original: Kattukammavacanicchāyantu tatiyā dutiyāyo ca, sañcatto pitarā ahaṃ, sarasi tvaṃ evarūpiṃ vācaṃ bhāsitā, bhagavantaṃ dassanāyatvevamādi.
analyzed: tatiyā ca ca pitarā aham sarasi tvam evarūpim vācam bhāsitā bhagavantam dassanāya tu evamādi
translated: But in the case of the sense of the word kattukamma, the locative is used in the sense of the accusative and the dative: I was appointed by my father, you remember such speech as this, in the case of seeing the Blessed One, and so on.

original: 40. Tulyatthena vā tatiyā.
analyzed: tulya tthena vā tatiyā
translated: . Or the locative is used in the sense of the accusative.

original: Tulyatthena yoge chaṭṭhī hoti tatiyā vā, tulyo pitu, tulyo pitarā, sadiso pitu, sadiso
analyzed: tulya tthena yoge chaṭṭhī hoti tatiyā vā tulyaḥ pitu tulyaḥ pitarā sadisaḥ pitu sadisaḥ
translated: The locative is used in the sense of the accusative or the dative when there is a sense of equality: equal to the father, equal with the father, similar to the father, similar with the father,

original: pitarā, iha kathaṃ tatiyā na hoti? Ajjunassa tulā natthi, kesavassupamā na ceti,
analyzed: pitarā iha katham tatiyā na hoti ajjunassa tulā natthi kesa vassu pamā na ca iti
translated: How is it not so in the third case? Ajjunassa tulā natthi, kesavassupamā na ceti,

original: nete tulyatthā, kiñjarahi tulyānamopammatthā.
analyzed: na ite tulya tthā
translated: These have the same meaning, but in the case of the equal, the meaning of the simile is different.

original: 41. Ato yonaṃ ṭāṭe.
analyzed: a taḥ ya ūnam ṭa ā ṭe
translated: . After yonaṃ ṭāṭe.

original: Akāranthato nāmasmā yonaṃ ṭāṭe honti yathākkamaṃ, ṭakārā sabbadesatthā, buddhā buddhe, atoti kiṃ? Kaññāyo, itthiyo, vadhuyo, idha kasmā na bhavati aggayo. Avidhānasāmatthiyā.
analyzed: nāmasmā yonam ṭā ṭe honti yathākkamam ṭakārā sabba desa atthāḥ buddhāḥ buddhe kasmā na bhavati a vidhāna sāmatthiyā
translated: After a word ending in a vowel, ṭāṭe are optionally added, in the respective order. ṭakārā sabbadesatthā, buddhā buddhe, atoti kiṃ? Kaññāyo, itthiyo, vadhuyo, idha kasmā na bhavati aggayo. Avidhānasāmatthiyā.

original: 42. Ninaṃ vā.
analyzed: ninam vā
translated: . Ninaṃ vā.

original: Akārantato nāmasmā ninaṃ ṭāṭe vā honti yathākkamaṃ. Rūpā, rūpe, rūpāni, atotveva aṭṭhīni.
analyzed: akāra antataḥ ṭāṭe vā honti yathākkamam rūpā rūpe rūpāni
translated: After a word ending in a vowel, ninaṃ ṭāṭe are optionally added, in the respective order. Rūpā, rūpe, rūpāni, atotveva aṭṭhīni.

original: 43. Smāsmiṃnaṃ.
analyzed: sma asmiṃnam
translated: . Smāsminnaṃ.

original: Akārantato nāmasmā smāsminnaṃ ṭāṭe vā honti yathākkamaṃ. Buddhā buddhasmā, buddhe buddhasmiṃ, atotveva aggismā aggismiṃ.
analyzed: akāra antataḥ ṭāṭe vā honti yathākkamam buddhā buddhe buddhasmin aggismin
translated: After a word ending in a vowel, smāsminnaṃ ṭāṭe are optionally added, in the respective order. Buddhā buddhasmā, buddhe buddhasmiṃ, atotveva aggismā aggismiṃ.

original: 44. Sassāya catutthiyā.
analyzed: sassāya catutthiyā
translated: . Sassāya catutthiyā.

original: Akārantato parassa sassa catutthiyā āyo hoti vā. Buddhāya buddhassa, bhiyyo tādatthyeyevāyamāyo
analyzed: akāra antataḥ parassa sassa catutthiyā āyaḥ hoti vā buddhāya buddhassa bhiyyaḥ
translated: After a word ending in a vowel, āyo is optionally added to the fourth case of the following word. Buddhāya buddhassa, bhiyyo tādatthyeyevāyamāyo

original: dissate, kvacidevaññattha, atotveva isissa, catutthiyāti kiṃ? Buddhassa mukhaṃ, attatthanti
analyzed: dissate isissa catutthiyā ati kim buddhassa mukham attatthanti
translated: is seen, in some places in some other way, even though not, only, of the fourth case? Buddha’s face, for one’s own benefit.

original: atthasaddena samāso.
analyzed: attha saddena samāsaḥ
translated: The compound is with the meaning of “benefit.”

original: Sabbāditopi smāsmiṃsānaṃ ṭāṭeāyā honteva… niruttikārānumatattā buddhavacane sandassanavato🔽ca, tatrodamudāharaṇaṃ ‘asmā lokā paramhā ca, ubhayā dhaṃsate naro’, ‘tyāhaṃ mante
analyzed: sabba āditaḥ pi sma asmiṃsānam ṭāṭeāyāḥ hontā iva nirutti kāra anumata ttā buddha vacane sandassanavataḥ  ca tatra udam udāharaṇam ca ubhayā mante
translated: In this genitive case, the forms of the words beginning with sabba are as follows: … because of the approval of the grammarians, and because of the occurrence of sandhi in the Buddha’s words.

original: paratthaddho’, ‘yāyeva kho panatthāya āgaccheyyātho tamevatthaṃ sādhukaṃ manasikareyyātho’ti.
analyzed: paratthaddhaḥ yāyā iva kho panatthāyaḥ āgaccheyya atho tam evattham sādhukam manasikareyyāthoti
translated: Here is an example: ‘A man is burned by both this world and the next,’ ‘I am devoted to the recitation of the mantras for the benefit of others,’ ‘You should pay proper attention to the very purpose for which you have come.’

original: 45. Ghapatekasmiṃ nādīnaṃ yayā.
analyzed: ghapata ikasmin na adīnam yayā
translated: . In a genitive with a single word, by the feminine.

original: Ghapato nādīnamekasmiṃ yayā honi yathākkamaṃ. Kaññāya, rattiyā, itthiyā, dhenuyā, vadhuyā, ekasminti kiṃ? Kaññāhi, rattīhi.
analyzed: gha pataḥ na ādīnam ekasmin yayā honi yathākkamam kaññāya rattiyā itthiyā dhenuyā vadhuyā ekasmin ti kim kaññāhi rattīhi
translated: In a genitive with a single word, by the feminine, the forms are as follows: of a girl, of a night, of a woman, of a cow, of a bride. In a single: what? of girls, of nights.

original: 46. Ssā vā tetimāmūhi.
analyzed: vā
translated: . Or by the feminine in the words beginning with te, taṃ, and ā.

original: Ghapasaññehi tetimāmūhi nādīnamekasmiṃssā vā hoti, tassā kataṃ, tassā dīyate, tassā
analyzed: gha pa saññehi na ādīnam ekasmin sā vā hoti tassā katam tassā dīyate tassā
translated: In a genitive with a single word, by the feminine, the forms are as follows: done by her, given to her, her.

original: nissaṭaṃ, tassā pariggaho, tassā patiṭṭhitaṃ, tāya vā, evaṃ etissā etāya, imissā
analyzed: nissaṭam tassā pariggahaḥ tassā patiṭṭhitam tāya vai evam etissa etāya imissā
translated: is detached, his possession, his support, by it, thus by this, by this one,

original: imāya, amussā amuyā, etehīti kiṃ? Sabbāya, nādīnaṃ tveva? Sā, ghapatotveva? Tāhi amūhi.
analyzed: imāya amussā amuyā etehi iti kim sabbāya tu eva sā amūhi
translated: by this one, by that one, by that one, by these, what? by all, but not of the endings? that, of the householder, just? by those, by those.

original: 47. Naṃmhi nuka dvādīnaṃ sattarasannaṃ.
analyzed: nam mhi nu ka dva ādīnam sattara san nam
translated: . Naṃmhi nuka of the twelve, of the seventeen.

original: Dvādīnaṃ sattarasannaṃ saṅkhyānaṃ nuka hoti naṃmhi vibhattamhi, dvinnaṃ catunnaṃ,
analyzed: dvi ādīnam sattarasannam saṅkhyānam hoti namhi vibhattamhi dvinnam catunnam
translated: Nuka is in the instrumental case of the twelve, of the seventeen, of the two, of the four,

original: pañcannaṃ, evaṃ yāva aṭṭhārasannaṃ, ukāro uccāraṇattho, kakāro antāvayavattho, tena naṃmhi na dīgho.
analyzed: evam yāva aṭṭhārasannam ukāraḥ uccāraṇa attho kakāraḥ anta avayava attho tena naṃ mhi na dīghaḥ
translated: of the five, and so on up to of the eighteen. The letter u is for the purpose of pronunciation, the letter k is for the purpose of the final part. Therefore in the instrumental case the long vowel does not occur.

original: 48. Basukatinnaṃ.
analyzed: basuka tinnam
translated: . Basukatinnaṃ.

original: Naṃmhi bahuno katissa ca nuka hoti, bahunnaṃ, katinnaṃ.
analyzed: namhi bahunaḥ katissa ca nuka hoti bahunnam katinnam
translated: Nuka is in the instrumental case of the many, of the made. Of the many, of the made.

original: 49. Ṇṇaṃṇṇannaṃ tito jhā.
analyzed: ṇ ṇ ṇ ṇ naṃ t itaḥ jhā
translated: . Ṇṇaṃṇṇannaṃ tito jhā.

original: Jhasaññā tito naṃvacanassa ṇṇaṃṇṇannaṃ hoti, tiṇṇaṃ, tiṇṇannaṃ, jhāti kiṃ tissannaṃ.
analyzed: jha saññā ti taḥ naṃ vacanassa hoti tiṇṇam tiṇṇannam jhā ti kim tissannam
translated: Tito is in the instrumental case of the three, of the three, of the seven, of the seven. Of the three, of the three, of the seven, of the seven. By jhā what? of the three.

original: 50. Ubhinnaṃ.
analyzed: ubhinnam
translated: . Ubhinnaṃ.

original: Ubhā naṃvacanassa innaṃ hoti, ubhinnaṃ.
analyzed: ubhā naṃvacanassa innam hoti
translated: Inna is in the instrumental case of the two. Of the two.

original: 51. Suña sassa.
analyzed: suña sassa
translated: . Suña sassa.🔽. Suñña sassa.

original: Nāmasmā sassa suña hoti, buddhassa, dvisakārapāṭhena siddhe lāghavatthamidaṃ.
analyzed: hoti buddhassa dvi sakāra pāṭhena siddhe lāghava attham idam
translated: The feminine of this is suñña. The Buddha has said this in two ways. This is a light way of saying it.

original: 52. Ssaṃssāssāyesvitare kaññebhimānami.
analyzed: ssa ssa ssa āye su itare kañña ibhi mānami
translated: . Ssaṃssāssāyesvitare kaññebhimānami.

original: Ssamādīsvitarādīnami hoti, itarissaṃ, itarissā, ekissaṃ, ekissā, aññissaṃ, aññissā,
analyzed: s s s m ādīsu itara ādi hoti itarissam itarissā ekissam ekissā aññissam aññissā
translated: Ssamādīsvitarādīnami hoti, itarissaṃ, itarissā, ekissaṃ, ekissā, aññissaṃ, aññissā,

original: etissaṃ, etissā, etissāya, imissaṃ, imissā, imissāya, esviti kiṃ? Itarāya, esanti
analyzed: etissam etissāḥ etissāya imissam imissāḥ imissāya esu iti kim itarāya esanti
translated: etissaṃ, etissā, etissāya, imissaṃ, imissā, imissāya, esviti kiṃ? Itarāya, esanti

original: kiṃ? Sabbassaṃ, sabbassā.
analyzed: kim sabbassam sabbassā
translated: kiṃ? Sabbassaṃ, sabbassā.

original: 53. Tāya vā.
analyzed: tāya vā
translated: . Tāya vā.

original: Ssamādīsu tassā vā i hoti, tissaṃ tassaṃ, tissā tassā, tissāya tassāya, ssaṃssāssāyesvitveva? Tāya.
analyzed: tassāḥ vai i hoti tissam tassam tissā tassā tissāya tassāya tāya
translated: Ssamādīsu tassā vā i hoti, tissaṃ tassaṃ, tissā tassā, tissāya tassāya, ssaṃssāssāyesvitveva? Tāya.

original: 54. Tetimāto sassa ssāya.
analyzed: teti mā taḥ sassa ssāya
translated: . Tetimāto sassa ssāya.

original: Tāetāimāto sassa ssāyo hoti vā. Tassāya tāya, etissāya etāya, imissāya imāya.
analyzed: sassa ssāyaḥ hoti vā tassāya tāya etissāya etāya imissāya imāya
translated: Tāetāimāto sassa ssāyo hoti vā. Tassāya tāya, etissāya etāya, imissāya imāya.

original: 55. Ratyādīhi ṭo smino.
analyzed: rati ādi hi ṭaḥ sminaḥ
translated: . Ratyādīhi ṭo smino.

original: Ratyādīhi smino ṭo hoti vā, ratto rattiyaṃ, ādo ādismiṃ.
analyzed: rati ādīhi sminaḥ ṭaḥ hoti vā ratto rattiyam ādaḥ ādismin
translated: Ratyādīhi smino ṭo hoti vā, ratto rattiyaṃ, ādo ādismiṃ.

original: 56. Suhisubhasso.
analyzed: suhi subhasso
translated: . Suhisubhasso.

original: Ubhassa suhisvo hoti. Ubhosu, ubhohi.
analyzed: ubhassa su hisvaḥ hoti ubhosu ubhohi
translated: Ubhassa suhisvo hoti. Ubhosu, ubhohi.

original: 57. Ltupitādinamā simhi.
analyzed: l tup ita ādi namā simhi
translated: . Ltupitādinamā simhi.

original: Ltuppaccayantānaṃ pitādīnaṃ ca ā hoti simhi. Kattā, pitā. Pitu, mātu, bhāvu, mītu, duhitu, jāmātu, nattu, hotu, potu.
analyzed: ltup paccaya antānam pitā ādīnam ca ā hoti simhi kattā pitā pitu mātu bhāvu mītu duhitu jāmātu nattu hotu potu
translated: The Genitive ending is ā, and the Instrumental ending is hi, in the case of father, etc., who are the cause of one’s birth.

original: 58. Ge a ca.
analyzed: ge a ca
translated: The nominative ending is ge and the vocative ending is ā.

original: Ltupitādīnaṃ a hoti ge ā ca, bho katta, bho kattā, bho pita, bho pitā.
analyzed: ltu pita ādīnam a hoti ge ā ca bho katta bho kattā bho pita bho pitā
translated: The Genitive ending is a, and the Instrumental ending is ge ā, in the case of father, etc.

original: 59. Ayunaṃ vā dīgho.
analyzed: ayunam vā dīghaḥ
translated: The nominative ending is ayunaṃ vā dīgho .🔽The nominative ending is a i u iccesaṃ vā dīgho hoti ge pare tiliṅge .🔽The nominative ending is gha brahmādite .🔽The nominative ending is ghato brahmādito ca gasse vā hoti .

original: A i u iccesaṃ vā dīgho hoti ge pare tiliṅge. Bho purisā, bho purisa, bho aggī, bho aggi, bho bhikkhū, bho bhikkhū.
analyzed: a i u iti ca īsam vā dīghaḥ hoti ge pare ti liṅge bho purisā bho purisa bho aggī bho aggi bho bhikkhū bho bhikkhū
translated: The nominative ending is bhoti kaññe .

original: 60. Ghabrahmādite.
analyzed: gha brahma ādite
translated: The nominative ending is bhoti kaññā .🔽The nominative ending is bho brahme .🔽The nominative ending is bho brahma .🔽The nominative ending is bho khatte .

original: Ghato brahmādito ca gasse vā hoti. Bhoti kaññe, bhoti kaññā, bho brahme, bho brahma,
analyzed: gha taḥ brahma āditaḥ ca gasse vā hoti bhoti kaññe bhoti kaññā bho brahme bho brahma
translated: The nominative ending is bho khatta .🔽The nominative ending is bho ise .🔽The nominative ending is bho isi .🔽The nominative ending is bho sakhe .🔽The nominative ending is bho sakha .

original: bho khatte, bho khatta, bho ise, bho isi, bho sakhe, bho sakha. Sakhi sakhīti itthiyaṃ
analyzed: bho khatte bho khatta bho ise bho isi bho sakhe bho sakha sakhi sakhi iti itthiyam
translated: The nominative ending is sakhi sakhīti itthiyaṃ .

original: siddhameva. Ākatigaṇo-yaṃ, evamaññatrāpi.
analyzed: siddham eva evam aññatra api
translated: The nominative ending is siddhameva .

original: 61. Nammādīhi.
analyzed: namma ādīhi
translated: The nominative ending is nammādīhi .🔽The nominative ending is ammādīhi gasse na hoti .

original: Ammādīhi gasse na hoti. Bhoti ammā, bhoti annā, bhoti ambā.🔽62. Rasso vā.
analyzed: amma ādīhi gasse na hoti bhoti ammā bhoti annā bhoti ambā 🔽rassaḥ vā
translated: The nominative ending is bhoti ammā .🔽The nominative ending is bhoti annā .🔽The nominative ending is bhoti ambā .

original: Ammādīnaṃ ge rasso hoti vā. Bhoti amma, bhoti ammā.
analyzed: amma ādīnam ge rassaḥ hoti vā bhoti amma bhoti ammā
translated: The vowel of ammā, etc., is short before a vowel. Amma, ammā.

original: 63. Gho ssaṃ, ssā, ssāyaṃ tiṃsu.
analyzed: gho ssam ssā ssāyam tiṃsu
translated: . Gho is the thirty-first.

original: Ssamādīsu gho rasso hoti. Tassaṃ, tassā, tassāya, taṃ, sabhatiṃ, esviti kiṃ? Tāya, sabhāya.
analyzed: rassaḥ hoti tassam tassā tassāya tam sabhatim esu iti kim tāya sabhāya
translated: The vowel of gho is short in the three genders. Tassam, tassā, tassāya, tam, sabhatim. Esviti kiṃ? Tāya, sabhāya.

original: 64. Ekavacana yosva-ghonaṃ.
analyzed: ekavacana yaḥ sva ghonam
translated: . In the singular, in yosu, and in gha.

original: Ekavacane yosu ca ghaokārantavajjitā naṃ nāmānaṃ rasso hoti tiliṅge. Itthiṃ, itthiyā,
analyzed: ekavacane yosu ca gha okāra anta vat jitāḥ nam nāmānam rassaḥ hoti ti liṅge itthim itthiyā
translated: In the singular, and in yosu, the vowel of the names is short, except in the case of gha, in all genders. Itthiṃ, itthiyā,

original: itthiyo, vadhuṃ vadhuyā, vadhuyo, daṇḍiṃ, daṇḍinā, daṇḍino, sayambhuṃ, sayambhunā,
analyzed: itthiyaḥ vadhum vadhuyā vadhuyaḥ daṇḍim daṇḍinā daṇḍinaḥ sayambhum sayambhunā
translated: itthiyā, vadhuṃ, vadhuyā, vadhuyo, daṇḍiṃ, daṇḍinā, daṇḍino, sayambhuṃ, sayambhunā,

original: sayambhuvo, agho nanti kiṃ? Kaññāya, kaññāyo, oggahaṇamuttaratthaṃ.
analyzed: sayambhuvaḥ aghaḥ nanti kim
translated: sayambhuvo, agho nanti kiṃ? Kaññāya, kaññāyo, oggahaṇamuttaratthaṃ.

original: 65. Ge vā.
analyzed: ge vā
translated: . Or ge.

original: Aghonaṃ ge vā rasso hoti tiliṅge, itthi, itthī, vadhu, vadhū, daṇḍi, daṇḍī, sayambhu, sayambhū. Aghonaṃtveva? Bhoti kaññā, bho go.
analyzed: aghonam ge vā rassaḥ hoti tiliṅge itthi itthī vadhu vadhū daṇḍi daṇḍī sayambhu sayambhū aghonam tu eva bhoti kaññā bho go
translated: The vowel of the names is short, or ge, in all genders, except in the case of gha. Itthi, itthī, vadhu, vadhū, daṇḍi, daṇḍī, sayambhu, sayambhū. Aghonaṃtveva? Bhoti kaññā, bho go.

original: 66. Sismiṃ nānapuṃsakassa.
analyzed: si smim nā napuṃsakassa
translated: . In sis, in the neuter.🔽. In the neuter, the vowel of the names is short in sis.

original: Napuṃsakavajjitassa nāmassa sismiṃ rasso na hoti. Itthī, daṇḍī, vadhū, sayambhū. Sisminti kiṃ? Itthiṃ, anapuṃsakassāti kiṃ? Daṇḍi kulaṃ.🔽67. Gossāgasihinaṃsu gāvagavā.
analyzed: napuṃsaka vajjitassa nāmassa sismim rassaḥ na hoti itthī daṇḍī vadhū sayambhū sisminti kim itthim a napuṃsakassa ati kim daṇḍi kulaṃ  gossāgasihinaṃsu gāvagavā
translated: In the nominative case of a noun ending in a vowel, the vowel is not lengthened. Woman, staff-bearer, bride, self-existent. In the nominative case: what? Woman, not a neuter noun. Staff-bearer, family.

original: Gasihinaṃvajjitāsu vibhattīsu gosaddassa gāvagavā honti. (Gāvaṃ, gavaṃ), gāvo, gavo,
analyzed: gasi hi naṃ vajjitāsu vibhattīsu go saddassa gāvagavāḥ honti gāvam gavam gāvaḥ gavaḥ
translated: . In the locative and ablative cases, the word go has the forms gāva and gavā. (Gāvaṃ, gavā), gāvo, gavo,

original: gāvena, gavena, gāvassa, gavassa, gāvasmā, gavasmā, gāve, gave. Agasihinaṃsūti kiṃ?
analyzed: gāvena gavena gāvassa gavassa gāvasmai gavasmai gāve gave agasi hinaṃsu iti kim
translated: gāvena, gavena, gāvassa, gavassa, gāvasmā, gavasmā, gāve, gave. In the locative and ablative cases: what?

original: Bho go, go tiṭṭhati, gohi, gonaṃ.
analyzed: bho go go tiṭṭhati gohi gonam
translated: Sir, cow, stand, with cows, of cows.

original: 68. Sumhi vā.
analyzed: sumhi vā
translated: . Or in the locative.

original: Gossa sumhi gāvagavā honti vā. Gāvesu, gavesu, gosu.
analyzed: gossa sumhi gāvagavā honti vā gāvesu gavesu gosu
translated: The word go has the forms gāva and gavā in the locative case. In the cows, in the cows, in the cows.

original: 69. Gavaṃ sena.
analyzed: gavam sena
translated: . Gavam in the instrumental.

original: Gossa se vā gavaṃ hoti saha sena. Gavaṃ, gāvassa, gavassa.
analyzed: gossa se vā gavam hoti saha sena gavam gāvassa gavassa
translated: The word go has the form gavam in the instrumental case together with the word sena. Gavam, of the cow, of the cow.

original: 70. Gunnaṃ ca naṃnā.
analyzed: gun nam ca naṃ nā
translated: . And gunnaṃ in the genitive.

original: Naṃvacanena saha gossa gunnaṃ hoti gavaṃca vā. Gunnaṃ, gavaṃ, gonaṃ.
analyzed: naṃvacanena saha gossa gunnam hoti gavaṃ ca vā gunnam gavam gonam
translated: By the word naṃ, the word go has the form gunnaṃ together with the word naṃ, and also the form gavam. Of the cows, of the cow, of the cows.

original: 71. Nāssā.
analyzed: na assā
translated: . Nāssa ā.

original: Goto nāssa ā hoti vā. Gāvā, gavā, gāvena, gavena.
analyzed: gotaḥ na asse ā hoti vā gāvā gavā gāvena gavena
translated: The word go has the form nāssa ā, and also the form gāvā, gavā, gāvena, gavena.

original: 72. Gāvumhi.
analyzed: gāvumhi
translated: . Gāvumhi.

original: Aṃvacane gossa gāvha vā hoti. Vāvhaṃ, gāvaṃ, gavaṃ. Gossa goṇādeso na kato… saddantarattā.
analyzed: aṃvacane gossa gāvha vā hoti vāvham gāvam gavam gossa go ṇa ādesaḥ na kataḥ
translated: In the locative case, the genitive singular ending -ssa becomes -vā or -vha. The genitive singular ending -ssa is not made in gossa, goṇādeso na kato, because of the proximity of the vowel.

original: 73. Yaṃ pīto.
analyzed: yam
translated: . Yaṃ pīto.

original: Pasaññīto aṃvacanassa yaṃ vā hoti. Itthiyaṃ, itthiṃ. Pītoti kiṃ? Daṇḍiṃ, rattiṃ.
analyzed: pa saññi itaḥ aṃ vacanassa yam vā hoti itthiyam itthim daṇḍim rattim
translated: In the locative case, the genitive singular ending -ssa becomes -yaṃ or -vā. Itthiyaṃ, itthiṃ. Pītoti kiṃ? Daṇḍiṃ, rattiṃ.

original: 74. Naṃ jhīto.
analyzed: nam jhī to
translated: . Naṃ jhīto.

original: Jhasaññīto aṃvacanassa naṃ vā hoti. Daṇḍinaṃ, daṇḍiṃ. Kathaṃ ‘buddhaṃ ādiccabandhuna’nti? Yogavibhāvā. Jhāti kiṃ? Itthiṃ. Īti kiṃ? Aggiṃ.
analyzed: jha saññi itaḥ aṃ vacanassa nam vā hoti daṇḍinam daṇḍim katham buddham yoga vibhāvā yoga vibhāvā
translated: In the locative case, the genitive singular ending -ssa becomes -naṃ or -vā. Daṇḍinaṃ, daṇḍiṃ. Kathaṃ ‘buddhaṃ ādiccabandhuna’nti? Yogavibhāvā. Jhāti kiṃ? Itthiṃ. Īti kiṃ? Aggiṃ.

original: 75. Yonaṃ none pume.
analyzed: yonam na ūne pume
translated: . Yonaṃ none pume.

original: Jhīto yonaṃ none vā honti yathākkamaṃ pulliṅge. Daṇḍīno, daṇḍine, daṇḍī, jhīto tveva? Itthiyo, pumeti kiṃ? Daṇḍīni kulāni.
analyzed: yonam none vā honti yathākkamam pulliṅge daṇḍīnaḥ daṇḍine daṇḍī tu eva itthiyaḥ pumā iti kim daṇḍīni kulāni
translated: In the locative case, the genitive singular ending -ssa becomes -yo or -no respectively in the masculine and feminine. Daṇḍīno, daṇḍine, daṇḍī, jhīto tveva? Itthiyo, pumeti kiṃ? Daṇḍīni kulāni.

analyzed: no

original: Jhīto yonaṃ no vā hoti pulliṅge. Daṇḍino tiṭṭhanti, daṇḍino passa, daṇḍī vā.
analyzed: no vā hoti pulliṅge daṇḍino tiṭṭhanti daṇḍino daṇḍī vā
translated: In the locative case, the genitive singular ending -ssa becomes -no in the masculine. Daṇḍino tiṭṭhanti, daṇḍino passa, daṇḍī vā.

original: 77. Smino ni.
analyzed: sminaḥ ni
translated: . Smino ni.

original: Jhīto smiṃvacanassa ni hoti vā, daṇḍini, daṇḍismiṃ, jhīto tveva? Aggismiṃ.
analyzed: smiṃvacanassa ni hoti vā daṇḍini daṇḍismin jhītaḥ tu eva aggismin
translated: In the locative case, the genitive singular ending -ssa becomes -ni in the masculine. Daṇḍini, daṇḍismiṃ, jhīto tveva? Aggismiṃ.

original: 78. Ambvādīhi.
analyzed: ambu ādīhi
translated: . Ambvādīhi.

original: Ambuādīhi sminoni hoti vā, phalaṃ patati ambuni, pupphaṃ yathā paṃsuni ātape kataṃ, vātveva? Ambumhi, paṃsumhi.
analyzed: ambu ādīhi vā phalam patati ambuni puppham yathā paṃsuni ātape katam ambumhi paṃsumhi
translated: The fruit falls into the mango-tree, as the flower falls into the dust in the sun, just as by the wind? In the mango-tree, in the dust.

original: 79. Kammādito.
analyzed: kamma āditaḥ
translated: . After kammādi.

original: Kammādito smino ni hoti vā. Kammani kamme. Kamma, camma, vesma, bhasma (asma), brahma, atta, ātuma, ghamma, muddha. Kammāditoti kiṃ? Buddhe.
analyzed: kamma āditaḥ hoti vā kammani kamme kamma camma vesma bhasma asma brahma atta ātuma ghamma kamma āditaḥ iti kim buddhe
translated: After kammādi ni is optionally used. In the work, in the deed. Kammādi means: kammani, kammanā, cammani, cammanā, kammāditotveva means: buddhena.

original: 80. Nāsseno.
analyzed: nāsseno
translated: . After nāssena.

original: Kammādito nāvacanassa eno vā hoti. Kammena, kammanā, cammena, cammanā, kammāditotveva? Buddhena.
analyzed: kamma āditaḥ na a vacanassa enaḥ vā hoti kammena kammanā cammena cammanā kamma āditaḥ tu eva buddhena
translated: After nāssena eno is optionally used after kammādi. Kammena, kammanā, cammena, cammanā, kammāditotveva means: buddhena.

original: 81. Jhalā sassa no.
analyzed: jha lā sassa naḥ
translated: . After jhalā sassa no.

original: Jhalato sassa no vā hoti. Aggino aggissa, daṇḍino daṇḍissa, bhikkhuno bhikkhussa, sayambhuno sayambhussa,
analyzed: jha l ataḥ sassa naḥ vā hoti agginaḥ aggissa daṇḍinaḥ daṇḍissa bhikkhunaḥ bhikkhussa sayambhunaḥ sayambhussa
translated: After jhalā sassa no is optionally used. Of the fire, of the fire-god, of the stick, of the stick-holder, of the monk, of the monk, of the self-existent, of the self-existent,

original: Kathaṃ ‘yo ca sisso mahāmune’ ti? (3) “Ito kvaci sassa ṭānubandho”ti brahmādīsu pāṭhā sassa e ṭānubandho.
analyzed: katham yaḥ ca sissaḥ mahā mune ti itas kvaci sassa ṭa anubandho ti brahma ādīsu pāṭhā sassa e ṭa anubandho
translated: How is it that ‘the disciple of the Great Sage’? “Sassa ṭānubandho” is the reading in the case of Brahmā, etc. Sassa e ṭānubandho.

original: 82. Nā smāssa.
analyzed: na sma assa
translated: . Not after smāssa.🔽.

original: Jhalato smāssa nā hoti vā. Agginā aggismā, daṇḍinā daṇḍismā, bhikkhunā bhikkhusmā, sayambhunā sayambhusmā.
analyzed: jha lataḥ sma assa nā hoti vā agginā aggismā daṇḍinā daṇḍismā bhikkhunā bhikkhusmā sayambhunā sayambhusmā
translated: But not in the sense of “from the fire” or “from the stick” or “from the monk” or “from the self-existent one.”

original: 83. Lā yo naṃ vo pume.
analyzed: lā yaḥ nam vaḥ pume
translated: . Lā is in the sense of “men” for you.

original: Lato yonaṃ vo hoti vā pulliṅge. Bhikkhavo bhikkhū, sayambhuvo sayambhūpumeti kiṃ? Āyūni.
analyzed: lataḥ yonam vaḥ hoti vā pulliṅge bhikkhavaḥ bhikkhū āyūni
translated: . Lā is in the sense of “men” for you in the masculine. Bhikkhavo bhikkhū, sayambhuvo sayambhūpumeti kiṃ? Āyūni.

original: 84. Jantvādito no ca.
analyzed: jantu āditaḥ na u ca
translated: . Jantvādito no ca.

original: Jantvādito yonaṃ no hoti vo ca vā pulliṅge. Jantuno, jantavo jantuyo, gotrabhuno, gotrabhuvo gotrabhū. Sahabhuno, sahabhuvo sahabhū.
analyzed: jantu āditaḥ no ca vā pulliṅge jantunaḥ jantavaḥ gotrabhunaḥ gotrabhuvaḥ gotrabhū sahabhunaḥ sahabhuvaḥ sahabhū
translated: . Jantvādito is not in the sense of “men” for you in the masculine or for you in the neuter. Jantuno, jantavo jantuyo, gotrabhuno, gotrabhuvo gotrabhū. Sahabhuno, sahabhuvo sahabhū.

original: 85. Kūto.
analyzed: kūto
translated: . Kūto.

original: Kūpaccayantato yonaṃ no vā hoti pulliṅge, viduno vidū, viññuno viññū, sabbaññuno sabbaññū.
analyzed: kūpa ccaya antataḥ yonam naḥ vā hoti pulliṅge vidunaḥ vidū viññunaḥ viññū sabbaññunaḥ sabbaññū
translated: . Kūpaccayantato is not in the sense of “men” for you in the masculine. Viduno vidū, viññuno viññū, sabbaññuno sabbaññū.

original: 86. Dhalāpo-musmā.
analyzed: dha lāpaḥ mus mā
translated: . Dhalāpo-musmā.

original: Amusaddato yonaṃ lopova hoti pulliṅge, amū, pumetveva? Amuyo amūni. Vopavādoyaṃ.
analyzed: pul liṅge amū pum etvā iva amūni
translated: . Amusaddato is in the sense of “men” for you in the masculine. Amū, in the masculine only? Amuyo amūni. Vopavādoyaṃ.

original: 87. Na no sassa.
analyzed: na naḥ sassa
translated: . Na no sassa.

original: Amusmā sassa no na hoti, amussa, noti kiṃ? Amuyā.
analyzed: amusmā sassa no na hoti amussa no ti kim amuyā
translated: . Amusmā sassa is not in the sense of “men” for you in the neuter. Amussa, noti kiṃ? Amuyā.

original: 88. Yolopanisu dīgho.
analyzed: yaḥ lopa nisu dīghaḥ
translated: . Yolopanisu dīgho.

original: Yonaṃ lope nisu ca dīgho hoti, aṭṭhī aṭṭhīni, yolopanisūti kiṃ? Rattiyo.🔽89. Sunaṃhisu.
analyzed: yo nam lope nisu ca dīghaḥ hoti aṭṭhī aṭṭhīni yo lopa nisū ti kim  sunaṃhisu
translated: In the case of the past part. part. of the verb lopeti, and in the case of the word dīgho, the form is aṭṭhī, aṭṭhīni, yolopanisū. What is the meaning of yolopanisū? It means rattiyo.

original: Esu nāmassa dīgho hoti. Aggīsu, aggīnaṃ, aggīhi.
analyzed: esu nāmassa dīghaḥ hoti aggīsu aggīnam aggīhi
translated: . In the case of the words agnī, aggīnaṃ, aggīhi, the form is sunaṃhisu.

original: 90. Pañcādīnaṃ cuddasannama.
analyzed: pañca ādīnam cud dasan nama
translated: . In the case of the words pañca, etc., up to cuddasa, the form is aṃsu.🔽In the case of the words pañca, etc., up to cuddasa, the form is aṃsu. Pañcasu, pañcannaṃ, pañcahi, chasu, channaṃ, chahi, evaṃ yāva aṭṭharasā.

original: Pañcādīnaṃ cuddasannaṃ sunaṃhisva hoti. Pañcasu, pañcannaṃ, pañcahi, chasu, channaṃ, chahi, evaṃ yāva aṭṭharasā.🔽91. Yvādo ntussa.
analyzed: pañca ādīnam hoti pañcasu pañcannam pañcahi chasu channam chahi evam yāva aṭṭharasā  y v ādaḥ n tus sa
translated: . In the case of the words yvā, etc., the form is a.

original: Yvādīsu ntussa a hoti. Guṇavantā, guṇavantaṃ, guṇavante, guṇavantena iccādi, yvā-doti kiṃ? Guṇavā tiṭṭhati.
analyzed: yu ādīsu n tussa a hoti guṇavantā guṇavantam guṇavante guṇavantena iccādi yu ādo ti kim guṇavā tiṭṭhati
translated: In the case of the words yvā, etc., the form is a. Guṇavantā, guṇavantaṃ, guṇavante, guṇavantena iccādi. What is the meaning of yvādo? Guṇavā tiṭṭhati.

original: 92. Ntassa ca ṭa vaṃse.
analyzed: n tassa ca ṭa va ṃse
translated: . In the case of the words aṃsa, etc., the form is ṭa vaṃsa.

original: Aṃsesu ntappaccayassa ṭa hoti vā ntussa ca. Yaṃ yaṃ hi rāja bhajati santaṃvāyadi
analyzed: aṃsesu n ta paccayassa ṭa hoti vā n tussa ca yam yam hi rāja bhajati santam vā yadi
translated: In the case of the words aṃsa, etc., the form is ṭa vaṃsa. Yaṃ yaṃ hi rāja bhajati santaṃvāyadi

original: vā asaṃ, kiccā-nakubbassa kareyya kiccaṃ, himavaṃva pabbataṃ, sujātimantopi ajātimassa.
analyzed: vā asam kiccā anakubbassa kareyya kiccam himavant va pabbatam su jātimantaḥ api a jātimassa
translated: vā asaṃ, kiccā-nakubbassa kareyya kiccaṃ, himavaṃva pabbataṃ, sujātimantopi ajātimassa.

original: Yogavibhāgenāññatrāpi. Cakkhumā andhitā honti, vaggumudātīriyā pana bhikkhū vaṇṇavā honti.
analyzed: yoga vibhāgena aññatra api cakkhumā andhitāḥ honti vaggumudātīriyāḥ pana bhikkhū vaṇṇavā honti
translated: By the method of analysis, elsewhere also: Cakkhumā andhitā honti, vaggumudātīriyā pana bhikkhū vaṇṇavā honti.

original: 93. Yosu jhissa pume.
analyzed: yosu jhissa pume
translated: In yosu, jhissa, pume.

original: Jhasaññassa issa yosu vā ṭa hoti pulliṅge. Aggayo aggī, jhaggahaṇaṃ kiṃ? Ikārantasamudāyassa ṭa mā siyābhi, rattiyo, iggahaṇaṃ kiṃ? Daṇḍino, pumeti kiṃ? Aṭṭhīni.
analyzed: jha saññassa i ssa yosu vā ṭa hoti pul liṅge aggayaḥ aggī jha ggahaṇam kim ikāra anta samudāyassa ṭa mā siyā abhi i k gahaṇam kim daṇḍinaḥ pumā iti kim aṭṭhīni
translated: In jhasa, issa, yosu, ṭa is optionally substituted for u in the masculine. Aggayo, aggī; why is the word jhagga used? To show that the substitution of ṭa is not for the whole compound ending in i, but for the final syllable only. Rattiyo; why is the word iggahaṇa used? To show that the substitution of ṭa is not for the whole compound ending in i, but for the final syllable only. Daṇḍino; why is the word pumeti used? Aṭṭhīni.

original: 94. Vevosu lussa.
analyzed: ve vosu lussa
translated: In vevosu, lussa.

original: Lasaññassa ussa vevosu ṭa hoti. Bhikkhave, bhikkhavo, vevosūti kiṃ? Jantuyo, uggahaṇaṃ kiṃ? Sayambhuvo.
analyzed: la saññassa ussa ve vosu ṭa hoti bhikkhave bhikkhavaḥ kim uggahaṇam kim
translated: In lasa, ussa, vevosu, ṭa is optionally substituted for u. Bhikkhave, bhikkhavo; why is the word vevosū used? Jantuyo; why is the word uggahaṇa used? Sayambhuvo.

original: 95. Yomhi vā kvaci.
analyzed: yomhi vā kvaci
translated: In yomhi, vā, kvaci.

original: Yomhi kvaci lasaññassa ussa vā ṭa hoti. Hetayo, nandanti taṃ kurayo dassanena, ajjeva taṃ kurayo pāpayatu. Vāti kiṃ? Hetuyo.
analyzed: kvaci hoti hetayaḥ nandanti tam kurayaḥ dassanena ajjā iva tam kurayaḥ pāpayatu vāti kim
translated: In yomhi, kvaci, lasa, ussa, ṭa is optionally substituted for u. Hetayo, nandanti taṃ kurayo dassanena, ajjeva taṃ kurayo pāpayatu; why is the word vāti used? Hetuyo.

original: 96. Pumālapane vevo.
analyzed: pumān ālapane vevaḥ
translated: In pumālapane, vevo.

original: Lasaññato uto yossālapane vevo honti vā pulliṅge. Bhikkhave, bhikkhavo bhikkhū, pumeti kiṃ āyūni, ālapaneti kiṃ? Jantuyo tiṭṭhanti, lutotveva? Dhenuyo, sayambhuvo.
analyzed: la sañña taḥ u taḥ yossa ālapane vā ivaḥ honti vā pulliṅge bhikkhave bhikkhavaḥ bhikkhū pumā iti kim āyūni ālapanā iti kim jantuyaḥ tiṭṭhanti dhenuyaḥ sayambhuvaḥ
translated: In lasa, uto, yossālapane, vevo is optionally substituted for u in the masculine. Bhikkhave, bhikkhavo bhikkhū; why is the word pumeti used? Āyūni; why is the word ālapane used? Jantuyo tiṭṭhanti; why is the word lutotva used? Dhenuyo, sayambhuvo.

original: 97. Smāhismiṃ naṃ mhābhimhi.
analyzed: sma ahismin nam mha abhimhi
translated: In smāhi, smī, naṃ, mhābhimhi.

original: Nāmasmā paresaṃ smāhisminnaṃ mhā bhimhi vā honti yathākkamaṃ. Buddhamhā buddhasmā, buddhebhi buddhehi, buddhamhi buddhasmiṃ, bahulādhikārāapavādavisayepi, dasasahassimhi dhātuyā.🔽98. Suhisvasse.🔽Akārantassa suhisve hoti. Buddhesu buddhehi.🔽99. Sabbādīnaṃ naṃmhīca.🔽Akārantānaṃ sabbādīnaṃ e hoti naṃmhi suhisu ca. Sabbesaṃ, sabbesu, sabbehi, sabbādīnanti🔽kiṃ? Buddhānaṃ, assetveva? Amūsaṃ. Sabba katara katama ubhaya itara añña aññatara🔽aññatama (4) “pubbaparā-varadakkhiṇuttarā-dharāni vavatthāyamasaññāyaṃ” (pā,1,1,34)🔽ya tya ta eta ima amu kiṃ eka tumha amha.🔽100. Saṃsānaṃ.🔽Sabbādito naṃvacanassa saṃsānaṃ honti. Sabbesaṃ, sabbesānaṃ.
analyzed: nāmasmā paresam mhā bhimhi vā honti yathākkamam buddhamhā buddhasmā buddhebhi buddhehi buddhamhi buddhasmin dasa sahassimhi dhātuyā  su hi svasse  a kāra antassa su hi sve hoti buddhesu buddhehi  sabba ādīnam namhi i ca  akāra antānam sabba ādīnam e hoti nam mhi su hi su ca sabbesam sabbesu sabbehi sabba ādīnam ti  kim buddhānam assetvā iva amūsam  aññatama pubba para avara dakkhiṇa uttara adharāni  ya tya te ete ima amu kim eka tumha amha  saṃsānam  sabba āditaḥ naṃ vacanassa saṃsānam honti sabbesam sabbesānam
translated: The forms of the words Buddha, etc., are formed by adding the suffixes -m- and -s- to the words Budha, etc., in the Instrumental and Locative respectively.🔽The Instrumental and Locative forms of the words Suh, etc.,🔽are formed by adding -e to the words Suh, etc., in the Nominative.🔽The forms of the words Sabba, etc., in the Instrumental and Locative Plural,🔽and in the Locative Dual, are formed by adding -e to the words Sabba, etc., in the Nominative.🔽What? The forms of the words Buddha, etc., are formed by adding -aṃ to the words Budha, etc., in the Nominative.🔽The forms of the words Sabba, etc., in the Instrumental and Locative Plural,🔽and in the Locative Dual, are formed by adding -e to the words Sabba, etc., in the Nominative.🔽

original: 101. Ghapā sassa ssā vā.
analyzed: gha pā sassa ssā vā
translated: The forms of the above are formed by adding the following endings in the respective order: mha, mhi, mhi, mhi, mhi, mhi, mhi, mhi, mhi, mhi, mhi, mhi, mhi, mhi, mhi, mhi, mhi, mhi, mhi, mhi, mhi, mhi, mhi, mhi, mhi, mhi, mhi, mhi, mhi, mhi, mhi, mhi, mhi, mhi, mhi, mhi, mhi, mhi, mhi, mhi, mhi, mhi, mhi, mhi, mhi, mhi, mhi, mhi, mhi, mhi, mhi, mhi, mhi, mhi, mhi, mhi, mhi, mhi, mhi, mhi, mhi, mhi, mhi, mhi, mhi, mhi, mhi, mhi, mhi, mhi, mhi, mhi, mhi, mhi, mhi, mhi, mhi, mhi, mhi, mhi, mhi, mhi, mhi, mhi, mhi, mhi, mhi, mhi, mhi, mhi, mhi, mhi, mhi, mhi, mhi, mhi, mhi, mhi, mhi, mhi, mhi, mhi, mhi, mhi, mhi, mhi, mhi, mhi, mhi, mhi, mhi, mhi, mhi, mhi, mhi, mhi, mhi, mhi, mhi, mhi, mhi, mhi, mhi, mhi, mhi, mhi, mhi, mhi, mhi, mhi, mhi, mhi, mhi, mhi, mhi, mhi, mhi, mhi, mhi, mhi, mhi, mhi, mhi, mhi, mhi, mhi, mhi, mhi, mhi, mhi, mhi, mhi, mhi, mhi, mhi, mhi, mhi, mhi, mhi, mhi, mhi, mhi, mhi, mhi, mhi,

original: Sabbādīnaṃ ghapato sassa ssā vā hoti, sabbassā sabbāya, paggahaṇamuttaratthaṃ.🔽102. Smino ssaṃ.
analyzed: sabba ādīnam gha pataḥ sa ssa ssā vā hoti sabba ssā sabbāya paggahaṇam uttara ttham  sminaḥ ssam
translated: The forms sabbassa, sabbāya, etc., are formed by adding the feminine ending -ā to the masculine forms sabbassa, sabbassaṃ, etc.

original: Sabbādīnaṃ ghapato smino ssaṃ vā hoti, sabbassaṃ sabbāya, amussaṃ amuyā.🔽103. Yaṃ.
analyzed: sabba ādīnam gha pataḥ sminaḥ ssam vā hoti sabbassam sabbāya amussam amuyā  yaṃ
translated: The forms sabbassaṃ, sabbāya, etc., are formed by adding the feminine ending -ā to the masculine forms sabbassa, sabbassaṃ, etc.🔽The forms kaññāyaṃ, kaññāya, etc., are formed by adding the feminine ending -ā to the masculine forms kaññassa, kaññassaṃ, etc.

original: Ghapato smino yaṃ vā hoti, kaññāyaṃ kaññāya, rattiyaṃ rattiyā, vadhuyaṃ vadhuyā, sabbāyaṃ sabbāya, amuyaṃ amuyā.🔽104. Tiṃ sabhāparisāya.
analyzed: ghapato sminaḥ yam vā hoti kaññāyam kaññāya rattiyam rattiyā vadhuyam vadhuyā sabbāyam sabbāya amuyam amuyā  tim sabhā parisāya
translated: The forms sabbāyaṃ, sabbāya, etc., are formed by adding the feminine ending -ā to the masculine forms sabbassa, sabbassaṃ, etc.

original: Sabhāparisāhi smino tiṃ vā hoti, sabhatiṃ sabhāya, parisatiṃ parisāya.🔽105. Padādīhi si.
analyzed: sabhā parisāhi tim vā hoti sabhatim sabhāya parisatim parisāya  pada ādi hi si
translated: The forms sabhatiṃ, sabhāya, etc., are formed by adding the feminine ending -ī to the masculine forms sabhassa, sabhassaṃ, etc.

original: Ehi smino si hoti vā, padasi padasmiṃ, bilasi bilasmiṃ.🔽106. Nāssa sā.
analyzed: ehi vā padasi padasmin bilasmin  na assa sā
translated: The forms padasi, padasmiṃ, etc., are formed by adding the feminine ending -ī to the masculine forms padassa, padassaṃ, etc.

original: Padādīhi nāssa sā hoti vā, padasā padena, bilasā bilena.🔽107. Kodhādīhi.🔽Ehi nāssa sā hoti vā, kodhasā kodhena, atthasā atthena.
analyzed: pada ādīhi sā hoti vā padasā padena bilasā bilena  kodha ādīhi  ehi na assa sā hoti vā kodhasā kodhena atthasā atthena
translated: The forms padasā, padena, etc., are formed by adding the feminine ending -ā to the masculine forms padassa, padassaṃ, etc.

original: 108. Atena.
analyzed: a tena
translated: The forms kodhasā, kodhena, etc., are formed by adding the feminine ending -ā to the masculine forms kodhassa, kodhassaṃ, etc.

original: Akārantato parassa nāvacanassa enādeso hoti, buddhena, atoti kiṃ? Agginā.
analyzed: akāra antataḥ parassa nā vacanassa e na ādesaḥ hoti buddhena a taḥ ti kim agginā
translated: The forms buddhena, etc., are formed by adding the masculine ending -ena to the feminine forms buddhāya, etc.

original: 109. Sisso.
analyzed: sisso
translated: The forms sisso, sissa, etc., are formed by adding the masculine ending -o to the feminine forms sissāya, sissāya, etc.

original: Akārantato nāmasmā sissa o hoti, buddho, atotveva? Aggi.
analyzed: akāra antataḥ nāmasmā sissa o hoti buddhaḥ aggi
translated: After a noun ending in a vowel, sissa is o, as in buddho, but not after a, as in aggi.

original: 110. Kvace vā.
analyzed: kva ce vā
translated: . Or kvace.

original: Akārantato nāmasmā sissa e hoti vā kvaci, vanappagumbe yathā phussitagge. Apavādavisayepi bahulaṃvīdhānā-sukhe dukkhe. Vāti kiṃ? Vanappagumbo kvacīti kiṃ? Pakkhe sabbattha mā hotu.
analyzed: akāra antataḥ nāmasmā si ssaḥ e hoti vā kvaci vanappagumbe yathā phussi tagge apavāda visaye pi bahulaṃvīdhāna asukhe dukkhe vāti kim vanappagumbaḥ kvaci iti kim pakkhe sabbattha mā hotu
translated: After a noun ending in a vowel, sissa is e or o, or kvace, as in vanappagumbe, yathā phussitagge. In apavādavisaya, too, bahulaṃ, vīdhānaṃ, sukhe, dukkhe. What is the meaning? Vanappagumbo. What is the meaning of kvace? Let it not be everywhere.

original: 111. Aṃ napuṃsake.
analyzed: am napuṃsake
translated: . Aṃ napuṃsake.

original: Akārantato nāmasmā sissa aṃ hoti napuṃsakaliṅge. Rūpaṃ.
analyzed: akāra antataḥ nāmasmā si ssa aṃ hoti napuṃsaka liṅge rūpam
translated: After a noun ending in a vowel, aṃ is napuṃsaka-gender, as in rūpaṃ.

original: 112. Yonaṃ ni.
analyzed: yonam ni
translated: . Yonaṃ ni.

original: Akārantato nāmasmā yonaṃ ni hoti napuṃsake. Sabbāni rūpāni, niccavidhāne phalaṃ ekaccādisabbādīnaṃ paṭhamāyaṃ.
analyzed: akāra antataḥ nāmasmai yonam ni hoti napuṃsake sabbāni rūpāni nicca vidhāne phalam ekacca ādi sabba ādīnam
translated: After a noun ending in a vowel, ni is napuṃsaka-gender, as in sabbāni rūpāni. In the rule of nicca, the result is in the first case of ekaccādisabbādīnaṃ.

original: 113. Jhalā vā.
analyzed: jha lā vā
translated: . Jhalā vā.

original: Jhalato yonaṃ ni hoti vā napuṃsake, aṭṭhīni aṭṭhī, āyūni āyū.
analyzed: jha lataḥ yonam ni hoti vā napuṃsake aṭṭhīni aṭṭhī āyūni āyū
translated: After jhala, ni is napuṃsaka-gender, or not, as in aṭṭhīni, aṭṭhī, āyūni, āyū.

original: 114. Lopo.
analyzed: lopaḥ
translated: . Lopo.

original: Jhalato yonaṃ lopo hoti, aṭṭhī, āyū, aggī, bhikkhū, jhalātveva? Aggayo. Pageva kasmā na hoti? Antaraṅgattā akārassa.
analyzed: jha lataḥ yonam lopaḥ hoti aṭṭhī āyū aggī bhikkhū pagā iva kasmā na hoti antaraṅga ttā akārassa
translated: After jhala, ni is deleted, as in aṭṭhī, āyū, aggī, bhikkhū. After jhala, too, as in aggayo. Why is it not so in pageva? Because of the internal a.

original: 115. Jantuhetvīghapehi vā.
analyzed: vā
translated: . Jantuhetvīghapehi vā.

original: Jantuhetūhi īkārantehi ghapa saññehi ca paresaṃ yonaṃ vā lopo hoti, jantū jantuyo,
analyzed: jantu hetūhi īkāra antehi ghapa saññehi ca paresam vā lopaḥ hoti jantū jantuyo
translated: The feminine endings in -u and -i, and the feminine of the words for ‘man’ and ‘reason’ drop the -a when they are in apposition to another word: jantuyo, jantū,

original: hetū hetuyo, daṇḍī daṇḍiyo, kaññā kaññāyo, rattī rattiyo, itthī itthiyo, dhenū dhenuyo, vadhū vadhuyo.
analyzed: hetū hetuyaḥ daṇḍī daṇḍiyaḥ kaññā kaññāyaḥ rattī rattiyaḥ itthī itthiyaḥ dhenū dhenuyaḥ vadhū vadhuyaḥ
translated: hetuyo, hetū, daṇḍiyo, daṇḍī, kaññāyo, kaññā, rattīyo, rattī, itthiyo, itthi, dhenuyo, dhenu, vadhuyo, vadhu.

original: 116. Ye passivaṇṇassa.
analyzed: ye passi vaṇṇassa
translated: . Of the feminine ending in -a.

original: Pasaññassa ivaṇṇassa lopo hoti vā yakāre, ratyo ratyā, ratyaṃ, pokkharañño, pokkharaññā,
analyzed: pa saññassa i va ṇṇassa lopaḥ hoti vā yakāre ratyoḥ ratyāḥ ratyam pokkharañño pokkharaññā
translated: The feminine ending in -a drops the -a optionally before the affix -ya: ratyo, ratyā, ratyaṃ, pokkharañño, pokkharaññā,

original: pokkharaññaṃ, vā tveva? Rattiyo, passāti kiṃ? Daṇḍiyo, ivaṇṇassāti kiṃ? Dhenuyo vadhuyo.
analyzed: pokkharaññam vā tveva rattiyo passāti kim daṇḍiyo
translated: pokkharaññaṃ, or rattiyo, what is seen? daṇḍiyo, what is the feminine ending in -a? dhenuyo, vadhuyo.

original: Kathaṃ ‘anuññāto ahaṃ matyā’ti? ‘Ye passā’ti yogavibhāgā.
analyzed: katham anuññātaḥ aham matyā ati ye yogavibhāgā
translated: How is it that ‘I am allowed by the mother’? ‘By the feminine ending in -a’ is the analysis.

original: 117. Gasīnaṃ.
analyzed: gasīnam
translated: . Of the feminine ending in -ī.

original: Nāmasmā gasīnaṃ lopo hoti vijjhantarābhāve, bho purisa, ayaṃ, daṇḍī.
analyzed: lopaḥ hoti vijjhantara abhāve bho purisa ayam daṇḍī
translated: The feminine ending in -ī drops the -ī when there is no vowel sign: bho purisa, ayaṃ, daṇḍī.

original: 118. Asaṅkhyehi sabbāsaṃ.
analyzed: asaṅkhyehi sabbāsam
translated: . Of all the feminine endings in the absence of a number.

original: Avijjamānasaṅkhyehi parāsaṃ sabbāsaṃ vibhattīnaṃ lopo hoti, ca vā eva evaṃ, etasmāyeva liṅgā asaṅkhyehi syādyuppatti anumīyate.
analyzed: a vijjamāna saṅkhyehi parāsam sabbāsam vibhattīnam lopaḥ hoti ca vā eva evam liṅgā asaṅkhyehi anumīyate
translated: The feminine endings drop the -a in the absence of a number: ca vā eva evaṃ, from this very indication the origin of the affix -ī is inferred in the absence of a number.

original: 119. Ekatthatāyaṃ.
analyzed: ekatthatā ayam
translated: . Of the singular.

original: Ekatthībhāve sabbāsaṃ vibhattīnaṃ lopo hoti bahulaṃ, puttīyati, rājapuriso, vāsiṭṭho,
analyzed: ekatthībhāve sabbāsam vibhattīnam lopaḥ hoti bahulam puttīyati rāja purisaḥ vāsiṭṭhaḥ
translated: In the case of the same case-meaning, the elision of all the case-endings is usual, as in puttīyati, rājapuriso, vāsiṭṭho,

original: kvaci na hoti bahulaṃ vidhānā-parantapo, bhagandaro, parassapadaṃ, attanopadaṃ, gavampati,
analyzed: kvaci na hoti bahulam vidhāna aparantapaḥ bhagandaraḥ parassapadam attanopadam gavampati
translated: but it is not usual in some instances, as in vidhānā-parantapo, bhagandaro, parassapadaṃ, attanopadaṃ, gavampati,

original: devānaṃpiyatisso, antevāsī, janesuto mamattaṃ māmako.
analyzed: devānaṃpiya tissaḥ antevāsī janesutaḥ mamattam māmakaḥ
translated: devānaṃpiyatisso, antevāsī, janesuto mamattaṃ māmako.

original: 120. Pubbasmāmādito.
analyzed: pup basma āma āditaḥ
translated: . Before the first and second cases.

original: Amādekatthā pubbaṃ yadekatthaṃ tato parāsaṃ sabbāsaṃ vibhattīnaṃ lopo hoti. Adhitthi. Idha na hoti bahulaṃ
analyzed: amāt ekatthā pubbam yat ekattham tatas parāsam sabbāsam vibhattīnam lopaḥ hoti adhitthi idha na hoti bahulam
translated: When the first and second cases have the same meaning, the elision of all the case-endings after the first is usual, as in adhitthi. Here it is not usual in some instances,

original: Vidhānā yathāpatthīyā, yathāparisāya, pubbasmāti kiṃ? Gāmagato.
analyzed: vidhānā yathāpatthīyā yathāparisāya kim
translated: as in vidhānā yathāpatthīyā, yathāparisāya. “Before the first” is understood. What is the purpose of stating it? Gāmagato.

original: 121. Nātoma pañcamiyā.
analyzed: na atoma pañcamiyā
translated: . Not before the fifth case.

original: Amādekatthā pubbaṃ yadekatthamakārantaṃ, tato parāsaṃ sabbāsaṃ vibhattīnaṃ lopo na hoti, antu, bhavatyapañcamyā, upakumbhaṃ, apañcamiyāti kiṃ? Upakumbhā ānaya.
analyzed: amāt ekatthā pubbam yat ekattham akāra antam tatas parāsam sabbāsam vibhattīnam lopaḥ na hoti bhavati a pañcamyā upakumbham a pañcamiyā iti kim upakumbhau ānaya
translated: When the first and fifth cases have the same meaning, the elision of all the case-endings after the first is not usual, as in antu, bhavatyapañcamyā, upakumbhaṃ. “Not before the fifth” is understood. What is the purpose of stating it? Upakumbhā ānaya.

original: 122. Vā tatiyāsattaminaṃ.
analyzed: vā tatiyā sattaminam
translated: . Or before the third and seventh cases.

original: Amādekatthā pubbaṃ yadekatthamakārantaṃ, tato parāsaṃ tatiyāsatthamīnaṃ vā aṃ hoti, upakumbhena kataṃ, upakumbhaṃ kataṃ, upakumte nidhehi, upakumbhaṃ nidhehi.
analyzed: amāt ekatthā pubbam yat ekattham akāra antam tatas parāsam tatiyā sattha mīnam vā aṃ hoti upa kumbhena katam upa kumbham katam upa kumte nidhehi upa kumbham nidhehi
translated: The instrumental case of the words ending in a is the same as that ending in aṃ, and the locative case of the words ending in e is the same as that ending in ā.

original: 123. Rājasī nāmhi.
analyzed: rājasī
translated: I am not a king.🔽Rājassa is the instrumental case of the words ending in aṃ, and rājassa is the locative case of the words ending in ā.

original: Nāmhi rājassi vā hoti, sabbadattena rājinā, vātveva? Raññā.🔽124. Sunaṃhisū.
analyzed: nāmhi rājassi vā hoti sabba dattena rājinā vā iva raññā  su naṃ hi sū
translated: I am not a king.

original: Rājassa ū hoti vā sunaṃhisu, rājūsu rājesu, rājūnaṃ raññaṃ, rājūhi rājehi.
analyzed: rājassa u hoti vā rājūsu rājesu rājūnam raññam rājūhi rājehi
translated: Rājassa is the instrumental case of the words ending in aṃ, and rājassa is the locative case of the words ending in ā.

original: 125. Imassāditthiyaṃṭe.
analyzed: imassa ā t itthiyaṃṭe
translated: This is the locative case of the words ending in e.

original: Imasaddassānitthiyaṃ ṭe hoti vā sunaṃhisu, esu imesu, esaṃ imesaṃ, esi imehi, anitthiyanti kiṃ? Imāsu, imāsaṃ, imāhi.🔽126. Nāmha nimi.
analyzed: ima saddassa anitthiyam ṭe hoti vā esu imesu esam imesam esi imehi anitthiyanti kim imāsu imāsam imāhi  nāmha nimi
translated: Imasaddassānitthiyaṃ ṭe hoti vā sunaṃhisu, esu imesu, esaṃ imesaṃ, esi imehi, anitthiyanti kiṃ? Imāsu, imāsaṃ, imāhi.

original: Imasaddassānitthiyaṃ nāmhi anaimiiccādesā honti, anena imīnā, anitthiyaṃtveva? Imāya.
analyzed: ima saddassa an itthiyam nāmhi an aimi it ca ādesāḥ honti anena an itthiyam tu eva imāya
translated: Imasaddassānitthiyaṃ nāmhi anaimiiccādesā honti, anena imīnā, anitthiyaṃtveva? Imāya.

original: 127. Simha napuṃsakassāyaṃ.
analyzed: simha napuṃsakassa ayam
translated: Simha napuṃsakassāyaṃ.

original: Imasaddassānapuṃsakassa ayaṃ hoti simhi, ayaṃ puriso, ayaṃ itthī, anapuṃsakassāti kiṃ? Imaṃ.
analyzed: ima saddassa a napuṃsakassa ayam hoti simhi ayam purisaḥ ayam itthī a napuṃsakassa ati kim imaṃ
translated: Imasaddassānapuṃsakassa ayaṃ hoti simhi, ayaṃ puriso, ayaṃ itthī, anapuṃsakassāti kiṃ? Imaṃ.

original: 128. Tyatetānaṃ tassa so.
analyzed: tassa saḥ
translated: 128. Tyetānaṃ tassa so.

original: Tyatetānamanapuṃsakānaṃ tassa so hoti simhi, syo puriso, syā itthī, evaṃ so, sā, eso, esā, anapuṃsakassetveva? Tyaṃ, taṃ, etaṃ.
analyzed: tya t etānam a napuṃsakānam tassa saḥ hoti simhi puriso syāḥ itthī evam saḥ sā esaḥ esā anapuṃsakassa itu eva tyam tam etam
translated: Tyetānamanapuṃsakānaṃ tassa so hoti simhi, syo puriso, syā itthī, evaṃ so, sā, eso, esā, anapuṃsakassetveva? Tyaṃ, taṃ, etaṃ.

original: 129. Massāmussa.
analyzed: massa amussa
translated: . Massāmussa.

original: Anapuṃsakassāmussa makārassa so hoti simhi, asu puriso, asu itthī.
analyzed: a napuṃsakassa amussa makārassa saḥ hoti simhi asu purisaḥ asu itthī
translated: Anapuṃsakassāmussa makārassa so hoti simhi, asu puriso, asu itthī.

original: 130. Ke vā.
analyzed: ke vā
translated: . Ke vā.

original: Amussa massa ke vā so hoti, asuko amuko, asukā amukā, asukaṃ amukaṃ, asukāni amukāni.
analyzed: amussa massa ke vā saḥ hoti asukaḥ amukaḥ asukāḥ amukāḥ asukam amukam asukāni amukāni
translated: Amussa massa ke vā so hoti, asuko amuko, asukā amukā, asukaṃ amukaṃ, asukāni amukāni.

original: 131. Tatassa no tabbāsu.
analyzed: tatassa no tabbāsu
translated: . Tatassa no tabbāsu.

original: Tasaddassa tassa no vā hoti sabbāsu vibhattīsu, ne te nāyo tāyo, naṃ taṃ, nāni tāni iccādi.
analyzed: ta saddassa tassa no vā hoti sabbāsu vibhattīsu ne te nāyo tāyo naṃ tam nāni tāni iccādi
translated: Tasaddassa tassa no vā hoti sabbāsu vibhattīsu, ne te nāyo tāyo, naṃ taṃ, nāni tāni iccādi.

original: 132. Ṭa sasmāsmiṃssāyassaṃssāsaṃmhāmhisvi massa ca.
analyzed: ṭa sa sma asmiṃssa ayas saṃssa asaṃmha amhi svi massa ca
translated: . Ṭa sasmāsmiṃssāyassaṃssāsaṃmhāmhisvi massa ca.

original: Sādīsvimassa tatassa ca ṭo vā hoti, assa imassa, asmā imasmā, asmiṃ imasmiṃ, assāya
analyzed: sa ādi isu imassa tatassa ca ṭaḥ vā hoti assa imassa asmai imasmai asmin imasmin assāya
translated: Sādīsvimassa tatassa ca ṭo vā hoti, assa imassa, asmā imasmā, asmiṃ imasmiṃ, assāya

original: imissāya, assaṃ imissaṃ, assā imissā, āsaṃ imāsaṃ, amhā imamhā, amhi imamhi, assa
analyzed: imissāya assam imissam assā imissā āsam imāsam amhā imamhā amhi imamhi assa
translated: imissāya, assaṃ imissaṃ, assā imissā, āsaṃ imāsaṃ, amhā imamhā, amhi imamhi, assa

original: tassa, asmā tasmā, asmiṃ tasmiṃ, assāya tassāya, assaṃ tassaṃ, assā tassā, āsaṃ tāsaṃ,
analyzed: tassa tasmai asmin tasmin assāya tassāya assam tassam assā tassā āsam tāsam
translated: ‘Tassa’ is from ‘asmā’, ‘Asmiṃ’ is from ‘tasmā’, ‘Assāya’ and ‘tassāya’ are from ‘assu’, ‘Assaṃ’ and ‘tassaṃ’ are from ‘asmiṃ’, ‘Assā’ and ‘tassā’ are from ‘assu’, ‘Āsaṃ’ and ‘tāsaṃ’ are from ‘asmā’.

original: amhā tamhā, amhi tamhi, ssāyādiggahaṇamādesantare mā hotūti.
analyzed: amhi tamhi amhi tamhi ssāya ādi ggahaṇam ādesa antare mā hotu iti
translated: ‘Amhā’ is from ‘tamhā’, ‘Amhi’ is from ‘tamhi’, ‘Ssāyā’ and so on are included in the preceding.

original: 133. Ṭe sissisismā.
analyzed: ṭe sissisismā
translated: . Ṭe sissisismā.

original: Isismā sissa ṭe vā hoti, ‘yo nvajja vinaye kaṅkhaṃ, atthadhammavidū ise’, vātveva? Isi.
analyzed: isismā sissa ṭe vā hoti yaḥ nu ajja vinaye kaṅkham attha dhamma vidū ise
translated: ‘Isismā sissa ṭe vā hoti’ is stated. ‘Yo nvajja vinaye kaṅkhaṃ, atthadhammavidū ise’, vātveva? ‘Isi’.

original: 134. Dutiyassa yossa.
analyzed: dutiyassa yossa
translated: . Dutiyassa yossa.

original: Isismā parassa dutiyāyossa ṭe vā hoti, ‘samaṇe brāhmaṇe vande, sampannacaraṇe ise’, vātveva? Isayo passa, dutiyassāti kiṃ? Isayo tiṭṭhanti.
analyzed: isismā parassa dutiya ayossa ṭe vā hoti samaṇe brāhmaṇe vande sampanna caraṇe ise dutiyassa ati kim isayo tiṭṭhanti
translated: ‘Isismā parassa dutiyāyossa ṭe vā hoti’ is stated. ‘Samaṇe brāhmaṇe vande, sampannacaraṇe ise’, vātveva? ‘Isayo passa’, ‘Dutiyassāti kiṃ? Isayo tiṭṭhanti’.

original: 135. Ekaccādīha to.
analyzed: ekacca ādi iha taḥ
translated: . Ekaccādīha to.

original: Akārantehi ekaccādīhi yonaṃ ṭe hoti, ekacce tiṭṭhanti, ekace passa, atoti kiṃ? Ekaccāyo, evaṃ esa sa paṭhama.
analyzed: akāra antehi ekacca ādīhi yonam ṭe hoti ekacce tiṭṭhanti ekace evam esa sa paṭhama
translated: ‘Akārantehi ekaccādīhi yonaṃ ṭe hoti’ is stated. ‘Ekacce tiṭṭhanti’, ‘Ekace passa’, ‘Atoti kiṃ? Ekaccāyo’, ‘Evaṃ esa sa paṭhama’.

original: 136. Na nissa ṭā.
analyzed: na nis ṭā
translated: . Na nissa ṭā.

original: Ekaccādīhi parassa nissa ṭā na hoti, ekaccāni.
analyzed: ekacca ādīhi parassa nissa ṭā na hoti ekaccāni
translated: ‘Ekaccādīhi parassa nissa ṭā na hoti’ is stated. ‘Ekaccāni’.

original: 137. Sabbādīhī.
analyzed: sabba ādīhī
translated: . Sabbādīhī.

original: Sabbādīhi parassa nissa ṭā na hoti, sabbāni.
analyzed: sabba ādīhi parassa nissa ṭā na hoti sabbāni
translated: ‘Sabbādīhi parassa nissa ṭā na hoti’ is stated. ‘Sabbāni’.

original: 138. Yonameṭa.
analyzed: yaḥ nama iṭa
translated: . Yonameṭa.

original: Akārantehi sabbādīhi yonameṭa hoti, sabbe tiṭṭhanti, sabbe passa, atotveva? Sabbāyo.
analyzed: akāra antehi sabba ādīhi hoti sabbe tiṭṭhanti sabbe passa sabba ayaḥ
translated: With the indeclinables sabba, etc., yon is formed with the affix -eṭ, sabbe tiṭṭhanti = sabbe, sabbe passa = sabbāyo.

original: 139. Nāññaṃ canāmappadhānā.
analyzed: na aññam ca nāma ppadhānā
translated: . Not with any other.

original: Nāmabhūtehī appadhānehi ca sabbādīhi yaṃ vuttaṃ, yañcāññaṃ sabbādikāriyaṃ, taṃ na hoti, te sabbā, te piyasabbā, te atisabbā.
analyzed: appadhānehi ca sabba ādīhi yam vuttam yat ca aññam sabba ādi kāriyam tam na hoti te sabbā te piya sabbā te ati sabbā
translated: Not with any other indeclinables than sabba, etc., is yon formed, nor is any other function of sabba, etc., to be found.

original: 140. Tatiyatthayoge.
analyzed: tatiya ttha yoge
translated: . In the third case.

original: Tatiyatthena yoge sabbādīhi yaṃ vuttaṃ, yañcāññaṃ sabbādi kāriyaṃ, taṃ na hoti, māsena pubbānaṃ māsapubbānaṃ.
analyzed: tatiya tthena yoge sabba ādīhi yam vuttam yat ca aññam sabba ādi kāriyam tam na hoti māsena pubbānam māsa pubbānam
translated: In the third case, not with any other function of sabba, etc., is yon formed, māsena pubbānaṃ = māsapubbānaṃ.

original: 141. Catthasamāse.
analyzed: cattha samāse
translated: . In the fourth compound.

original: Catthasamāsavisaye sabbādīhi yaṃ vuttaṃ, yañcāññaṃ sabbādikāriyaṃ, taṃ na hoti, ikkhiṇuttarapubbānaṃ, samāseti kiṃ? Amusañca tesañca dehi.
analyzed: cattha samāsa visaye sabba ādīhi yam vuttam yat ca aññam sabba ādi kāriyam tam na hoti ikkhiṇ uttarapubbānam samāse ti kim amusam ca tesam ca dehi
translated: In the fourth compound, not with any other function of sabba, etc., is yon formed, ikkhiṇuttarapubbānaṃ = ikkhiṇuttarā.

original: 142. Veṭa.🔽Etthasamāsavisadhaya sabbādīhi yadhassaṭa vutto, tassa vā hoti, pugguttare, pubbuttarā.
analyzed: veṭa  sabba ādīhi vuttaḥ tassa vā hoti pugguttare pubbuttarā
translated: 142. Veṭa.🔽The six, namely, yassa, yassa, yadassa, yadassa, pugguttare, pubbuttarā, are used with all, etc., in the sense of “that” in a compound with a preposition.

original: 143. Pubbādīhi chahī.
analyzed: pubba ādīhi chahī
translated: In the fourth compound, with the indeclinables sabba, etc., the affix -eṭ is formed, pugguttare = pugguttarā.

original: Etehi pubbādīhi chahi savisaye eṭa vā hoti, pubbe pubbā, pare parā, apare aparā, dakkhiṇe dakkhiṇā, uttare uttarā, adhare adharā, chahitikiṃ? Ye.
analyzed: etehi pubba ādīhi chahi sa visaye vā hoti pubbe pubbā pare parāḥ apare aparāḥ dakkhiṇe dakkhiṇāḥ uttare uttarāḥ adhare adharā chahi tikim ye
translated: With these six, beginning with “before,” etc., eṭa is optionally added to the base in the sense of “in front,” etc., as follows: before, in front, in the forepart, in the east, in the north, below, in the south, in the west, in the north-west, in the south-west, in the north-east, in the south-east, in the nadir, in the zenith.

original: 144. Manādīhi smiṃsaṃnāsmānaṃ sisoosāsā.
analyzed: sisoosāsā
translated: . With man, etc., smiṃ, etc., sisoosāsā.

original: Manādīhi smimādīnaṃ sisoosāsā vā honti yathākkamaṃ, manasi manasmiṃ, manaso manassa,
analyzed: mana ādīhi smim ādīnam sisoosāsāḥ vā honti yathākkamam manasi manasmin manasaḥ manassa
translated: With man, etc., smiṃ, etc., sisoosāsā are optionally added, as follows: in the mind, in the mental, of the mental, of the mind,

original: mano manaṃ, manasā manena, manasā manasmā, kathaṃ ‘putto jāto acetaso, hitvā yāti
analyzed: manaḥ manam manasā manena manasā manasmā katham puttaḥ jātaḥ acetasaḥ hitvā yāti
translated: the mind, the mental, by the mind, by the mental, by the mind, from the mind. How is it that ‘the thoughtless son is born, having left, he goes

original: sumedhaso, suddhuttaravāsasā, hemakappanavāsase’ti? Sakattheṇatthā. Manatama tapa
analyzed: sumedhasaḥ suddhuttara vāsasā hema kappana vāsasā iti sakattheṇatthā manatama tapa
translated: the wise one, having put on a pure upper robe, having put on a golden-coloured robe’? In the sense of a vehicle. Manatama tapa

original: teja sira ura vaca oja rajayasa paya (6) “saravayā-yavāsacetā jalāsayākkhayalohapaṭamanesu”.
analyzed: teja sira ura vacaḥ oja rajayasa paya
translated: teja sira ura vaca oja rajayasa paya “saravayā-yavāsacetā jalāsayākkhayalohapaṭamanesu”.

original: 145. Sato saba bhe.
analyzed: sataḥ saba bhe
translated: . With sat, saba bhe.

original: Santhasaddassa saba bhavati bhakāre, sabbhi.
analyzed: santha saddassa saba bhavati bhakāre sap bhi
translated: With the word santha, saba is added when there is the vowel a, as follows: with all.

original: 146. Bhavato vā bhonto gayonāse.
analyzed: bhavataḥ vā bhontaḥ gayonāse
translated: . With bhava, bhonto gayonāse.

original: 153. Himavato vā o.

original: Himavato simhī ntussa o vā hoti, himavanto himavā.
analyzed: himavataḥ simhi ntussa o vā hoti himavantaḥ himavā
translated: The sign of the feminine is added to Himavata, etc., and the sign of the neuter, or the sign of the feminine, is added to the stem.

original: 154. Rājādiyuvāditvā.🔽Rājādīhiyuvādīhi ca sissa ā hoti, rājā, yuvā. Rāja brahma sakha atta ātuma (7) “dhammo
analyzed: rāja ādi yuva ādi tvā  ca sissa ā hoti rājā yuvā rāja brahma sakha atta ātuma dhammo

original: vāññatthe” daḷhadhammā, asma, (8) “imo bhāve” aṇimā, (mahimā, garimā) laghimā, yuva

original: sā suvā maghava puma vattaha.
analyzed: sā suvā maghava puma vattaha
translated: . Of the feminine of the words for “law,” etc.🔽The sign of the feminine is added to the stems ending in a vowel, and the sign of the neuter is added to the stems ending in a consonant.

original: 155. Vāmhānaṅa.
analyzed: vām ha anaṅa
translated: . Of the feminine of the words for “small,” etc.🔽The sign of the feminine is added to the stems ending in a vowel, and the sign of the neuter is added to the stems ending in a consonant.

original: Rājādīnaṃ yuvādīnaṃ ca ānaṅa hoti vā aṃmhi, rājānaṃ rājaṃ, yuvānaṃ yuvaṃ.🔽156. Yonamāno.
analyzed: rāja ādīnam yuva ādīnam ca vā rājānam rājam yuvānam yuvam  yonamānaḥ
