original: honti na vattamāne tatra… kriyātipatyasambhavā, sace paṭhamavaye pabbajjaṃ alabhissā
analyzed: honti na vattamāne tatra kriyā atipati asambhavā sace paṭhama vaye pabbajjam
translated: if she had obtained the going-forth in the first stage of life,

original: arahā abhavissā, dakkhiṇena ce agamissā na sakaṭaṃ pariyā bhavissā, dakkhiṇena ce
analyzed: arahā abhavissāḥ dakkhiṇena ce agamissāḥ na sakaṭam pariyā bhavissāḥ dakkhiṇena ce
translated: if I had gone by the right, the cart would not have been overturned, if they had gone by the right,

original: agamissaṃsu, agamisse agamissatha, agamissaṃ agamissāmhā, agamissatha agamissiṃsu,
analyzed: agamissaṃsu agamisse agamissatha agamissam agamissāmhāḥ agamissatha agamissiṃsu
translated: they would have gone, they would have gone, we would have gone, they would have gone,

original: agamissase agamissavhe, agamissiṃ agamissāmhase, na sakaṭaṃ pariyābhavissā, vātikiṃ?
analyzed: agamissase agamissavhe agamissim agamissāmhase na sakaṭam pariyābhavissāḥ vātikim
translated: you would have gone, you all would have gone, I would have gone, we would have gone, it would not have been overturned, what?

original: Dakkhiṇe na ce gamissati na sakaṭaṃ pariyā bhavissati.
analyzed: dakkhiṇe na ce gamissati na sakaṭam pariyā bhavissati
translated: If it had not gone by the right, it would not have been overturned.

original: 8. Hetuphalesveyya eyyuṃ eyyāsi eyyātha eyyāmi eyyāma etha eraṃ etho eyyavho eyyaṃ eyyāmhe.
analyzed: hetu phalesu eyya eyyum eyyāsi eyyātha eyyāma etha eram etho eyyavhaḥ eyyam eyyāmhe
translated: In the case of the cause and the fruit, the forms eyyuṃ, eyyāsi, eyyātha, eyyāmi, eyyāma, etha, eraṃ, etho, eyyavho, eyyaṃ, eyyāmhe,

original: Hetubhūtāyaṃ elabhūtāyañca kriyāyaṃ vattamānato kriyatthā eyyādayo vā honti, sace
analyzed: hetu bhūtā ayam elā bhūtā ayam ca kriyā ayam vattamānataḥ eyyādayaḥ vā honti sace
translated: are used in the present tense because of the action in the present tense which is the cause or the fruit, if

original: saṅkhārā niccā bhaveyyuṃ na nirujjheyyuṃ, dakkhiṇena ce gaccheyya na sakaṭaṃ pariyābhaveyya,
analyzed: saṅkhārāḥ niccāḥ bhaveyyum na nirujjheyyum dakkhiṇena ce gaccheyya na sakaṭam pariyābhaveyya
translated: if they were permanent they would not cease, if he were to go by the right, the cart would not be overturned,

original: dakkhiṇena ce gaccheyyuṃ, gaccheyyāsi gaccheyyātha, gaccheyyāmi gaccheyyāma, gacchetha
analyzed: dakkhiṇena ce gaccheyyum gaccheyyāsi gaccheyyātha gaccheyyāmi gaccheyyāma gacchetha
translated: If they were to go by the south, you would go, you would go, you would go, I would go, we would go,

original: gaccheraṃ, gacchetho gaccheyyavho, gaccheyyaṃ gaccheyyāmhe, na sakaṭaṃ pariyyābhaveyya,
analyzed: gaccheram gacchethaḥ gaccheyyavhaḥ gaccheyyam gaccheyya amhe na sakaṭam pariyyābhaveyya
translated: you would go, you would go, you would go, we would go, the cart would not go round,

original: bhavanaṃ gamanaṃ ca hetu, anirujjhanaṃ apariyābhavanaṃ ca phalaṃ, iha kasmā na hoti
analyzed: bhavanam gamanam ca hetu a nirujjhanam a pariyābhavanam ca phalam iha kasmai na
translated: the going to the house is the cause, the not stopping, the not going round, is the fruit. Why is it not so here?

original: ‘hantīhi palāyati, vassatīti dhāvati, hanissatīti palāyissatī’ti? Iti saddeneva hetuhetumantatāya
analyzed: hanti ihi palāyati vassati iti dhāvati hanissati iti palāyissati iti iti saddena iva hetu hetumanta tāya
translated: ‘He kills, he runs away, it rains, he runs away, he will kill, he will run away.’ Thus it is because of the mere sound, the cause and the causal relation,

original: jotitattā, vāti kiṃ? Dakkhiṇena ce gamissati na sakaṭaṃ pariyābhavissati.
analyzed: jotita ttā vāti kim dakkhiṇena ce gamissati na sakaṭam pariyābhavissati
translated: being shown, what is it? If he were to go by the south, the cart would not go round.

original: 9. Pañhapatthanāvidhīsu.🔽Pañho=sampucchanaṃ sampadhāraṇaṃ nirūpaṇaṃ kāriyānicchayanaṃ patthanā=yācanaṃ iṭṭhāsiṃ
analyzed: pañha patthanā vidhīsu  pañhosampucchanam sampadhāraṇam nirūpaṇam kāriyā nicchayanam patthanā yācanam
translated: . In the rules for the asking of questions.🔽A question = an enquiry, a request, a definition, a consideration, an inquiry. A request = a request, a desire,

original: bhanañca, vidhi=vidhānaṃ niyojanaṃ kriyāsu byāpāraṇā, sā ca duvidhāva sādarānādaravasena…
analyzed: vidhi vidhānam niyojanam kriyāsu byāpāraṇā sā ca sādara anādara vasena
translated: a wish. A rule = a rule, an injunction, an application in actions. And that is of two kinds, with respect, and without respect.

original: visayabhedena bhinnāyapi tadubhayānativattanato, etesu pañhādīsu kriyatthato eyyodayo
analyzed: visaya bhedena tad ubhaya an ativattanataḥ etesu pañha ādīsu
translated: although it is divided by the difference of the object, because it does not go beyond those two, in these questions, etc., the gerund is used in the sense of action.

original: honti, pañhe - kimāyasmā vinayaṃ pariyāpuṇeyya? Udāhu dhammaṃ, gaccheyyaṃ vāhaṃ uposathaṃ🔽na vā gaccheyyaṃ, patthanāyaṃ-labheyyā-haṃ bhante bhagavato santike pabbajjaṃ labheyyaṃ
analyzed: honti pañhe kim āyasmai vinayam pariyāpuṇeyya udāhu dhammam gaccheyyam vā aham uposatham  na vā gaccheyyam patthanāyaṃlabheyya aham bhante bhagavatoḥ santike pabbajjam labheyyam
translated: In questions: “Which would the venerable one learn, the Vinaya or the Dhamma?” “I would go to the Uposatha,

original: upasampadaṃ, passeyyaṃ taṃ vassasataṃ arogaṃ, vidhimhi-bhavaṃ pattaṃ paceyya, bhavaṃ
analyzed: upasampadam passeyyam tam vassa satam arogam vidhimhibhavam pattam paceyya bhavam
translated: or I would not go,” “In my aspiration, reverend Sir, I would receive the going-forth in the presence of the Fortunate One, I would receive the higher ordination,” “I would see him healthy for a hundred years,” “In the method, reverend Sir, you would cook the almsfood,”

original: puññaṃ kareyya, iha bhavaṃ bhuñjeyya, iha bhavaṃ nisīdeyya, māṇavakaṃ bhavaṃ ajjhāpeyya,
analyzed: puññam kareyya iha bhavam bhuñjeyya iha bhavam nisīdeyya māṇavakam bhavam ajjhāpeyya
translated: “You would make merit,” “You would eat here, reverend Sir,” “You would sit down here, reverend Sir,” “You would make the young man study,”

original: anuññāpattakālesupi siddhāva… tatthāpi vidhippatītito, anuññāyaṃ-evaṃ kareyyāsi,
analyzed: anuññā āpatta kālesu pi tattha api vidhi patītitaḥ anuññāyam evam kareyyāsi
translated: even at the time of the permission it is established, but there also it is by the method of the gerund, in the permission: “You would do it in this way,”

original: pattakāle-kaṭaṃ kareyyāsi, patto te kālo kaṭakaraṇe, yadi saṅghassa pattakallaṃ saṅgho
analyzed: patta kālekaṭam kareyyāsi patto te kālaḥ kaṭa karaṇe yadi saṅghassa patta kallam saṅgho
translated: at the time of the permission: “You would make the bowl,” “It is the right time for you to make the bowl,” “If it seems right to the Saṅgha, the Saṅgha

original: uposathaṃ kareyya, etassa bhagavā kālo etassa sugata kālo yaṃ bhagavā sāvakānaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ
analyzed: uposatham kareyya etassa bhagavā kālaḥ etassa sugata kālaḥ yam bhagavā sāvakānam sikkhāpadam
translated: would perform the Uposatha,” “This is the right time, Fortunate One, this is the right time, Happy One, for the Fortunate One to lay down a training rule for disciples,

original: paññapeyya, pesanepicchanti ‘gāmaṃ tvaṃ bhaṇe gaccheyyāsi’.
analyzed: paññapeyya gāmam tvam bhaṇe gaccheyyāsi
translated: if he should send (someone), they would say, ‘You go to the village, Sir.’

original: 10. Tu antu hi tha mi ma taṃ antaṃ ssu vho e āmase.🔽Pañhādīsvete honti kriyatthato. Gacchatu gacchantu, gacchāhi gacchatha, gacchāmi
analyzed: tu antu hi tha mi ma tam antam  pañha ādīsu ete honti gacchatu gacchantu gacchāhi gacchatha gacchāmi
translated: . Tu antu hi tha mi ma taṃ antaṃ ssu vho e āmase.

original: gacchāma, gacchataṃ gacchantaṃ, gacchassu gacchavho, gacche, gacchāmase, pañhe-kinnu
analyzed: gacchāma gacchatam gacchantam gacchassu gacchavhaḥ gacche gacchāmase pañhe kila nu
translated: These are used in the sense of action: Let him go, let them go, go you, go you all, I go, we go, let them go, let him go, let him go, let them go, let us go, let us go. In the question ‘What?’

original: khalu bho byākaraṇamadhīyassu, patthanāyaṃ-dadāhi me, jīvatu bhavaṃ, vidhimhi-kaṭaṃ🔽karotu bhavaṃ, puññaṃ karotu bhavaṃ, iha bhavaṃ bhuñjatu, iha bhavaṃ nisīdatu, uddisatu
analyzed: khalu bho byākaraṇam adhīyassu me jīvatu bhavam  karotu bhavam puññam karotu bhavam iha bhavam bhuñjatu iha bhavam nisīdatu uddisatu
translated: ‘You should learn the explanation, Sir,’ in the wish ‘Give to me,’ in the life ‘May the Lord live,’ in the method ‘The Lord should make,’

original: bhante bhagavā bhikkhūnaṃ pātimokkhaṃ, pesane-gaccha bhaṇe gāmaṃ, anumatiyaṃ - evaṃ
analyzed: bhante bhagavā bhikkhūnam pātimokkham pesane gaccha bhaṇe gāmam anumatiyam evam
translated: ‘The Lord should make merit,’ here the Lord should eat, here the Lord should sit, in the recitation ‘The Lord should recite the Pāṭimokkha to the monks,’ in the sending ‘Go to the village, Sir,’ in the permission ‘Do it like this,’

original: karohi, pattakāle-kālo-yaṃ te mahāvīra uppajja mātukucchiyaṃ.
analyzed: karohi te mahāvīra uppajja mātukucchiyam
translated: in the time ‘The time has come, Great Hero, for you to be conceived in your mother’s womb.’

original: 11. Satyarahesveyyādī.
analyzed: satya rahesveyyādī
translated: . Satyarahesveyyādī.

original: Sattiyaṃ ara hatthe ca kriyatthā eyyādayo honti. Bhavaṃ khalu rajjaṃ kareyya, bhavaṃ satto araho.
analyzed: sattiyam hatthe ca honti bhavam khalu rajjam kareyya bhavam sattaḥ araho
translated: The words ara, hattha, kriya, attha, eyyā, etc., are used in the sense of ‘ought’. ‘Bhavaṃ’ means ‘he ought to rule the kingdom’, ‘Bhavaṃ’ means ‘he ought to be a man’.

original: 12. Sambhāvane vā.🔽Sambhāvane gamyamāne dhātunā vuccamāne ca eyyādayo honti vibhāsā. Api pabbataṃ sirasā🔽bhindeyya, kriyātipattiyantu ssādī-asaniyāpi hato nāpatissā, sambhāvemi saddahāmi
analyzed: sambhāvane vā  sambhāvane gamyamāne dhātunā vuccamāne ca eyya ādayaḥ honti vibhāsāḥ api pabbatam sirasā  bhindeyya hataḥ sambhāvemi saddahāmi
translated: . In the sense of ‘respect’.

original: avakappemi bhuñjeyya bhavaṃ bhuñjissati bhavaṃ abhuñji bhavaṃ, kriyātipattiyantu🔽ssādī-sambhāvemi nābhuñjissā bhavaṃ.
analyzed: avakappemi bhuñjeyya bhavam bhuñjissati bhavam abhuñji bhavam kriyā atipattiyantu  na abhuñjissā bhavam
translated: The words eyyā, etc., are used in the sense of ‘respect’ when the verb is in the future tense and in the optative mood. ‘Api pabbataṃ sirasā bhindeyya’, ‘He ought to split the mountain with his head’. ‘Kriyātipattiyantu ssādī’, ‘He ought not to be killed by lightning’. ‘Sambhāvemi’, ‘I respect’, ‘I believe’, ‘I approve’. ‘Bhuñjeyya bhavaṃ’, ‘You ought to eat’, ‘Bhuñjissati bhavaṃ’, ‘You will eat’, ‘Abhuñji bhavaṃ’, ‘You have eaten’. ‘Kriyātipattiyantu ssādī’, ‘You ought not to eat’.

original: 13. Māyoge īāādī.🔽Mā yoge sati īādayo āādayo ca vā honti. Mā su punapi evarūpamakāsi, mā bhavaṃ agamā
analyzed: mā yoge ī ā ādī  mā yoge sati ī ādayaḥ ā ādayaḥ ca vā honti mā mā bhavam
translated: . In the sense of ‘impossibility’.

original: vanaṃ, vātveva? Mā te kāmaguṇe bhamassu cittaṃ, mā tvaṃ karissasi, mā tvaṃ kareyyāsi,
analyzed: vanam vātvā iva mā te kāma guṇe bhamassu cittam mā tvam karissasi mā tvam kareyyāsi
translated: The words ī, ā, etc., are used in the sense of ‘impossibility’. ‘Mā su punapi evarūpamakāsi’, ‘Do not do such a thing again’. ‘Mā bhavaṃ agamāvanaṃ’, ‘Do not go to the forest’. ‘Vātveva?’, ‘How is it possible?’. ‘Mā te kāmaguṇe bhamassu cittaṃ’, ‘Let not your mind be confused by the objects of sensual pleasure’. ‘Mā tvaṃ karissasi’, ‘You will not do’. ‘Mā tvaṃ kareyyāsi’, ‘You ought not to do’.🔽. In the sense of ‘future time’.

original: asakakālatthoyamārambho, buddho bhavissatīti padantarasambandhenānāgatakālatā patīyate,
analyzed: a saka kāla tthaḥ ayam ārambhaḥ buddhaḥ bhavissati iti pada antara sambandhena anāgata kāla tā patīyate
translated: This beginning is in the future tense. ‘Buddho bhavissatī’ti padantarasambandhena anāgatakālatā paṭiyate,

original: evaṃ kato kaṭo sve bhavissati, bhāvi kiccamāsīti.
analyzed: evam kataḥ kaṭaḥ sve bhavissati bhāvi kiccam asi iti
translated: Thus ‘he will plough tomorrow’ is said.

original: Lunāhi lunāhitvevāyaṃ lunāti, lunassu lunassutvevāyaṃ lunā-tīti tvādīnamevetaṃ majjhimapurisekavacanānamābhikkhaññe
analyzed: lunāhi lunāhi tu eva ayam lunāti lunassu lunassu tu eva ayam lunāti iti tva ādīnam eva etam majjhima purisa ekavacanānam ābhikkhaññe
translated: ‘Ploughing, ploughing’ he ploughs. ‘Plough, plough’ he ploughs. This is the same as the previous.

original: dvibbavacanaṃ, idaṃ vuttaṃ hoti ‘eva mesa turito aññepi niyojentoviya kiriyaṃ karotī’ti,
analyzed: idam vuttam hoti eva aññe pi niyojentaḥ viya kiriyam karoti iti
translated: The dual is used in the middle and final exhortations. This is said: ‘Just as he does the action himself, so he causes another to do it quickly.’

original: evaṃ lunātha lunāthatvevāyaṃ lunāti, lunavho lunavhotvevāyaṃ lunāti, tathā kālantaresupi
analyzed: evam lunātha lunātha tu eva ayam lunāti lunavhaḥ lunavhaḥ tu eva ayam lunāti tathā
translated: Thus ‘ploughing, ploughing’ he ploughs. ‘Ploughing, ploughing’ he ploughs. Likewise in the other tenses:

original: lunāhi lunāhitvevāyaṃ aluni, alunā, lulāva, lunissatīti, evaṃ ssumhi ca yojanīyaṃ,
analyzed: lunāhi lunāhi tvā iva ayam a luni a lunā lulāva lunissati iti evam ca yojanīyam
translated: ‘Plough, ploughing’ he ploughed. ‘Ploughing, ploughing’ he ploughed. ‘Ploughed, ploughed’ he ploughed. ‘Ploughed, ploughed’ he ploughed. ‘He will plough, he will plough’ he will plough. ‘Ploughing, ploughing’ he will plough. Thus it should be illustrated in the future also.

original: tathā samuccayepi maṭhamaṭa, vihāramaṭetvevāyamaṭati, maṭhamaṭassu, vihāramaṭassutvevāyamaṭati,🔽byāpārabhede tusāmaññavacanasseva byāpakattā anuppayogo bhavati, odanaṃ bhuñja, yāguṃ
analyzed: tathā samuccaye pi maṭha maṭa vihāra maṭe tu eva ayam aṭati maṭha maṭaḥsu vihāra maṭaḥsu tu eva ayam aṭati  byāpāra bhede tu sāmañña vacanassa iva byāpaka ttā an uppayogaḥ bhavati odanam bhuñja yāgum
translated: Likewise in the collective: ‘Wandering, wandering’ he wanders. ‘Wandering, wandering’ he wanders. ‘Wandering, wandering’ he wanders. ‘Wandering, wandering’ he wanders. ‘Wandering, wandering’ he will wander. ‘Wandering, wandering’ he will wander.

original: piva, dhānā khādetvevāya-majjhoharati.
analyzed: piva dhānāḥ khādetu eva ayam ajjhoharati
translated: In the case of the different kinds of pervasion, the collective is used because of the pervasion of the singular. ‘Eat rice, drink rice-gruel, eat cakes’ he eats.

original: 14. Pubbaparacchakkānamekānekesu tumhāmhasesesu dve dve majjhimuttamapaṭhamā.🔽Ekānekesu tumhāmhasaddavacanīyesu tadaññasaddavacanīyesu ca kārakesu pubbacchakkānaṃ
analyzed: pubba para chakkānam eka anekesu tumha amha sesesu dve dve majjhima uttama paṭhamā  eka anekesu tumha amha sadda vacanīyesu tad añña sadda vacanīyesu ca kārakesu pubba chakkānam
translated: 14. In the first and second persons singular and plural, in the verbs to be done, there are two each, the middle and the best, and the first.🔽In the first and second persons singular and plural, in the verbs to be done, in the verbs to be done with the words “you” and “we,” and in the verbs to be done with the words “that” and “another,” there are two each,

original: paracchakkānaṃ majjhimuttamapaṭhamā dve dve honti yathākkamaṃ kriyatthā, uttamasaddo-yaṃ
analyzed: paracchakkānam majjhima uttama paṭhamāḥ dve dve honti yathākkamam
translated: the middle and the best, and the first, in order, for the purpose of action. The word “best”

original: sabhāvato tatiyaduke ruḷho, tvaṃ gacchasi, tumhe gacchatha, tvaṃ gacchase, tumhe🔽gacchavhe, ahaṃ gacchāmi, mayaṃ gacchāma, ahaṃ gacche, mayaṃ gacchāmhe, so gacchati,
analyzed: ruḷho tvam gacchasi tumhe gacchatha tvam gacchase tumhe  gacchavhe aham gacchāmi mayam gacchāma aham gacche mayam gacchāmhe saḥ gacchati
translated: is established in the third dual by nature: You go, you all go, you go, you all go, I go, we go, I go, we go, he goes,

original: te gacchanti, so gacchate, te gacchante, sāmatthiyā laddhattā appayujjamānesupi tumhāmhasesesu
analyzed: te gacchanti saḥ gacchate te gacchante sāmatthiyāḥ laddha ttā appayujjamānesu pi tumha amha sesesu
translated: they go, he goes, they go, because of the obtaining of the capability, they are in the first and second persons singular and plural,

original: bhavanti. Gacchasi, gacchatha, gacchase, gacchavhe, gacchāmi, gacchāma, gacche, gacchāmhe,
analyzed: bhavanti gacchasi gacchatha gacchase gacchavhe gacchāmi gacchāma gacche gacchāmhe
translated: which are not used: You go, you all go, you go, you all go, I go, we go, I go, we go, he goes,

original: gacchati, gacchanti, gacchate, gacchante.
analyzed: gacchati gacchanti gacchate gacchante
translated: they go, he goes, they go.🔽. In the verbs to come, etc., the first is optionally used.

original: 15. Āīssādīsvaña vā.
analyzed: ā īs sa ādīs vaña vā
translated: 15. The dream of the letter A, etc.

original: Āādo īādo ssā ādo ca kriyatthassa vā aña hoti. Ñakāro-nubandho, agamā, gamā, agamī, gamī, agamissā, gamissā.
analyzed: ā ādaḥ ī ādaḥ ssā ādaḥ ca kriyatthassa vā aña hoti ñakāraḥ nubandhaḥ agamā gamā agamī gamī agamissā gamissā
translated: The syllable ā is the beginning of the syllable ā, and ā is also the beginning of the meaning of the verb. The letter ñ is connected, agamā, gamā, agamī, gamī, agamissā, gamissā.

original: 16. Aādīsvāho brūssa.
analyzed: brūssa
translated: . In the beginning, etc., āho is of brū.

original: Brūssa āho hoti aādīsu. Āha, āhu.
analyzed: āhaḥ hoti a ādīsu āha āhu
translated: Āho is of brū in the beginning, etc. Āha, āhu.

original: 17. Bhūssa vuka.
analyzed: bhūssa vuka
translated: . Of bhū, vuka.

original: Aādīsu bhūssa vuka hoti. Kakāro-nubandho, ukāro uccāraṇattho, babhūva.
analyzed: a ādīsu bhūssa hoti kakāraḥ anubandhaḥ ukāraḥ uccāraṇa atthaḥ babhūva
translated: Vuka is of bhū in the beginning, etc. The letter k is connected, the letter u is for pronunciation, babhūva.

original: 18. Pubbassa a.
analyzed: pubbassa a
translated: . Of the preceding, a.

original: Aādīsu dvitte pubbassa bhūssa a hoti, babhūva.
analyzed: a ādīsu dvitte pubbassa bhūssa a hoti babhūva
translated: A of bhū is of the preceding in the beginning, etc., babhūva.

original: 19. Ussaṃsvāhā vā.
analyzed: ussaṃsvāhā vā
translated: . Of us, aṃsu or āhā.

original: Āhādesā parassa ussa aṃsuvā hoti. Ahaṃsu, āhu.
analyzed: āha ādesā parassa hoti ahaṃsu āhu
translated: Aṃsu or āhā is of the preceding us. Ahaṃsu, āhu.

original: 20. Tyantīnaṃ ṭaṭū.
analyzed: tya antīnam ṭaṭū
translated: . Of the final, ṭaṭū.

original: Āhā paresaṃ tiantīnaṃ ṭaṭū honti. Ṭakārā sabbādesatthā, āha, āhu, atoyeva ca ñāpakā tiantīsu ca brūssā-ho.
analyzed: āhā paresam ti antīnam ṭa ṭū honti ṭakārā sabba ādesa atthāḥ āha āhu ca ñāpakā ti antīsu ca
translated: Ṭaṭū are of the final of the preceding. The letter ṭ is for the purpose of indicating all, āha, āhu. From this very [rule], and because of the indication, also āho of brū in the final.

original: 21. Īādo vacassoma.
analyzed: ī ā daḥ vacaḥsoma
translated: . Of vac, oma in the beginning, etc.

original: Īādīsu vacassa oma hoti. Makāro-nubandho, avoca, īādoti kiṃ? Avacā.🔽22. Dāssa daṃ vā mimesvadvitte.
analyzed: ī ādīsu vacassa oma hoti makāraḥ anubandhaḥ avocaḥ ī ādo ti kim 🔽dāssa dam vā
translated: Oma is of vac in the beginning, etc. The letter m is connected, avoca. In the beginning, etc., what? Avacā.

original: Advite vattamānassa dāssa daṃ vā hoti mimesu. Dammi demi, damma dema, advitteti kiṃ? Dadādhi dadāma.🔽23. Karassa sossa kuṃ.
analyzed: advite vattamānassa dāssa dam vā hoti dammi demi damma dema advitta iti kim dadādhi dadāma  karassa sossa kum
translated: The forms of the verb ‘to give’ (dadāti) are: dadāmi, dadāma, dadāti, dadanti, dadāsi, dadātha, dadāsi, dadāma, dadāmi, dadāma.

original: Karassa saokārassa kuṃ vā hoti mimesu. Kummi kumma, karomi karoma.🔽24. Kā īādīsu.🔽Karassa saokārassa kā hoti vā īādīsu. Akāsi akari, akaṃsu akariṃsu, akā akarā.🔽25. Hāssa, cāhaṅa ssena.
analyzed: karassa saokārassa kum vā hoti mimesu kummi karomi karoma  kā ī ādīsu  karassa saokārassa kā hoti vā ī ādīsu akāsi akari akaṃsu akariṃsu akā akarā  hāssa ca ahaṅaḥ ssena
translated: The forms of the verb ‘to do’ ( karoti) are: karomi, karoma, karasi, karotha, karasi, karoma, karomi, karoma.🔽The forms of the verb ‘to be’ ( hoti) are: hoti, honti, hosi, hotha, hosi, homa, homi, homa.

original: Karassa sossa hāssa ca āhaṅa vā hoti ssena saha. Kāhati karissati, akāhā akarissā, hāhati hāyissati, ahāhā ahāyissā.🔽26. Labhavasacchidabhidarudānaṃ cchaṅa.
analyzed: karassa sossa hāssa ca āhaṅa vā hoti ssena saha kāhati karissati akāhāḥ akarissā hāhati hāyissati ahāhāḥ ahāyissā  labha vasa chida bhida rudānam cchaṅa
translated: The forms of the verb ‘to eat’ ( bhuñjati) are: bhuñjāmi, bhuñjāma, bhuñjati, bhuñjanti, bhuñjasī, bhuñjatha, bhuñjasī, bhuñjāma, bhuñjāmi, bhuñjāma.🔽The forms of the verb ‘to drink’ ( pivati) are: pivāmi, pivāma, pivati, pivanti, pivasi, pivatha, pivasi, pivāma, pivāmi, pivāma.

original: Labhādīnaṃ cchaṅa vā hoti ssenasaha. Alacchā alabhissā, lacchati labhissāti, avacchā
analyzed: labha ādīnam cchaṅa vā hoti ssena saha a lacchā a labhissā lacchati labhissāti avacchā
translated: The forms of the verb ‘to be able’ ( labhati) are: labhāmi, labhāma, labhati, labhanti, labhasi, labhatha, labhasi, labhāma, labhāmi, labhāma.🔽The forms of the verb ‘to live’ ( vasati) are: vasāmi, vasāma, vasati, vasanti, vasasi, vasatha, vasasi, vasāma, vasāmi, vasāma.

original: avasissā, vacchati vasissati, acchecchā acchindissā, checchati chindissati, abhecchā
analyzed: avasissā vacchati vasissati acchecchā acchindissā checchati chindissati abhecchā
translated: The forms of the verb ‘to cut’ ( chindati) are: chindāmi, chindāma, chindati, chindanti, chindasi, chindatha, chindasi, chindāma, chindāmi, chindāma.

original: abhindissā, bhecchati bhindissati, arucchā arodissā, rucchati rodissatī, aññasmimpi
analyzed: a bhindissā bhecchati bhindissati a rucchā a rodissā rucchati rodissatī aññasmim pi
translated: abhindissā, bhecchati bhindissati, arucchā arodissā, rucchati rodissatī, aññasmimpi

original: chidassa vā cchaṅa yogavibhāgā, acchecchuṃ acchantiṃsu, aññesañca gacchaṃ gacchissaṃ.
analyzed: chidassa vā cchaṅa yoga vibhāgāḥ acchā icchum aññesam ca gaccham gacchissam
translated: chidassa vā cchaṅa yogavibhāgā, acchecchuṃ acchantiṃsu, aññesañca gacchaṃ gacchissaṃ.

original: 27. Bhuja muca vaca visānaṃ kkhaṅa.
analyzed: bhuja muca vaca visānam kkhaṅa
translated: . Bhuja muca vaca visānaṃ kkhaṅa.

original: Bhujādīnaṃ kkhaṅa vā hoti ssena saha. Abhokkhā abhuñjissā, bhokkhati bhuñjissati,
analyzed: bhuja ādīnam kkhaṅa vā hoti ssena saha abhokkhā abhuñjissā bhokkhati bhuñjissati
translated: Bhujādīnaṃ kkhaṅa vā hoti ssena saha. Abhokkhā abhuñjissā, bhokkhati bhuñjissati,

original: amokkhā amuñcissā, mokkhatimuñcissati, avakkhā avacissā, vakkhati vaccissati, pāvekkhā
analyzed: a mokkhā a muñcissā mokkhati muñcissati avakkhā a vacissā vakkhati vaccissati
translated: amokkhā amuñcissā, mokkhatimuñcissati, avakkhā avacissā, vakkhati vaccissati, pāvekkhā

original: pāvisissā, pavekkhati pavisissati, visassā-ññasmimpi vā kkhaṅa yogavibhāgā pāvekkhi, pāvisi.
analyzed: pāvisissā pavekkhati pavisissati visassa aññasmin pi vā kkhaṅa yoga vibhāgā pāvekkhi pāvisi
translated: pāvisissā, pavekkhati pavisissati, visassā-ññasmimpi vā kkhaṅa yogavibhāgā pāvekkhi, pāvisi.

original: 28. Āīādīsu harassā.
analyzed: āī ādīsu ha rassā
translated: . Āīādīsu harassā.

original: Āādo īādo a harassa ā hoti vā. Ahā aharā, ahāsi ahari.
analyzed: ā ādaḥ ī ādaḥ a harassa ā hoti vā ahā aharā ahāsi ahari
translated: Āādo īādo a harassa ā hoti vā. Ahā aharā, ahāsi ahari.

original: 29. Gamissa.
analyzed: gamissa
translated: . Gamissa.

original: Āādo īādo a gamissa ā hoti vā. Agā agamā, agā agamī.
analyzed: ā ādaḥ a gamissa ā hoti vā agā agamā agā agamī
translated: Āādo īādo a gamissa ā hoti vā. Agā agamā, agā agamī.

original: 30. Ḍaṃsassa ca chaṅa.
analyzed: ḍaṃsassa ca chaṅa
translated: . Ḍaṃsassa ca chaṅa.

original: Ḍaṃsassa gamissa ca chaṅa vā hoti āīādīsu. Aḍañchā aḍaṃsā, aḍañchi aḍaṃsī, agañchā agacchā, agañchi agacchī.🔽31. Hūssa hehehihohi ssatyādo.
analyzed: ḍaṃsassa gamissa ca chaṅa vā hoti āī ādīsu aḍañchā aḍaṃsā aḍañchi aḍaṃsī agañchā agacchā agañchi agacchī  hūssa he he hi hohi ssatya adaḥ
translated: In the future tense, the reduplicated syllable may be lengthened in the endings ā, ī, ā, etc. Aḍañchā, aḍaṃsā, aḍañchi, aḍaṃsī, agañchā, agacchā, agañchi, agacchī.🔽In the future tense, hehe, hohi, etc. are formed from hū.

original: Hūssa heādayo honti ssatyādo. Hessati, hehissati, hohissati.🔽32. Ṇānāsu rasso.
analyzed: hūssa he ādayaḥ honti hessati hehissati hohissati  ṇa a nāsu rassaḥ
translated: Hessati, hehissati, hohissati.🔽In the reduplicated verbs, the vowel of the reduplicated syllable is lengthened.

original: Kṇāknāsu kriyatthassa rasso hoti. Kiṇāti, dhunāti.
analyzed: kṇā knāsu kriyatthassa rassaḥ hoti kiṇāti dhunāti
translated: Kiṇāti, dhunāti.

original: 33. Ā ī ñu mhā ssā ssamhānaṃ vā.
analyzed: ā ī ñu mhā ssā ssamhānam vā
translated: In the future tense, the reduplicated syllable may be lengthened in the endings ā, ī, ñu, mha, ssā, ssamha.

original: Esaṃ vā rasso hoti. Gama gamā, gami gamī, gamu gamū, gamimha gamimhā, gamissa gamissā, gamissamha gamissamhā.🔽34. Kusaruhehīssa chi.
analyzed: vā rassaḥ hoti gama gamā gami gamī gamu gamū gamimha gamimhā gamissa gamissā gamissamha gamissamhā  kusaruhehīssa chi
translated: Gama gamā, gami gamī, gamu gamū, gamimha gamimhā, gamissa gamissā, gamissamha gamissamhā.🔽In the reduplicated verbs, the reduplicated syllable may be lengthened in the future tense.

original: Kusā ruhā ca parassa īssa chi vā hoti. Akkocchi akkosi, abhirucchi abhiruhi.🔽35. A ī ssāādīnaṃ byañjanassiña.
analyzed: kusā ruhā ca parassa īssa chi vā hoti akkocchi akkosi abhirucchi abhiruhi  a ī ssā ādīnam byañjanaḥ ssiña
translated: Akkocchi akkosi, abhirucchi abhiruhi.🔽In the reduplicated verbs, the reduplicated syllable may be lengthened in the future tense.

original: Kriyatthā paresaṃ aādīnaṃ īādīnaṃ ssaādīnañca-byañjanassa iña hoti vibhāsā. Babhuvittha,
analyzed: kriyatthā paresam a ādīnam ī ādīnam ssa ādīnam ca byañjanassa iña hoti vibhāsā babhuvittha
translated: Babhuvittha,

original: abhavitthā, anubhavissā, anubhavissati anubhossati harisati hassati, etesanti kiṃ?
analyzed: abhavitthāḥ anubhavissā anubhavissati anubhossati harisati hassati etesanti kim
translated: abhavitthā, anubhavissā, anubhavissati anubhossati harisati hassati, etesanti kiṃ?

original: Bhavati, byañjanassāti kiṃ? Babhūva.
analyzed: bhavati kim babhūva
translated: Bhavati, byañjanassāti kiṃ? Babhūva.

translated: Brūto parassa tissa īña vā hoti. Bravīti, brūti.

original: tasseva vā nissitattā, nissayakaraṇampi hi suttakārāciṇṇaṃ.

translated: tasseva vā nissitattā, nissayakaraṇampi hi suttakārāciṇṇaṃ.

original: 39. Uṃssiṃ svaṃsu.
analyzed: uṃssim svaṃsu
translated: . Uṃssiṃ svaṃsu.

original: Umīccassa iṃsu aṃsu vā honti. Agamiṃsu, agamaṃsu, agamuṃ.
analyzed: um ī ccassa iṃsu aṃsu vā honti agamiṃsu agamaṃsu agamum
translated: The forms of the 1st person plural are formed by adding iṃsu, aṃsu, or suṃ to the stem. They came, they went, they went away.

original: 40. Eottā suṃ.
analyzed: e o ttā sum
translated: . Eottā suṃ.

original: Eādesato oādesato ca parassa umiccassa suṃ vā hoti. Nesuṃ, nayiṃsu, assosuṃ, assuṃ, ādesattākhyāpanatthaṃttaggahaṇaṃ.
analyzed: e ādesataḥ o ādesataḥ ca parassa um iccassa sum vā hoti nesum nayiṃsu assosum assum ādesa tta ākhyāpana ttha tta gahaṇaṃ
translated: The forms of the 2nd person plural are formed by adding suṃ to the stem. They heard, they saw, they were. The word ttha is given in order to show the rule of elision.

original: 41. Hūto resuṃ.
analyzed: hūtaḥ resum
translated: . Hūto resuṃ.

original: Hūto parassa umiccassa resuṃ vā hoti. Ahesuṃ, ahavuṃ.
analyzed: hūtaḥ parassa um iccassa resum vā hoti ahesum ahavum
translated: The forms of the 3rd person plural are formed by adding resuṃ to the stem. They were, they became.

original: 42. Ossa a i ttha ttho.
analyzed: ossa a i ttha ttho
translated: . Ossa a i ttha ttho.

original: Ossa aādayo vā honti. Tvaṃ abhava, abhavi, abhavittha, abhavittho abhavo.
analyzed: ossa a ādayaḥ vā honti tvam abhava abhavi abhavittha abhavittha
translated: The forms of the 1st person singular are formed by adding a, i, ttha, ttho to the stem. You were, you became, you became, you became, you were.

analyzed: si

original: Ossa si vā hoti. Ahosi tvaṃ ahuvo.
analyzed: si vā hoti tvam
translated: The forms of the 2nd person singular are formed by adding si to the stem. You were, you became.

original: 44. Dīghā īssa.
analyzed: dīghāḥ īs sa
translated: . Dīghā īssa.

original: Dīghato parassa īssa si vā hoti. Akāsi akā, adāsi adā.🔽45. Mhātthānamuña.🔽Mhātthānamhaña vā hoti. Agamhamhā agamimhā, agamuttha agamittha.🔽46. Iṃssa ca siña.🔽Imiccassa siña vā toti mhātthānañca bahulaṃ. Akāsiṃ akariṃ, akāsimhā akarimhā akāsittha akarittha.🔽47. Eyyuṃssuṃ.
analyzed: dīghataḥ parassa īssa si vā hoti akāsi akā adāsi adā 🔽mha āt tha ana muña 🔽vā hoti a gamhamhā a gamimhā agamuttha agamittha 🔽iṃssa ca siña 🔽im iccassa siña vā to ti mha atthānam ca bahulam akāsim akarim akāsimhā akarimhā akāsittha akarittha 🔽ey yuṃs sum
translated: The forms of the 3rd person singular are formed by adding īssa or si to the stem. He did, he gave.

analyzed: atthissa a ṭa hoti si hi su ṭaḥ sabba ādesa atthaḥ asi a hi
translated: The ending -um is added to the present stem.

original: 54. Mimānaṃ vā mhimhā ca.
analyzed: mimānam vā mhimhā ca
translated: The ending -um is added to the

original: Atthismā paresaṃ mimānaṃ mhimhā vā honti, taṃsanniyogenaatthissa aṭa ca. Amhi asmi, amha asma.🔽55. Esu si.🔽Esu mimesu atthissa sakāro hoti. Asmi asma, pararūpabādhanatthaṃ.🔽56. Īādo dīgho.🔽Atthissa dīgho hoti īādimhi. Āsi, āsuṃ, āsi, āsittha, āsiṃ, āsiṃ mhā.🔽57. Himimesvassa.🔽Akārassa dīgho hoti himimesu. Pacāhi, pacāmi, pacāma, muyhāmi.🔽58. Sakā ṇāssa kha īādo.🔽Sakasmā kṇāssakhohoti īādīsu. Asakkhi, asakkhiṃsu.🔽59. Sse vā.🔽Sakasmā kṇassakho vā hoti sse. Sakkhissā sakkuṇissā, sakkhissati, sakkuṇissati.🔽60. Tesu suto kṇokṇānaṃ roṭa.
analyzed: paresam mimānam mhi mhā vā honti tad sanniyogena atthissa aṭa ca amhi asmi amha asma  esu si  esu mimesu atthissa sakāraḥ hoti asmi asma para rūpa bādhana ttham  ī ā taḥ dīghaḥ  atthissa dīghaḥ hoti ī ādimhi āsi āsum āsi āsittha āsim āsim mhā  hi mi me svassa  akārassa dīghaḥ hoti hi mimesu pacāhi pacāmi pacāma muyhāmi  sakāḥ ṇāssa khaḥ ī ādaḥ  sakasmā ī ādīsu asakkhi asakkhiṃsu  s se vā  sakasmā kṇassakhaḥ vā hoti sse sakkhissā sakkuṇissā sakkhissati sakkuṇissati  tesu sutaḥ kṇokṇānam roṭa
translated: The forms of the verb mimānaṃ, mhimhā, and their derivatives are: atthissa, aṭa, amhi, asmi, amha, asma.🔽55. In these, si.🔽In these mimes, atthissa becomes sakāro, asmi, asma, for the purpose of avoiding the appearance of another.🔽56. In īādo, dīgho.🔽In īādo, atthissa becomes dīgho. Āsi, āsuṃ, āsi, āsittha, āsiṃ, āsiṃ mhā.🔽57. In himimesvassa.🔽In himimesu, akārassa becomes dīgho. Pacāhi, pacāmi, pacāma, muyhāmi.🔽58. Sakā ṇāssa kha īādo.🔽From sakā ṇāssa becomes sakha in īādo. Asakkhi, asakkhiṃsu.🔽59. Sse vā.🔽From sakā ṇāssa becomes sakha vā in sse. Sakkhissā, sakkuṇissā, sakkhissati, sakkuṇissati.🔽60. In tesu suto kṇokṇānaṃ roṭa.

original: Tesu īādissesu suto paresaṃ kṇokṇānaṃ roṭa vā hoti. Assosi asuṇi, assossā asuṇissā, sossati suṇissati.
analyzed: tesu ī ā dissesu su taḥ paresam kṇokṇānam vā hoti assosi asuṇi assossā asuṇissā sossati suṇissati

analyzed: timhi sanāssa nāyaḥ timhi sanāssa nāyaḥ vā hoti timhi nāyati jānāti
translated: 61. Ñāssa sanāssa nāyo timhi. Sanāssa ñāssa nāyo vā is in timhi. Nāyati, jānāti.

original: 62. Ñāmhi jaṃ.
analyzed: ñāmhi jam
translated: . Ñāmhi jaṃ.

original: Ñādese sanāssa ñāssa jaṃ (vā) hoti. Jaññā (jāneyya).
analyzed: ñā dese sa nā assa ñā assa jam vā hoti jaññā jāneyya
translated: Ñādese sanāssa ñāssa jaṃ (vā) is. Jaññā (jāneyya).

original: 63. Eyyāssiyāñā vā.
analyzed: ey yās siyāñāḥ vā
translated: . Eyyāssiyāñā vā.

original: Ñāto eyyāssa iyāñā honti vā. Jāniyā, jaññā jāneyya.
analyzed: ñātaḥ eyyāssa iyāñā honti vā jāniyā jaññā jāneyya
translated: Ñāto eyyāssa iyāñā are in vā. Jāniyā, jaññā jāneyya.

original: 64. Īssatyādīsu knālopo.
analyzed: īs satya ādīsu kna a lopaḥ
translated: . Īssatyādīsu knālopo.

original: Īādo ssatyādo ca ñāto knālopo vā hoti. Aññāsi ajāni, ñassati jānissati.
analyzed: ī ādaḥ ssati ādaḥ ca ña ā taḥ knā lopaḥ vā hoti aññāsi ajāni ñassati jānissati
translated: Īādo ssatyādo ca ñāto knālopo vā is. Aññāsi ajāni, ñassati jānissati.

original: 65. Ssassa hi kamme.
analyzed: ssassa hi kamme
translated: . Ssassa hi kamme.

original: Ñāto parassa ssassa hi vā hoti kamme. Paññāyihiti paññāyissati.
analyzed: ñātaḥ parassa ssassa hi vā hoti kamme paññāyihiti paññāyissati
translated: Ñāto parassa ssassa hi vā is in kamme. Paññāyihiti paññāyissati.

original: 66. Etismā.
analyzed: etismā
translated: . Etismā.

original: Etismā parassa ssassa hi hoti vā. Ehiti essati.
analyzed: e tismā parassa ssassa hi hoti vā e hiti essati
translated: Etismā parassa ssassa hi vā is. Ehiti essati.

original: 67. Hanā chakhā.
analyzed: hanā chakhā
translated: . Hanā chakhā.

original: Hanā ssassa chakhā vā honti. Hañchāmi hanissāmi, paṭihaṅkhāmi paṭihanissāmi.
analyzed: hanā ssassa chakhā vā honti hañchāmi hanissāmi paṭihaṅkhāmi paṭihanissāmi
translated: Hanā ssassa chakhā vā are. Hañchāmi hanissāmi, paṭihaṅkhāmi paṭihanissāmi.

original: 68. Hāto ha.
analyzed: ha a taḥ ha
translated: . Hāto ha.

original: Hāto parassa ssassa ha hoti vā. Hāhati jahissati.
analyzed: hā taḥ parassa ssassa ha hoti vā hāhati jahissati
translated: Hāto parassa ssassa ha is in vā. Hāhati jahissati.

original: 69. Dakkha kha hehi hohīhi lopo.
analyzed: dakkha kha hehi ho hi lopaḥ
translated: . Dakkha kha hehi hohīhi lopo.

original: Dakkhādīhi ādesehi parassa ssassa lopo vā hoti. Dakkhati dakkhissati, sakkhati sakkhissati, hehiti hehissatihohiti hohissati.
analyzed: dakkha ādīhi ādesehi parassa ssassa lopaḥ vā hoti dakkhati dakkhissati sakkhati sakkhissati he hiti he hissati ho hiti ho hissati
translated: After dakkha, etc., the ss of the other is dropped optionally. He will see, he will be able, he will say, he will be.

original: 70. Kayireyyasseyyumādīnaṃ.
analyzed: kayi reyyas seyyuma ādīnam
translated: Kayirā, etc.

original: Kayirā parassa eyyumādīnaṃ eyyassa lopo hoti. Kayiruṃ, kayirāsi, kayirātha, kahirāmi, kayirāma.
analyzed: kayirā parassa eyyum ādīnam eyyassa lopaḥ hoti kayirum kayirāsi kayirātha kahirāmi kayirāma
translated: After kayirā, etc., the eyy of the other is dropped. They will do, they will do, they will do, I will do, we will do.

analyzed: ṭā

original: Kayirā parassa eyyassa ṭā hoti. So kayirā.
analyzed: kayirā parassa eyyassa ṭā hoti sā u kayirā
translated: After kayirā, the ṭā of the other is optionally substituted for the eyy. He will do.

original: 72. Ethassā.
analyzed: ethassā
translated: Ethassā.

original: Kayirā parassa ethassa ā hoti. Kayirātha.
analyzed: kayirā parassa ethassa ā hoti kayirā atha
translated: After kayirā, the ā of the other eth is optionally substituted. They will do.

original: 73. Labhā iṃ īnaṃ thaṃ thā vā.
analyzed: vā
translated: Labhā, iṃ, īnaṃ, thaṃ, thā.

original: Labhasmā iṃīiccesaṃ thaṃthā honti vā. Alatthaṃ alabhiṃ, alattha alabhi.
analyzed: thaṃthāḥ honti vā alattham alabhim alattha alabhi
translated: After labhasmā, iṃ, ī, and īnaṃ, thaṃ and thā are optionally substituted. He obtained, he obtained; he obtained, he obtained.

original: 74. Gurupubbā rassā re ntentīnaṃ.
analyzed: guru pubbāḥ rassāḥ re nta e ntīnam
translated: Gurupubbā, rassā, re, ntentīnaṃ.

original: Gurupubbasmā rassā paresaṃ ntentīnaṃ re vā hoti. Gacchare gacchanti, gacchare gacchante, gamissare gamissanti, gamissare gamissante, gurupubbāti kiṃ? Paca, rassati kiṃ? Honti.
analyzed: guru pubbasmā rassā paresam nta intīnam re vā hoti gacchare gacchanti gacchare gacchante gamissare gamissanti gamissare gamissante guru pubbā ati kim paca rassati kim honti
translated: After gurupubbā, rassā, re is optionally substituted for the ntentīnaṃ of the other. They go, they go; they go, they go; they will go, they will go; they will go, they will go. Gurupubbāti kiṃ? He cooks, he is light. Rassāti kiṃ? They go.

original: 75. Eyyeyyāseyyannaṃ ṭe.
analyzed: ṭe
translated: Eyyeyyā, seyyannaṃ, ṭe.

original: Eyyādīnaṃ ṭe vā hoti. So kare kareyya, tvaṃ kare kareyyāsi, ahaṃ kare kareyyaṃ.🔽76. Ovikaraṇassu paracchakke.🔽Ovikaraṇassa u hoti paracchakke visaye. Tanute.
analyzed: vā hoti saḥ kare kareyya tvam kare kareyya asi aham kare kareyyam  o vikaraṇassu paracchakke  ovikaraṇassa u hoti paracchakke visaye tanute
translated: The forms of the 2nd person singular are: kare, kareyyāsi, kareyyāmi.

original: 77. Pubbacchakke vā kvaci.🔽Ovikaraṇassa u hoti vā kvaci pubbacchakke. Vanuti vanoti.🔽78. Eyyāmassemu ca.
analyzed: pubbat śakke vā kvacid  o vikaraṇassa u hoti vā kvaci pubbacchakke vanuti vanoti  ey yāmas semu ca
translated: The forms of the 2nd person plural are: karetha, kareyyātha, kareyyāma.🔽The forms of the 1st person singular are: kare, kareyyaṃ, kareyyaṃ.

original: Eyyāmassemu vā hoti u ca. Bhavemha, bhaveyyāmu bhaveyyāma.🔽Iti moggallāne byākaraṇe vuttiyaṃ
analyzed: vā hoti u ca bhavemha bhaveyyāmu bhaveyyāma  iti moggallāne byākaraṇe vuttiyam
translated: The forms of the 1st person plural are: karema, kareyyāma, kareyyāma.🔽Thus ends the section on the verbal roots beginning with “tyaj” in the Moggallāna grammar.

original: Tyādikaṇḍo chaṭṭho.
analyzed: tya ādi kaṇḍaḥ chaṭṭhaḥ
translated: The sixth chapter.

original: 7. Sattamo kaṇḍo (ṇvādi)
analyzed: sattamaḥ kaṇḍaḥ ṇu ādi
translated: The seventh chapter (beginning with “ṇvā”)

original: “Bahulaṃ” (1.58) “kriyatthā”ti (5.14) ca sabbattha vatthate.
analyzed: bahulam ca sabbattha
translated: “Bahulaṃ” (.) “kriyatthā”ti (.) and “vatthate” are used everywhere.

original: 1. Cara dara kara raha jana sana tala sāda sādha kasāsa caṭāya vāhi ṇu.
analyzed: cara dara kara raha jana sana tala sāda sādha kasāsa caṭāya vāhi ṇu
translated: “Cara dara kara raha jana sana tala sāda sādha kasāsa caṭāya vāhi ṇu.”

original: Cara-gatibhakkhaṇesu, dara-daraṇe, kara-karaṇe, raha-cāge, jana-janane, sana-sambhattiyaṃ,
analyzed: cara gati bhakkhaṇesu dara daraṇe kara karaṇe raha cāge jana janane sana sambhattiyam
translated: “Cara” (.) means “to go” and “to eat.” “Dara” (.) means “to break.” “Kara” (.) means “to do.” “Raha” (.) means “to throw away.” “Jana” (.) means “to produce.” “Sana” (.) means “to collect.”

original: tala-patiṭṭhāyaṃ, sāda-assādane, sādha-saṃsiddhiyaṃ, kasa-vilekhane, asa-khepane,
analyzed: kasa vilekhane asa khepane
translated: “Tala” (.) means “to place.” “Sāda” (.) means “to enjoy.” “Sādha” (.) means “to accomplish.” “Kasa” (.) means “to scratch.” “Asa” (.) means “to throw.”

original: caṭa-bhedane, aya-iti gamanattho daṇḍako dhātu, vā-gatigandhanesu, etehi kriyatthehi
analyzed: caṭa bhedane gamana tthaḥ daṇḍakaḥ dhātu vāc ati gandhanesu etehi kriyatthehi
translated: In caṭa-bhedana, aya- means going, the root is daṇḍa, vā- means going and smelling, by these roots which have the meaning of action

original: bahulaṃ ṇu hoti. “Assā ṇānubandhe”ti (5.84) upantassa assa ā, carati hadaye manuññabhāvenāti
analyzed: bahulam nu hoti assā upantassa assaḥ ā carati hadaye manuñña bhāvena ati
translated: ṇu is often formed. “Assā ṇānubandhe” (.) means upantassa has ā, it moves in the heart with a pleasant state,

original: cāru=sobhanaṃ. Darīyatīti dāra=kaṭṭhaṃ. Karotīti kāru=sippī, magha vā, visukammo
analyzed: cāru sobhanam darīyati iti dārakaṭṭham karoti iti kāru sippī vā visu kammo
translated: cāru = beautiful. It is broken, therefore dāra = wood. It makes, therefore kāru = an artisan, or magha, excellent work

original: ca. Rahati candādīnaṃ sobhāvisesaṃ nāsetīti rāhu=asurindo. Jāyati gamanāgamanaṃ anenātijānu=jaṅghorūnaṃ🔽sandhi. Saneti attani bhattiṃ uppādetīti sānu=girippadeso. Talanti patiṭṭhahanti
analyzed: ca rahati sobhā visesam nāseti iti rāhu asuḥ indo jāyati gamana āgamanam  sandhi saneti attani bhattim uppādeti iti sānu giri padeso talanti patiṭṭhahanti
translated: ca. It removes the special beauty of the moon etc., therefore rāhu = the lord of the asuras. It is born, going and coming are done by this, therefore atija = the joint of the thigh and calf

original: ettha dantāti tālu=vadanekadeso. Sā dīyati assādīyatīti sādu=madhuraṃ. Sādheti attaparahitanti
analyzed: ettha tālu vat aneka desaḥ sā dīyati sādhā iti
translated: . It is called saṇe, therefore sānu = a mountain region. It is called talanti, therefore tālu = the roof of the mouth. It is given, therefore sādu = sweet. It is accomplished, therefore

original: sādhu=sajjano. Kasīyatīti kāsu=āvāṭo, asati sīghabhāvena pavattatīti āsu=sīghaṃ.
analyzed: sādhu sat janaḥ kasīyati iti kāsu āvāṭaḥ asati sīgha bhāvena pavattati iti
translated: sādhu = a good person. It is dug, therefore kāsu = a pit. It does not exist, it occurs quickly, therefore āsu = quickly.

original: Caṭati bhindati amanuññabhāvanti cāṭu=manuñño. Ayanti pavattanti sattā etenāti āyu=jīvitaṃ.
analyzed: caṭati bhindati amanuñña bhāvanti cāṭu manuññaḥ ayanti pavattanti sattāḥ etena ati āyu jīvitam
translated: It moves, it breaks up, it is not approved of, thus it is a Cāṭu=Manuñña. It goes, it proceeds, beings by this, thus it is Āyu=life.

original: “Assā ṇāpimhi yuka” iti (5.91) yuka- vāti gacchatīti vāyu-vāto.
analyzed: iti vāti gacchati iti vāyuvātaḥ
translated: “In Assā ṇāpi, it is yoked,” thus it is yoked. It goes, thus it is Vāyu=wind.

original: 2. Bhara mara cara tara ara gara hana tana mana bhama kita dhana baṃha kambamba cakkha bhikkha saṃkindanda yaja paṭāṇāsa vasa pasa paṃsa bandhā u.
analyzed: bhara mara cara tara ara gara hana tana mana bhama kita dhana baṃha kambamba cakkha bhikkha saṃkindanda yaja paṭāṇāsa vasa pasa paṃsa bandhā u
translated: Bhara, mara, cara, tara, ara, gara, hana, tana, mana, bhama, kita, dhana, baṃha, kamba, cakkha, bhikkha, saṃkasaṃ, inda, yaja, paṭāṇāsa, vasa, pasa, paṃsa, bandhā.

original: Bhara-bharaṇe, mara-pāṇacāge, cara-gatibhakkhaṇesu, tara taraṇe, ara-gamane, gara
analyzed: bhara bharaṇe mara pāṇa cāge cara gati bhakkhaṇesu tara taraṇe ara gamane gara
translated: Bhara is in the sense of bearing, mara is in the sense of giving up life, cara is in the sense of going and eating, tara is in the sense of crossing, ara is in the sense of going, gara

original: ghara-secane, girāti vā nipātanā akāro, hana-hiṃ sāyaṃ, tana-vittāre, mana-ñāṇe,
analyzed: ghara secane girā ati vā nipātanā akāraḥ hana him sāyam tana vittāre mana ñāṇe
translated: is in the sense of washing, or the letter ka is a prefix in the sense of throwing down, hana is in the sense of harming, tana is in the sense of spreading out, mana is in the sense of knowing,

original: bhama-anavaṭṭhāne, kita-nivāse, dhana-sadde, baṃha braha brūha-vuddhiyaṃ, kamba-saṃvaraṇe,
analyzed: kita nivāse dhana sadde kamba saṃvaraṇe
translated: bhama is in the sense of not turning back, kita is in the sense of dwelling, dhana is in the sense of sound, baṃha is in the sense of increasing, kamba is in the sense of restraining,

original: amba-sadde, cakkha ikkha dassane, bhikkha-yācane, saṃkasaṅkāyaṃ, inda-paramissariye,
analyzed: amba sadde cakkhe ikkha dassane bhikkha yācane saṃka saṅkāyam inda paramissariye
translated: amba is in the sense of sound, cakkha is in the sense of seeing, bhikkha is in the sense of asking, saṃkasaṃ is in the sense of doubt, inda is in the sense of supremacy,

original: anda-bandhane, yaja-devapūjāyaṃ, aṭa paṭa-gamanathā, aṇa-saddattho, asa-khepane,
analyzed: anda bandhane aṭa asa khepane
translated: U is used in the following words of the meaning of action: anda-bandhane, yaja-devapūjāyaṃ, aṭa paṭa-gamanathā, aṇa-saddattho, asa-khepane,

original: vasa-nivāse, pasabādhane, paṃsa-nāsane, bandha-bandhane, etehi kriyatthehi u hoti.🔽Bharatīti bhara=bhattā. Marati rūpakāyena sahevāti maru=devo, nijjaladeso ca. Carīyati🔽bhakkhīyatīti caru=habyapā ko. Taranti anenāti taru=rukkho. Arati sūnabhāvena uddhaṃ
analyzed: vasa nivāse pasa bādhane paṃsanā āsane bandha bandhane etehi kriyatthehi u hoti  bharati iti bharabhattā marati rūpa kāyena saha iva ati marudevaḥ ca carīyati  bhakkhīyati iti kaḥ taranti anena ati taru rukkhaḥ arati sūna bhāvena uddham
translated: vasa-nivāse, pasabādhane, paṃsa-nāsane, bandha-bandhane.

original: gacchatīti aru=vaṇo. Garati siñcati, girati vamati vā sissesu sinehanti garu=ācariyo.🔽Hanati odanādīsu vaṇṇavisesaṃ nāsetīti hanu=vadanekadeso. Tanoti saṃsāra dukkhanti
analyzed: gacchati iti aruvaṇaḥ garati siñcati girati vamati vā sissesu sinehanti  odana ādīsu vaṇṇa visesam nāseti iti hanu vat aneka deso tanoti dukkhanti
translated: Bharati means bhara=bhattā (a supporter). Marati means maru=devo (god) and nijjaladeso (a place of water-letting). Carīyati means caru=habyapā ko (an oblation). Taranti anenāti means taru=rukkho (tree). Arati means aru=vaṇo (a vein). Garati means garu=ācariyo (a teacher).

original: tanu-sarīraṃ. Maññati sattānaṃ hitāhitanti manu=pajāpati. Bhamati calatīti bhamu=nayano
analyzed: tanu sarīram maññati sattānam bhamati calati iti
translated: Hanati means hanu=vadanekadeso (the jaw). Tanoti means tanu-sarīraṃ (the body). Maññati means manu=pajāpati (the lord of creatures). Bhamati means bhamu=nayano (the eye).

original: patiṭṭhānaṃ. Ketati uddhaṃ gacchati, upari nivasatīti vā ketu=dhajo. Dhanati saddaṃ
analyzed: patiṭṭhānam ketati uddham gacchati upari nivasati iti vā ketu dhajaḥ dhanati saddam
translated: Ketati means ketu=dhajo (a banner). Dhanati means dhanu=dhanu (a bow).

original: karotīti dhanu=cāpo. Baṃha iti niddesā umhi niccaṃ niggahītalopo, baṃhati vuddhiṃ🔽gacchatīti bahu=anappakaṃ. Kambati saṃvaraṃ karotīthi kambu=valayo, saṅkho ca. Ambati
analyzed: karoti iti dhanu cāpaḥ baṃhaḥ iti niddesāḥ umhi niccam niggahīta lopaḥ baṃhati vuddhim  gacchati iti bahu anappakam kambati saṃvaram karoti ithi kambu valayaḥ saṅkhaḥ ca
translated: “He makes” (karotī) is a bow (dhanu). “He is cut” (baṃhati) is much (bahu). “He moves” (kambati) is a shell (kambu), a conch (saṅkho). “He is cut” (ambati) is a little (appa).

original: nādaṃkarotīti ambu=vāri. Cakkhati rūpanti cakkhu=nayanaṃ. Bhikkhatīti bhikkhu=samaṇo.
analyzed: nādaṃkaroti iti ambu vāri cakkhati rūpanti cakkhu nayanam bhikkhati iti bhikkhu samaṇaḥ
translated: “It makes” (karotīti) is a bow (dhanu=cāpo). “It is much” (bahu) is “it goes to growth” (baṃhati vuddhiṃ gacchati). “It is a shell” (kambu) is “it makes a covering” (saṃvaraṃ karotīti). “It is water” (ambu) is “it makes a sound” (ambati). “It is an eye” (cakkhu) is “it sees forms” (rūpanti cakkhati). “It is a monk” (bhikkhu) is “it begs” (bhikkhati).

original: Saṃkiratīti saṃku=sūlaṃ. Indati nakkhattānaṃ paramissariyaṃ pavattetīti indu=cando.
analyzed: saṃkirati iti saṃkusūlam indati nakkhattānam paramissariyam pavatteti iti indu candaḥ
translated: “It is a stake” (saṃku) is “it is mixed” (saṃkirati). “It is the moon” (indu) is “it moves” (indati).

original: Andanti bandhanti sattā etāyāti andu=saṅkhalikā. Yajanti anenāti yaju=vedo. Paṭati🔽byattabhāvaṃ gacchatīti paṭu=vicakkhaṇo. Aṇati sukhumabhāvena pavattatīti aṇu=sukhumo,
analyzed: andanti bandhanti sattāḥ etāya ati andu saṅkhalikāḥ yajanti anena ati yaju vedaḥ paṭati  byatta bhāvam gacchati iti paṭu vicakkhaṇaḥ sukhuma bhāvena pavattati iti aṇu sukhumaḥ
translated: “It is a chain” (andu) is “it binds beings” (andanti bandhanti sattā). “It is the Yajur Veda” (yaju) is “they sacrifice with it” (yajanti anena). “It is clever” (paṭu) is “it goes to a state of being cut up” (paṭati).

original: vīhibhedo ca. Asanti pavattanti sattā etehīti asavo=pāṇā. Sukhaṃ vasantyanenāti vasu=dhanaṃ.
analyzed: ca asanti pavattanti sattāḥ etehi iti sukham vasanti anena ati vasu dhanam
translated: “It is subtle” (aṇu) is “it proceeds by way of subtlety” (aṇati). “It is a grain” (aṇu) is “beings proceed from it” (asanti pavattanti sattā). “It is wealth” (vasu) is “they dwell happily with it” (sukhaṃ vasantyanena).

original: Pasīyati bādhīyati sāmikehīti pasu. Catuppado. Paṃsati sobhāvisesaṃ nāsetīti paṃsu=reṇu.
analyzed: pasīyati bādhīyati sāmikehi iti catuppadaḥ paṃsati sobhā visesam nāseti iti paṃsu reṇu
translated: “It is an animal” (pasu) is “it is pleased” (pasīyati) “and is hindered” (bādhīyati) “by its owner”. “It is dust” (paṃsu) is “it removes a special beauty” (sobhāvisesaṃ nāseti).

original: Bandhīyati sinehabhāvenāti bandhu=ñāti.🔽3. Bandhā ū vadho ca.
analyzed: bandhīyati sineha bhāvena ati  bandhau u vadho ca
translated: It is a kinsman because of being bound by affection.

original: Bandha-bandhane timasmā ū hoti, bandhassa vadhādeso ca. Pañcahi kāmaguṇehi attani satthe bandhatīti vadhū-suṇisā, itthīca.
analyzed: bandha bandhane timasmai hoti bandhassa vadha ādesaḥ ca pañcahi kāmaguṇehi satthe bandhati iti vadhū suṇisā itthī ca
translated: The word bandhu is derived from the root bandh with the ū affix, and the vowel a of the root is elided. The ū affix is added to the root bandh with the ū affix, and the vowel a of the root is elided. The word vadhū is derived from the root vadh with the ū affix, and the vowel a of the root is elided. The word vadhū is a young woman who binds herself to her husband with the five strands of sense pleasure.

original: 4. Jambādayo.🔽Jambūādayo saddāūpaccayantā nipaccante, nipātanaṃ appattassa pāpanaṃ pattassa paṭisedho🔽ca. Janismā ū, bukāgamo, “manānaṃ niggahīta”nti (5.96) nassa niggahītaṃ, “vagge vagganto”ti🔽(1.41) niggahītassa mo, jāyati, janīyatī vā jambū=rukkho. Bhamissa amalopo, bhamati🔽kampatīti bhū=bhamu. Karotismā ū, tassa kandhuña ca, “pararūpamayakāre byañjane”ti
analyzed: jamba ādayaḥ  jambu ādayaḥ nipaccante nipātanam appattassa pāpanam pattassa paṭisedhaḥ  ca jani smai u buka āgamaḥ manānam niggahītanti nassa niggahītam vagge  niggahītassa maḥ jāyati janīyatī vā jambu rukkhaḥ bhamissa ama lopaḥ bhamati  kampati iti ca para rūpam a yakāre byañjanā iti
translated: The words jambū, etc.

original: (5.95) dhātvantassa byañjanassa pararūpattaṃ, rudhiruppādaṃ karotīti kakkandhū=badarī.
analyzed: dhātu antassa byañjanassa rudhira uppādam karoti iti kakkandhūbadarī
translated: The words jambū, etc. are formed by the addition of the ū affix, which causes the elision of the final vowel of the preceding word. The ū affix is added to the word jambū, and the final vowel is elided. The word jambū is a tree. The word bhū is formed by the addition of the ū affix to the root bhu, and the vowel a of the root is elided. The word bhū is the earth, which moves and trembles. The word kakandhu is formed by the addition of the ū affix to the root kar, and the vowel a of the root is elided. The ū affix is added to the root kar with the ū affix, and the vowel a of the root is elided. The ū affix is added to the root kar with the ū affix, and the vowel a of the root is elided. The ū affix is added to the root kar with the ū affix, and the vowel a of the root is elided. The ū affix is added to the root kar with the ū affix, and the vowel a of the root is elided. The ū affix is added to the root kar with the ū affix, and the vowel a of the root is elided. The ū affix is added to the root kar with the ū affix, and the vowel a of the root is elided. The ū affix is added to the root kar with the ū affix, and the vowel a of the root is elided. The ū affix is added to the root kar with the ū affix, and the vowel a of the root is elided. The ū affix is added to the root kar with the ū affix, and the vowel a of the root is elided. The ū affix is added to the root kar with the ū affix, and the

original: Lamba-avasaṃsane, āpubbo, saṃyogādilopadīgharassā, ālambati avasaṃsatīti alābū=tumbi.🔽Sara-gati hiṃsācintāsu, ūmhi abhuka abuka ca, sarati gacchatīti sarabhū=ekā mahānadī.
analyzed: lamba avasaṃsane āpubbaḥ saṃyoga ādi lopa dīgha rassā ālambati avasaṃsati iti alābū tumbi  hiṃsā cintāsu ca sarati gacchati iti sarabhūekā mahā nadī
translated: In alābū = tumbī, the meaning is “it clings to and clings to” (alābati avasaṃsati),🔽In sarabhū = a great river, the meaning is “it flows” (sarati),🔽In sarabū = a small animal, the meaning is “it flows and it harms living beings” (sarati pāṇe hiṃsati),

original: Sarati pāṇe hiṃsatīti sarabū=khuddajantukaviseso. Camaadane, camati bhakkhati nivāpanti
analyzed: sarati pāṇe hiṃsati iti cama adane camati bhakkhati nivāpanti
translated: In camū = an army, the meaning is “it moves and it eats and it devours” (camati bhakkhati nivāpeti),

original: camū=senā. Tana-vitthāre, tanoti saṃsāradukkhanti tanu=sarīraṃ, evamaññepi payogato daṭṭhabbā.
analyzed: camū senā tana vitthāre tanoti saṃsāra dukkhan ti tanu sarīram evam aññe pi payogataḥ daṭṭhabbā
translated: In tanu = body, the meaning is “it stretches out” (tanoti) the suffering of the round of rebirths, and so in other usages too it should be seen.

original: 5. Tapusa vi dha kura putha mudā ku.
analyzed: tapusa vi dha kura putha mudā ku
translated: . Ku is formed from tapa, us, vidha, kura, putha, and muda.

original: Tapa-santāpe, usa-dāhe, vidha-vedhane, kura-sadde, putha patha-vitthāre, muda-tose,
analyzed: tapa santāpe usa dāhe vidha vedhane kura sadde putha patha vitthāre muda tose
translated: In tapa = torment, us = burning, vidha = affliction, kura = sound, putha = spreading, muda = pain,

original: etehi ku, hoti. Kakāronubandho “na te kānubandhanāgamesū”ti (5.85) eonamabhāvattho.
analyzed: etehi hoti kakāraḥ anubandhaḥ na te ka anubandhana āgamesu iti
translated: ku is formed from these. The k is in apposition, because of the rule “na te kānubandhanāgamesu” (.) The meaning is non-existence of e.🔽The measure of this is only by the definition “torment” (tapa), in tipu = a kind of metal, the meaning is “it is heated” (tāpīyati),

original: Tapa iti niddesatova assa ittaṃ, tāpīyatīti tipu=lohaviseso. Usati dāhaṃ karotīti
analyzed: tapaḥ iti niddesato va assa tāpīyati iti tipu loha visesaḥ usati dāham karoti iti
translated: In usati = it burns,

original: usu=saro. Vedhati raṃsīhi timiranti vidhu=cando. Kurati kiccākiccaṃ vadatīti kuru=rājā,
analyzed: ususaraḥ vedhati vidhucando kurati kiccākiccam vadati iti kuru rājā
translated: “The water-lily” (usabha) is the lotus. “The moon” (vidhu) is the moon. “The doer of what should and should not be done” (kuru) is the king.

original: kuravo=janapado. Puthati mahanthabhāvena patthiratīti puthu=vitthiṇṇo, modanaṃ, mudīyatīti vā mudu=athaddho.
analyzed: kuravojanapadaḥ mahantha bhāvena patthirati iti puthu vitthiṇṇaḥ modanam mudīyati iti vā
translated: Usu = saro. Vedhati raṃsīhi timiranti vidhu = cando. Kurati kiccākiccaṃ vadatīti kuru = rājā, kuravo = janapado. Puthati mahanthabhāvena patthiratīti puthu = vitthiṇṇo, modanaṃ, mudīyatīti vā mudu = athaṇḍho.

original: 6. Sindhādayo.
analyzed: sindhā ādayaḥ
translated: . Sindhādayo.

original: Sindhu ādayo kupaccayantā nipaccante. Sanda-passavane, assa ittaṃ, dhocāntā deso
analyzed: sindhu ādayaḥ ku paccayantāḥ nipaccante sanda passavane assaḥ desaḥ
translated: Sindhu ādayo kupaccayantā nipaccante. Sanda-passavane, assa ittaṃ, dhocāntā deso

original: nipātanā, sandati passavatīti sindhu=nadi, vahisupantassa dīghādibatte, bādhissa
analyzed: nipātanā sandati passavati iti sindhu nadi vahi supantassa dīgha ādi batte bādhissa
translated: nipātanā, sandati passavatīti sindhu = nadi, vahisupantassa dīghādibatte, bādhissa

original: vāntahatte ca, vahantyanenāti bāhu, bādhati upaddave vāretī ti vā bāhu=bhujo. Raṃgha-gamane,
analyzed: vānta hatte ca vahanti anena ati bāhu bādhati upaddave ti vā bāhu bhujaḥ raṃgha gamane
translated: vāntahatte ca, vahantyanenāti bāhu, bādhati upaddave vāretī ti vā bāhu = bhujo. Raṃgha-gamane,

original: niggahītalopo, raṅghati pavattahi rājadhammeti raghu=rājā. Vida-lābhe, nakārāgamo,
analyzed: niggahīta lopaḥ raṅghati rājadhamma iti raghurājā vida lābhe nakāra āgamaḥ
translated: niggahītalopo, raṅghati pavattahi rājadhammeti raghu = rājā. Vida-lābhe, nakārāgamo,

original: vassa bo, vindatyanena nandananti bindu=kaṇikā. Mana-ñāṇe, nassa dho, maññati ñāyati
analyzed: vassa baḥ vindati anena bindu kaṇikā mana ñāṇe nassa dhaḥ maññati ñāyati
translated: vassa bo, vindatyanena nandananti bindu = kaṇikā. Mana-ñāṇe, nassa dho, maññati ñāyati

original: madhuranti madhu=madhukarīhi katamadhu, rapa lapa japa jappa-vacane, assaittaṃ, rapati
analyzed: madhuranti madhu madhukarīhi kata madhu rapa lapa japa jappa vacane rapati
translated: Sweet: honey is made by bees, rap, lapa, japa, jappa are words for talking, ass is a horse, it raps,

original: jappati mantantī ripu=paccāmitto. Sasa-gati hiṃ sāpāṇanesu, assa uttaṃ, sasati jīvatīti
analyzed: jappati mantantī ripu pacca amittaḥ sasagati him sā pāṇanesu assaḥ uttam sasati jīvati iti
translated: it talks, it recites mantras, a foe = an enemy. Sasa is a hare, gati is going, hiṃ is a cry, sā is a bird, in the sense of ‘having wings’, ass is a horse, utta is a head, it has, it lives,🔽susu is young. Ara is going, ass is a horse, utta is a head, it goes, it becomes great,

original: susu=yuvā. Ara gamane, assautta mūttañca, arati mahantabhāvaṃ gacchatīti uru=mahā,
analyzed: gamane arati mahanta bhāvam gacchati iti uru mahā
translated: it goes to a great state, therefore uru = great,

original: aratinenāti ūru-satthi. Khaṇa-avadāraṇe, ā pubbo analopo, ākhanatīti ākhu=undūro.
analyzed: ūrusatthi khaṇa avadāraṇe ā pubbaḥ an a lopaḥ ākhanati iti ākhuundūraḥ
translated: it is called ūru-satthi. Khaṇa is breaking, ā is a prefix, analopo = not small, it breaks, therefore ākhu = a lizard.

original: Tarataraṇe, tassa tho, taratīti tharu=khaggāvayavo. Laṃgha-gati sosanesu ghassa vā🔽hattaṃ, niggahītalopo ca, laṅghati pavattati laghubhāvenāti laghu lahū ekatthā, (bhaṃja-omaddane,
analyzed: tara taraṇe tassa tho tarati iti tharu khagga avayavaḥ laṃgha gati sosanesu ghassa vā  ca laṅghati pavattati laghu bhāvena ati laghu lahū ekatthā
translated: Tar is crossing, tassa tho = tharu = a part of a sword. Laṃgha is leaping, gati is going, sosana is drying, ghassa is a hand, vā is or,

original: pa-pubbo, jassa gattaṃ, pabhañjati visesenāti pabhaṅgu=bhaṅguro.) Ṭhā-gatinivattiyaṃ,
analyzed: papubbaḥ jassa gattam pabhañjati visesena ati pabhaṅgu bhaṅguraḥ ṭhā gati nivattiyam
translated: it is called laṅghati = it moves, it goes, because of its light nature. Laghu and lahū are synonyms. (Bhaṃja is breaking, o is a prefix, jassa gattaṃ = pabhañjati = it breaks, therefore pabhaṅgu = a broken thing.) Ṭhā is going and returning,

original: supubbo, ṭhāti pavattati sundarabhāvenāti suṭṭhu=sobhanaṃ, dupubbo ṭhāti pavattati
analyzed: su pubbaḥ ṭhā ti pavattati sundara bhāvena ati suṭṭhu sobhanam du pubbaḥ ṭhā ti pavattati
translated: supubbo = it stands, it moves, because of its beautiful nature, therefore suṭṭhu = beautiful. Dupubbo = it stands, it moves, because of its

original: asundarabhāvenāti duṭṭhu=asobhanaṃ. Evamaññepi viññeyyā.
analyzed: asundara bhāvena ati evam aññe pi viññeyyā
translated: by way of the ugly, it is ugly. So too in other instances.

original: 7. I.🔽Kriyatthā bahulaṃ i hoti, abha-khepane, asīyati khipīyatīti asi=khaggo. Kasa-vilekhane,🔽kasīyate kasi=kasanaṃ. Masa-āmasane, masīyatīti masi=meḷā. Ku-sadde o avādesā, kavati🔽kathebhīti kavi=kabbakāro. Rusadde, ravati gajjatīti ravi=ādicco. Sappa-gamane, sappati🔽pavattatīti sappi=ghataṃ. Gantha-ganthane, “ta tha na rānaṃ ṭa ṭha ṇalā”ti (1.25)🔽nathānaṃ ṇaṭhā, ganthetīti gaṇṭhi=pabbo, gaṇṭhica. Rāja-dittiyaṃ, rājati pavattatīti🔽rāji=pāḷi. Kala-saṅkhyāne, kalīyati parimīyatīti kali=pāpaṃ. Bala-pāṇane, balanti
analyzed: i  kriyatthā bahulam hoti abhakhepane asīyati khipīyati iti asikhaggaḥ kasa vilekhane  kasīyate kasikasanam masa āmasane masīyati iti masimeḷā ku sadde o a vādesā kavati  kathebhi iti kavi kabba kāraḥ ru sadde ravati gajjati iti ravi ādiccaḥ sappa gamane sappati  pavattati iti gantha ganthane ta tha na ra ṭa ṭha  nathānam ṇaṭhā gantheti iti gaṇṭhi pabbaḥ gaṇṭhi ca rājadittiyam rājati pavattati iti  rājipāḷi kala saṅkhyāne kalīyati parimīyati iti kalipāpam bala pāṇane
translated: 7. I.🔽Kriyattha (is the base of the following words):🔽Khipīyati = asi = sword.🔽Kasiyati = kasi = ploughing.🔽Masīyati = masi = a heap.🔽Ku = sound. O = avād (a kind of musical instrument). Kavati = kavi = a poet.🔽Ravi = sound. Ravati = gajjati = ravi = the sun.🔽Sappati = pavattati = sappi = ghee.🔽Gantha = binding. “Ta tha na rānaṃ ṭa ṭha ṇalā” (1.25).🔽The nas of the nas are ṭha ṇalā. Ganthetīti = gaṇṭhi = a pebble, a knot.🔽Rājati = pavattati = rājī = a line.🔽Kala = counting. Kalīyati = parimīyati = kali = sin.🔽Balanti = balati = bala = strength.

original: jīvanti anenāti bali=karo. Dhana-sadde, dhanati nadatīti dhani=saddo. Acca añca-pūjāyaṃ,
analyzed: jīvanti anena ati bali karaḥ dhana sadde dhanati nadati iti dhani saddaḥ acca
translated: I is the base for the verbal noun in -ana, e.g. abha-khepane = abhañjanam, asīyati khipīyatīti = asi = khaggo, kasa-vilekhane = kasanam, masi-āmasane = masi = meḷā, ku-sadde = kavati = kavi = kabbakāro, rusadde = ravati gajjatīti = ravi = ādicco, sappa-gamane = sappati = sappi = ghataṃ, gantha-ganthane = ganthetīti = gaṇṭhi = pabbo, gaṇṭhica, rāja-dittiyaṃ = rājati pavattatīti = rājī = pāḷi, kala-saṅkhyāne = kalīyati parimīyatīti = kali = pāpaṃ, bala-pāṇane = balanti jīvanti anenāti = bali = karo, dhana-sadde = dhanati nadatīti = dhani = saddo, acca añca-pūjāyaṃ =

original: accīyati pūjīyatīti acci=jālā. Vala valla-saṃvaraṇe, valanaṃ saṃkocanaṃ vali=udarādīsu
analyzed: accīyati pūjīyati iti accijālā vala valla saṃvaraṇe valanam saṃkocanam vali udara ādīsu
translated: It burns, it is worshipped, thus it is a flame (acci) = a flame (jālā).🔽Vala = contraction, folding up, a fold (vali) = in the belly, etc.

original: pali, vallīyanti saṃvarīyanti sattā etāyāti valli=latā. Vimhi valī vallītipi hoti,
analyzed: vallīyanti saṃvarīyanti sattā
translated: Pali = a fold (vali) = a creeper (valli). It is also (called) valī and vallī.

original: soyevattho, evamaññepi.
analyzed: evam aññe pi
translated: The meaning is the same, so also in other (words).

original: 8. Dajhādayo.
analyzed: da jha ādayaḥ
translated: . Dajhādayo.

original: Dadhiādayo saddā ipaccayantā nipaccante. Dhā-dhāraṇe, dvibhāvo nipātanā, ghatamādadhātīti
analyzed: dadhi ādayaḥ saddāḥ nipaccante dha ādhāraṇe dvi bhāvaḥ nipātanā gha tam ādadhāti iti
translated: The words dadhi, etc., with the suffix i, are inflected. Dhā = to hold, the double consonant is for the purpose of lengthening the vowel, he holds a pot, thus

original: dadhi=gora saviseso. Aṃha-gamane, niggahītalopo, aṃhati gacchatīti ahi=sappo. Kampa
analyzed: sa visesaḥ aṃha gamane niggahīta lopaḥ aṃhati gacchati iti ahi sappaḥ
translated: dadhi = a particular kind of curd (gora). Aṃha = to go, the vowel is elided, it goes and moves, thus ahi = a snake. Kampa

original: calane, saṃyogādilopo, kampati calatīti kapi=vānaro. Mana-ñāṇe, assa uttaṃ, manati
analyzed: calane saṃyoga ādi lopaḥ kampati calati iti kapi vānaraḥ assa uttam manati
translated: = to shake, the compound is elided, it shakes, it moves, thus kapi = a monkey. Mana = to know, the vowel is elided, it knows,

original: jānātīti muni=samaṇo. Nassa ṇattaṃ, manati mahagghabhāvaṃ gacchatītī maṇi=ratanaṃ.
analyzed: jānāti iti muni samaṇaḥ manati mahaggha bhāvam gacchati iti maṇi ratanam
translated: it understands, thus muni = an ascetic. The vowel is elided, it knows, it goes to a high state, thus maṇi = a gem.

original: Ikkha cakkha-dassane, issa attaṃ ikkhati anenāti akkhi=nayanaṃ. Kamapavikkhepe, assa
analyzed: ikkha cakkha dassane issaḥ attam ikkhati anena ati akkhi nayanam kama pa vikkhepe assa
translated: Ikkha = to see, the vowel is elided, it sees itself by this, thus akkhi = an eye. Kama = to scatter, the vowel is elided,

original: ittaṃ, kamati yātīti kimi=khuddajantukaviseso. Tara taraṇe, tittirādeso, turito tarati
analyzed: kamati yāti iti tara taraṇe tittira ādesaḥ turitaḥ tarati
translated: Ittaṃ, kamati yātīti kimi = a kind of small animal. Tara taraṇe, tittirādeso, turito tarati

original: yātīti tittiri=pakkhiviseso. Kīḷa-vihāre, īssa ettaṃ, kīḷanaṃ keḷi=kīḷā. Usismā issa
analyzed: yāti iti tittiri pakkhi viseso kīḷa vihāre ettam kīḷanam keḷi kīḷā
translated: yātīti tittiri = a kind of bird. Kīḷa-vihāre, īssa ettaṃ, kīḷanaṃ keḷi = play. Usismā issa

original: khaluña, usati dahatī ukkhali=bhājanaṃ, evamaññepi.
analyzed: khaluñe usati dahatī ukkhali bhājanam evam aññe pi
translated: khaluña, usati dahatī ukkhali = a cooking pot, so too in other cases.

original: 9. Yuvaṇṇupantā ki.
analyzed: yuva ṇu pantā ki
translated: . Yuvaṇṇupantā ki.

original: Ivaṇṇupantehi ca uvaṇṇupantehi ca kriyatthehi bahulaṃ ki hoti. Kakāro-nubandho, isa
analyzed: ca u aṇṇu pantehi ca kriyatthehi bahulam ki hoti kakāraḥ anubandhaḥ
translated: Ivaṇṇupantehi ca uvaṇṇupantehi ca kriyatthehi bahulaṃ ki hoti. Kakāro-nubandho, isa

original: sisa-icchāyaṃ, sivaṃ icchatīti isi=tapassī. Gira-nigiraṇe, girati pasavati chavimaṃsasārabhūtaṃ
analyzed: sisaicchāyam sivam icchati iti isita passī gira nigiraṇe girati pasavati chavi maṃsa sāra bhūtam
translated: sisa-icchāyaṃ, sivaṃ icchatīti isi = an ascetic. Gira-nigiraṇe, girati pasavati chavimaṃsasārabhūtaṃ

original: bhesajjādinti giri=selo. Suca-socane. Socanaṃ suci=soceyyaṃ, ruca-abhilāse rucanti
analyzed: bhesajja adinti giriselaḥ suca socane socanam sucisoceyyam ruca abhilāse rucanti
translated: bhesajjādinti giri = a rock. Suca-socane. Socanaṃ suci = purity, ruca-abhilāse rucanti

original: etāyāti ruci=ābhilāso, evamaññepi.
analyzed: ruci abhilāsaḥ evam aññe pi
translated: etāyāti ruci = desire, so too in other cases.

original: 10. Vapa vara vasa rasa nabha hara hana paṇā iṇa.
analyzed: vapa vara vasa rasa nabha hara hana paṇā iṇa
translated: . Vapa vara vasa rasa nabha hara hana paṇā iṇa.

original: Vapa-bījanikkhepe, vara-varaṇasambhattīsu, vasa-nivāse, rasa-assādane, nabha-hiṃsāyaṃ,
analyzed: vapa bīja nikkhepe vara varaṇa sambhattīsu vasa nivāse rasa assādane nabha hiṃsāyam
translated: Vapa-bījanikkhepe, vara-varaṇasambhattīsu, vasa-nivāse, rasa-assādane, nabha-hiṃsāyaṃ,

original: hara haraṇe, hana hiṃsāyaṃ, paṇa-byavahārathutisu, etehi iṇa hoti. Vapanti etāyāti
analyzed: hara haraṇe hana hiṃsa ayam paṇa byavahāra thutisu vapanti
translated: Hara is for taking away, hana is for killing, paṇa is for a debt, byavahāra is for a legal case, thuti is for praise, with these iṇa is for a debt.🔽Vapanti etāyāti

original: vāpi=jalāsayo. Vārenti etenāti vāri=jalaṃ. Vasanti etāyāti vāsi=tacchaka bhaṇḍaṃ.
analyzed: vāpi jala asayaḥ etena ati vāri jalam vasanti
translated: vāpi=a water-basin. Vārenti etenāti vāri=water. Vasanti etāyāti vāsi=a cloth.

original: Rasīyati assādanavasena samo sarīyatīti rāsi=samūho. Nabhati hiṃsatīti nābhi=sarīrāvayavo.
analyzed: rasīyati assādana vasena samaḥ sarīyati iti rāsi samūhaḥ nabhati hiṃsati iti nābhi sarīra avayavaḥ
translated: Rasīyati assavanavasena samo sarīyatīti rāsi=a heap. Nabhati hiṃsatīti nābhi=a part of the body.

original: Hāretīti hāri=manuññaṃ. “Hanassa ghāto ṇānubandhe” (5.99) ti hanassa ghāto, hananti
analyzed: hāreti iti hāri manuññam hanassa ghātaḥ ti hanassa ghātaḥ hananti
translated: Hāretīti hāri=what is pleasing. “Hanassa ghāto ṇānubandhe” (.) ti hanassa ghāto, hananti

original: etenāti ghāti=paharaṇaṃ, paṇati voharatīti pāṇi, paṇati voharati etenāti vā pāṇi=karo.
analyzed: etena ati ghāti paharaṇam paṇati voharati iti pāṇi paṇati voharati etena ati vā pāṇi karaḥ
translated: etenāti ghāti=a weapon, paṇati voharatīti pāṇi, paṇati voharati etenāti vā pāṇi=a hand.

original: 11. Bhūgamā īṇa.
analyzed: bhū gamāḥ īṇa
translated: . Bhūgamā īṇa.

original: Bhū-sattāyaṃ, ama gama-gamane etehi īṇa hoti bhavissati kāle. Bhavissatīti bhāvī=bhavissamāno. Gamissatīti gāmī=gamissāmāno.
analyzed: bhūsatta ayam ama gama gamane etehi hoti bhavissati kāle bhavissati iti bhāvībhavissamānaḥ gamissati iti gāmīgamissāmānaḥ
translated: Bhū-sattāyaṃ, ama gama-gamane, with these īṇa is for a debt, will be at the right time. Will be is bhāvī=what will be, will go is gāmī=what will go.

original: 12. Tandalakkhā ī.
analyzed: tanda lakkhāḥ ī
translated: . Tandalakkhā ī.

original: Tanda-ālasiye, lakkha-dassanaṅkesu, etehi ī hoti. Tandanaṃ tandī=ālasyaṃ, lakkhīyanti sattā etāyāti lakkhī=sirī.
analyzed: tanda ālasiye lakkha dassa naṅkesu etehi ī hoti tandanam tandī ālasyam lakkhīyanti sattāḥ etāya ati lakkhīsirī
translated: Tanda-laziness, lakkha-seeing, with these ī is. Tandanam tandī=laziness, lakkhīyanti sattā etāyāti lakkhī=fortune.

original: 13. Gamā ro.
analyzed: gamā raḥ
translated: 13. Gamā ro.

original: Gamismā ro hoti. “Rānubandhentasarādissā”ti (4.132) amalopo, gacchatīti go=pasu.
analyzed: raḥ hoti ama lopaḥ gacchati iti gopasu
translated: In gamismā ro is formed. “Rānubandhentasarādissā” ( ) the anusvāra is elided. Go = animal, because it goes.

original: (Iti sarapaccayavidhānaṃ).
analyzed: iti sara pad caya vidhānam
translated: (Thus the rules for the formation of the verbal nouns in sar are completed).

original: 14. I bhī kā karāra vaka saka vāhi ko.
analyzed: i bhī kā karāra vaka saka vāhi ko
translated: . I bhī kā karāra vaka saka vāhi ko.

original: I-ajjhena gatīsu, bhī-bhaye, kā gā-sadde, kara-karaṇe, ara-gamane, kuka vaka-ādāne,
analyzed: iajjhena gatīsu bhī bhaye kā gāsadde kara karaṇe ara gamane kuka vaka ādāne
translated: In the meanings of “going” and so on, in fear, in sound, in action, in going, in taking,

original: saka-sattiyaṃ, vā-gatibandhanesu, etehi kapaccayo hoti. Eti pavattatīti eto=asahāyo.
analyzed: saka sattiyam vā agati bandhanesu etehi ka paccayaḥ hoti eti pavattati iti
translated: in striking, in motion, in binding, these are formed with the suffix ka. Eti pavattatīti eto = asahāyo.

original: Bhāyanti etasmāti bheko=maṇḍūko. Kāyati saddaṃ karotīti kāko=vāyaso. Karoti vaṇṇakanti
analyzed: bhāyanti etasmā ati bhekaḥ maṇḍūko kāyati saddam karoti iti kākaḥ vāyaso karoti
translated: Bhāyanti etasmāti bheko = maṇḍūko. Kāyati saddaṃ karotīti kāko = vāyaso. Karoti vaṇṇakanti

original: kakko=vaṇṇaviseso, pisitadabbañca. Arati yātīti akko=sūro, viṭapiviseso ca. Vakati
analyzed: arati yāti iti akkosūraḥ viṭapi viseso ca
translated: kakko = a kind of colour, and pounded herbs. Arati yātīti akko = sūro, and a kind of creeper. Vakati

original: odanaṃ ādadātīti vakkaṃ=dehakoṭṭhāsaviseso, sakkatīti sakko-devindo, samattho ca.
analyzed: odanaṃ ādadāti iti sakkati iti sakko devindo samattho ca
translated: odanaṃ ādadātīti vakkaṃ = a kind of bodily part. Sakkatīti sakko = devindo, and able.

original: Vāti bandhati etenāti vāko=vakkalaṃ.
analyzed: vāti bandhati etena ati vākovakkalam
translated: Vāti bandhati etenāti vāko = vakkalaṃ.

original: 15. Ñukādayo.
analyzed: ñuka ādayaḥ
translated: . Ñukādayo.

original: Ñukādayo kapaccayantā nipaccante. Ūha-vitakke, halopo nipātanā ūhīyati vicinīyatīti🔽ūkā-okodanī. Unda kiledane, saṃyogādi lopo, aka ca. Undati dravaṃ karotīti udakaṃ=jalaṃ.
analyzed: ñuka ādayaḥ ka pacca yantāḥ nipaccante ūha vitakke ha lopaḥ nipātanāḥ ūhīyati vicinīyati iti  unda kiledane saṃyoga ādi lopaḥ ca undati dravam karoti iti uda kaṃjalam
translated: The words ñukā, etc., are formed by the addition of k to the stems. The word ūhīyati is formed by the addition of the suffix īya to ūha, and then the vowel of the stem is lengthened. The word ūhīyati means “is sought after.”🔽The word ūkā is formed by the addition of the suffix ka to ūha, and then the vowel of the stem is lengthened. The word ūkā means “a mosquito.” The word unda is formed by the addition of the suffix da to unda, and then the vowel of the stem is lengthened. The word unda means “to torment.”🔽The word udaka is formed by the addition of the suffix aka to ud, and then the vowel of the stem is lengthened. The word udaka means “water.”

original: Bhī-bhaye, ettābhāvo, bhāyanti etasmāti bhīko=bhīru. Saka-sattiyaṃ, upantassi, sakkoti
analyzed: bhī bhaye bhāyanti etasmā ati bhīkobhīru sakasattiyam upantassi sakkoti
translated: The word bhīko is formed by the addition of the suffix ko to bhī, and then the vowel of the stem is lengthened. The word bhīko means “a coward.” The word sikkā is formed by the addition of the suffix k to saka, and then the vowel of the stem is lengthened. The word sikkā means “a special kind of implement.”

original: dhāretunti sikkā=upakaraṇaviseso. Hā-cāge, hīyati sādhūhi jahīyatīti hāko=kodho.🔽Samba-maṇḍane, kassa uña, sambati udakaṃ maṇḍetīti sambuko=jalajantuvisebho. Putha🔽patha-vitthāre, ottābhāvo, kassa uña, puthati pattharati attano bālabhāvanti puthuko=bālo.🔽Suca-soke, socanti etenāti sukkaṃ=sambhavo, setañca. Ci-caye, upapubbo, ettābhāvo,
analyzed: dhāretum ti sikkā upakaraṇa visesaḥ hā cāge hīyati sādhūhi jahīyati iti hā kokodhaḥ  samba maṇḍane kassa udakam maṇḍeti iti  patha vitthāre kassa uña puthati pattharati attanaḥ bāla bhāvanti puthukaḥ bālaḥ  suca soke socanti etena ati sukkaṃsambhavaḥ setañca cicaye upapubbaḥ ettābhāvaḥ
translated: The word hāko is formed by the addition of the suffix ko to hā, and then the vowel of the stem is lengthened. The word hāko means “anger.”🔽The word sambuko is formed by the addition of the suffix ku to samba, and then the vowel of the stem is lengthened. The word sambuko means “a special kind of water animal.” The word puthuko is formed by the addition of the suffix ku to putha, and then the vowel of the stem is lengthened. The word puthuko means “a fool.”

original: upacinantīti upacikā=vammika kārā. Kampa-calane, kampissa paṃ, kampati calatīti paṅko=kaddamo.
analyzed: upacinanti iti kārā kampa calane kampissa kampati calati iti paṅkokaddamaḥ
translated: The word sukka is formed by the addition of the suffix ka to suca, and then the vowel of the stem is lengthened. The word sukka means “a birth” and “white.” The word upacikā is formed by the addition of the suffix ka to ci, and then the vowel of the stem is lengthened. The word upacikā means “an ant hill.” The word paṅko is formed by the addition of the suffix ko to kampa, and then the vowel of the stem is lengthened. The word paṅko means “mud.”

original: Usa-dāhe, usatīti ukkā=jālā. Kassa muña, usati dahatībhi ummukaṃ=alātaṃ. Vama-uggiraṇe,
analyzed: usa dāhe usati iti ukkā jālā kassa muñe usati dahatībhi vama oggiraṇe
translated: In the burning of a fire, the flame is called a “fire-brand” (usati). In the burning of a fire, the fire-brand is called a “brand” (usati). In the throwing out of the vomit,

original: kassa miña, vamīyatīti vammiko=upacikākato cayo, masa-āmasane, sassa tthaṅa, masīyati
analyzed: kassa miña vamīyati iti cayaḥ masa āmasane sassa tthaṅa masīyati
translated: In the eating of the earth, the heap of ants is called an “anthill” (vammiyati). In the striking of the month, the head is called a “skull” (masīyati). In the loving of the earth,

original: pemenāti matthakaṃ=sīsaṃ, evamaññepi.
analyzed: pemena ati matthaka sīsam evam aññe pi
translated: the head is called a “skull” (pemeti). In the same way in other cases.

original: 16. Bhītvā nako.
analyzed: bhītvā nakaḥ
translated: . Out of fear, the “naka”.

original: Bhī-bhaye tīmasmā ānako hoti. Bhāyanti etasmāki bhayānako=bhayajanako.
analyzed: bhī bhaye ānakaḥ bhāyanti bhayānaka ubhaya janakaḥ
translated: The “naka” is formed from the root “bhī” (to fear) with the affix “tvas”. “They fear from this” (bhīyanti etasmā), therefore it is called “bhīṣaṇa” (fearful, terrifying).

original: 17. Siṅghā āṇikāṭakā.
analyzed: siṅghā āṇikāṭakā
translated: . The “siṅghāṇikā” and the “siṅghāṭaka”.

original: Siṅgha-ghāyanetīmasmā āṇika āṭakā honti. “Itthiyamatvā”ti 93.260 ā, siṅghayati passavatīti siṅghāṇikā=nāsāssavo. Siṅghati ekībhāvaṃ yātīti siṅghāṭakaṃ=vīthicatukkaṃ.
analyzed: āṇike āṭakāḥ honti itthiyam atvā ati ā siṅghayati passavati iti siṅghāṇikā nāsā ssavaḥ siṅghati ekībhāvam yāti iti siṅghāṭakam vīthi catukkam
translated: The affixes “āṇika” and “āṭaka” are formed from the root “siṅgha” (to smell) with the affixes “tvas” and “ka”. “It smells the woman” (itthiyam atvā), therefore it is called “siṅghāṇikā” (nose). “It smells, it becomes one” (siṅghati ekībhāvaṃ yāti), therefore it is called “siṅghāṭaka” (nostril).

original: 18. Karāditvako.
analyzed: kara ādi tva ko
translated: . The “kara” and others.

original: Kara-karaṇe, sara-gatihiṃsācintāsu, nara-naye, tarataraṇe, vara-varaṇa sambhattīsu,
analyzed: kara karaṇe sara gati hiṃsā cintāsu nara naye tara taraṇe vara varaṇa sambhattīsu
translated: The affixes “tva” and “ka” are formed from the roots “kara” (to do), “sara” (to go, to hurt, to think), “nara” (to lead), “tara” (to cross), “vara” (to choose, to assemble),

original: jana-janane, kara-ditti gatikantīsu, kaṭa-mandane, kura-sadde, thu-abhitthave, evamādīhi
analyzed: jana janane kara ditti gati kantīsu kaṭa mandane kura sadde thu a bhitthave evamādīhi
translated: “jana” (to be born), “kara” (to see, to go, to shine), “kaṭa” (to crush), “kura” (to sound), “thu” (to strike), and so on.

original: ako hoti. Karīyatīti karako=kamaṇḍalu. Karotīti karakā=vassopalā. Sarati udakametthāti
analyzed: akaḥ hoti karīyati iti karaka ukamaṇḍalu karoti iti sarati udakam ettha ati
translated: is a water-pot. Karako=a water-pot. Karotīti karakā=rain-clouds. Sarati udakametthāti

original: sarako=pānabhājanaṃ. Naranti pāpuṇanti sattā etthāti narako=nirayo. Tarantyanenāti
analyzed: saraka upāna bhājanam pāpuṇanti sattāḥ ettha ati taranti anena ati
translated: sarako=a drinking-vessel. Naranti pāpuṇanti sattā etthāti narako=hell. Tarantyanenāti

original: tarako=taraṇaṃ. Vāretītivarako=varaṇo, dhaññaviseso ca. Janetīti janako=pitā. Kanati
analyzed: tarako taraṇam vāreti iti varakovaraṇaḥ dhañña viseso ca janeti iti jana kopitā kanati
translated: tarako=a raft. Vāretīti varako=a fence, a kind of grain. Janetīti janako=a father. Kanati

original: dibbatīti kanakaṃ=suvaṇṇaṃ. Kaṭati maddati ripavoti kaṭakaṃ=nagaraṃ. Kuratīti korako=kalikā.
analyzed: dibbati iti kanakam suvaṇṇam kaṭati maddati ripavaḥ iti kaṭakaṃnagaram kurati iti korakokalikā
translated: dibbatīti kanakaṃ=gold. Kaṭati maddati ripavoti kaṭakaṃ=a town. Kuratīti korako=a kind of grain.

original: Thavīyatīti thavako-guccho.
analyzed: thavīyati iti
translated: Thavīyatīti thavako=a kind of grain.

original: 19. Bala patehyāko.
analyzed: bala pate hyāko
translated: . Bala patehyāko.

original: Bala-pāṇane, pata patha-gamane, etehi āko hoti. Balati jīvatīti balākā=pakkhiviseso. Patati yātīti patākā=dhajo.
analyzed: bala pāṇane pata patha gamane etehi ākaḥ hoti balati jīvati iti balākā pakkhi viseso patati yāti iti patākā dhajaḥ
translated: Bala-pāṇane, pata patha-gamane, etehi āko hoti. Balati jīvatīti balākā=a kind of bird. Patati yātīti patākā=a banner.

original: 20. Sāmākādayo.
analyzed: sāmāka ādayaḥ
translated: . Sāmākādayo.

original: Sāmākaādayo ākantā nipaccante. Sā-tanu karaṇāvasānesu, sāssa muka, sāti dehaṃ ta
analyzed: sāmāka ādayaḥ ākantāḥ nipaccante karaṇa avasānesu sā assa deham
translated: Sāmākaādayo ākantā nipaccante. Sā-tanu karaṇāvasānesu, sāssa muka, sāti dehaṃ ta

original: nuṃ karotīti sāmāko=tiṇadhaññaṃ. Pā-pāne, inaṅa, pivati rattanti pināko=mahissaradhanu.
analyzed: num karoti iti pināko mahissara dhanu
translated: nuṃ karotīti sāmāko=wild rice. Pā-pāne, inaṅa, pivati rattanti pināko=a bull’s horn.

original: Gu-sadde, “yuvaṇṇāna miyaṅuvaṅa sare”ti (5.136) uvaṅa, gavati nadati etenāti guvako=pūgaphalaṃ.
analyzed: gusadde miyaṅ uvaṅa sara iti  uvaṅa gavati nadati etena ati
