translated: In the word guvaka, guvaka is a fruit tree, because it is called “a tree which is called guvaka” (yuvaṇṇāna miyaṅuvaṅa sare).

original: Aṭa paṭa-gamanatthā, paṭati yātīti paṭākā=vejayantī. Sala pila pala hula-gamanatthā,
analyzed: paṭa gamana atthā paṭati yāti iti paṭākā vejayantī
translated: In the word paṭākā, paṭākā is a banner, because it is called “a banner which goes by the word paṭa” (paṭa-gamanatthā). In the word salākā, salākā is a stick, because it is called “a stick which goes by the word sala” (sala pila pala hula-gamanatthā).

original: salati yātīti salākā=vejjopakaraṇadabbaṃ. Vida-ñāṇe, vidati jānātīti vidāko=vidvā.
analyzed: salati yāti iti salākā vejja upakaraṇa dabbam vida ñāṇe vidati jānāti iti
translated: In the word vidāko, vidāko is a wise man, because he is called “one who knows by the word vid” (vid-ñāṇe).🔽In the word piññāko, piññāko is a chessman, because it is called “one which is gambled with by the word paṇi” (paṇabyavahārathutīsu).

original: Paṇabyavahārathutīsu assa ittaṃ, ūka ca, paṇīyati voharīyatīti piññāko=tilakakko, evamaññepi.🔽21. Vicchālagamamusā kiko.🔽Vicchā-gamane, ala=bandhane, ama gama-gamane, musa-theyye, etehi kiko hoti. Vicchati
analyzed: paṇa byavahāra thutīsu ca paṇīyati voharīyati iti evam aññe pi  vicchā alagama musā kiko  vicchā gamane ala bandhane gama gamane musatheyye etehi kikaḥ hoti vicchati
translated: Vicchiko, alikaṃ, gamiko, mūsiko, kiṃkaṇikā, etc.🔽In the word vicchiko, vicchiko is an insect, because it is called “one which goes by the word vicchā” (vicchā-gamane).

original: yātīti vicchiko=kīṭo. Alati bandhati etenāti alikaṃ=asaccaṃ. Gacchatīti gamiko=gantā.
analyzed: yāti iti vicchikokīṭaḥ alati bandhati etena ati gacchati iti gamikaḥ gantā
translated: In the word alikaṃ, alikaṃ is a lie, because it is called “one which is bound by the word ala” (ala=bandhane). In the word gamiko, gamiko is a traveller, because it is called “one which goes by the word gama” (gama-gamane).

original: Musāti niddesā dīgho, musati thenetīti mūsiko=undūro.
analyzed: niddesāḥ dīghaḥ
translated: In the word mūsiko, mūsiko is a mouse, because it is called “one which steals by the word musa” (musāti niddesā dīgho).

original: 22. Kiṃkaṇikādayo.
analyzed: kiṃkaṇikā ādayaḥ
translated: Kiṃkaṇikā, etc.

original: Kiṃkaṇikādayo saddā kikantā nipaccante. Kaṇaiti daṇḍako dhātu saddattho, kassa dvittaṃ,
analyzed: kiṃkaṇikā ādayaḥ saddā kikantāḥ nipaccante daṇḍakaḥ dhātu sadda atthaḥ kassa
translated: The sounds of a little bell, etc., are kikantā, nipaccante. Kaṇa means a little, an element, a sound; kassa dvittaṃ,

original: assa ittaṃ, niggahītāgamo ca, kaṇati saddaṃ karotī kiṃkaṇikā=ghaṇḍikā. Muda-tose,
analyzed: ca kaṇati saddam karotī kiṃkaṇikā ghaṇḍikā
translated: assa ittaṃ, and niggahīta is added. Kaṇati, it makes a sound, is a little bell = a bell. Muda-tose,

original: dassa dvittaṃ, mudanti etamayāti muddikā=aṅguliyāveṭṭhanaṃ, phalaviseso a. Mahīyati
analyzed: dassa mudanti muddikā aṅguliyā āveṭṭhanam phala viseso
translated: dassa dvittaṃ, they are delighted with this, is a little finger = a covering for the finger, a kind of fruit. Mahīyati,

original: pūjīyatīti mahikā=himaṃ. Kala-saṅkhyāne, kalīyati parimītayatīti kalikā=korako. Sappa-gamane,
analyzed: kala saṅkhyāne kalīyati parimītayati iti
translated: it is worshipped, is a little earth = snow. Kala-saṅkhyāne, it is measured by this, is a little measure = a handful. Sappa-gamane,

original: assa ittaṃ. Sappati gacchatīti sippikā=jalajantuviseso, evamaññepi.
analyzed: assaḥ ittam sappati gacchati iti sippikā jala jantu viseso evam aññe pi
translated: assa ittaṃ. Sappati, it goes, is a little snake = a kind of water animal. So with the others.

original: 23. Isā kīko.
analyzed: isā kīko
translated: . Isā kīko.

original: Isa siṃsa-icchāyaṃ, iccasmā kīko hoti. Icchīyatīti isīkā=tūlanissayo.
analyzed: isa kīkaḥ hoti icchīyati iti isīkā tūla nissayo
translated: Isa siṃsa-icchāyaṃ, kīko is formed from iccasmā. It is desired, is a little thread = a spider’s web.

original: 24. Kamapadā ṇuko.
analyzed: kama padā ṇukaḥ
translated: . Kamapadā ṇuko.

original: Kama-icchāyaṃ, pada-gamane, etehi ṇuko hoti. “Ṇiṇāpīna”nti (5.160) yogavibhāgā ṇilopo. Kāmetīti kāmuko=kāmayitā. Pajjati yāti etāyāti pādukā=pādopakaraṇaṃ.
analyzed: pada gamane etehi ṇukaḥ hoti yogavibhāgāḥ yogavibhāgāḥ yogavibhāgāḥ kāmeti iti kāmukā u kāmayitā pajjati yāti pādukā pāda upakaraṇam
translated: Kama-icchāyaṃ, pada-gamane, ṇuko is formed from these. “Ṇiṇāpīna” , the ṇ is elided by the rule of division of a compound. It is desired, is a little desire = one who desires. It goes by this, is a little foot = a foot-covering.

original: 25. Maṇḍasalā ṇūko.
analyzed: maṇḍa salā ṇūkaḥ
translated: . Maṇḍasalā ṇūko.

original: Maṇḍa-bhūsane, sala-gamanattho daṇḍako dhātu, etehi ṇūko hoti. Maṇḍeti jalaṃ bhūsetīti maṇḍūko=bheko, salati gocaratta mupayātīti sālūkaṃ=uppalakaṇḍo.🔽26. Ulūkādayo.🔽Ulūkādayo saddā ṇūkantā nipaccante. Ula-gavesane, ottābhāvo nipātanā, ulati gavesatīti🔽ulūko=kosiyo. Mana=ñāṇe, nassa dhattaṃ, maññatīti madhūko=rukkho. Jala-dittiyaṃ,
analyzed: maṇḍa bhūsane daṇḍakaḥ dhātu etehi ṇūkaḥ hoti maṇḍeti jalam bhūseti iti maṇḍūkaḥ bhekaḥ salati gocarattam upayāti iti  ulūka ādayaḥ  ulūka ādayaḥ saddāḥ nipaccante ula gavesane nipātanā ulati gavesati iti  ulūka ukosiyaḥ mana ñāṇe nassa dhattam maññati iti madhūka urukkhaḥ jaladittiyam
translated: The word maṇḍūka is formed by adding ṇūka to the word maṇḍa, which is a noun formed by adding the suffix -a to the root maṇḍ, to mean “to adorn,” and the word daṇḍa, which is a noun formed by adding the suffix -a to the root daṇḍ, to mean “to go.” The word maṇḍūka thus means “he who adorns the water.” The word sālūka is formed by adding ṇūka to the word sala, which is a noun formed by adding the suffix -a to the root sal, to mean “to go.” The word sālūka thus means “he who goes to the place of his food.”

original: jalatīti jalūkā=lohitapo, evamaññepi.🔽27. Kasā sako.
analyzed: jalati iti evam aññe pi  kasā sako
translated: The words ulūkā, etc., are formed by adding ṇūka to the words ulūka, etc. The word ulūkā is formed by adding ṇūka to the word ulūka, which is a noun formed by adding the suffix -a to the root ulū, to mean “to seek.” The word ulūkā thus means “he who seeks by night.” The word madhūka is formed by adding ṇūka to the word mana, which is a noun formed by adding the suffix -a to the root man, to mean “to know.” The word madhūka thus means “he who knows honey.” The word jalūkā is formed by adding ṇūka to the word jala, which is a noun formed by adding the suffix -a to the root jal, to mean “to see.” The word jalūkā thus means “he who sees water.”

original: Kasa-vilekhanetīmasmā sako hoti. Kasatīti kassako=kasikammakāro.🔽28. Karā tiko.
analyzed: sakaḥ hoti kasati iti  karā tikaḥ
translated: The word kasā is formed by adding sako to the word kasa, which is a noun formed by adding the suffix -a to the root kasa, to mean “to scratch.” The word kasā thus means “he who scratches.”

original: Karotismā tiko hoti. Karonti kīḷaṃ etthāti kattiko=bāhulo.🔽29. Isā ṭhakana.
analyzed: karotismā tikaḥ hoti karonti ettha ati kattikobāhulo  isā ṭhakana
translated: The word karā is formed by adding tiko to the word karoti, which is a noun formed by adding the suffix -a to the root karoti, to mean “to do.” The word karā thus means “he who does a play.”

original: Isa siṃsa-icchāyaṃ, iccasmā ṭhakana hoti. Icchīyatīti iṭṭhakā=mattikāvikāro.
analyzed: iccasmā hoti icchīyati iti
translated: The word isā is formed by adding ṭhakana to the word isa, which is a noun formed by adding the suffix -a to the root isa, to mean “to desire.” The word isā thus means “he who is desired.”

original: 30. Samā kho.🔽Sama-upasamakhedesu, etasmā kho hoti. Sameti upasametīti saṅkho=kambu.
analyzed: samā kho 🔽sama aupasama khedesu etasmai kho hoti sameti upasameti iti
translated: The word samā is formed by adding kho to the

original: 31. Mukhā dayo.🔽Mukha ādayo khantā nipaccante. Mu-bandhane, ottābhāvo nipātanā, munanti bandhanti
analyzed: mukhāḥ dayaḥ  mukhe ādayaḥ khantāḥ nipaccante mu bandhane nipātanāḥ munanti bandhanti
translated: 31. Mouth, etc.

original: etenāti mukhaṃ=lapanaṃ. Si-sevāyaṃ, ettā bhāvo nipātanā, sayanti ettha ūkā kusuma-dayo
analyzed: etena ati mukhaṃlapanam bhāvaḥ nipātanā
translated: Mouth, etc., are accepted, are put down. Mu- is binding, ottā is the state of being put down, they are bound by this, therefore mouth = speaking. Si- is serving, ettā is the state of being put down, they lie down here, the flowers, etc.,

original: cāti sikhā=cūḷā. Vipubbassa sissa, visatissa vā, visesena sayanti ettha, pavisantīti
analyzed: ca ati sikhācūḷāḥ vipubbassa sissa visatissa vā visesena sayanti ettha pavisanti iti
translated: therefore crest = topknot. Vipubbassa sissa, visatissa vā, they lie down here, they enter,

original: visikhā=racchā. Kana-dītti gati kantīsu, nipubbo, anabhāgalopo, kanati dibbatīti🔽nikkho=suvaṇṇavikāro. Mayaiti gamanattho daṇḍako dhātu, khassa ūña, mayati yātīti
analyzed: visikhā racchā kanati gati kantīsu nipubbaḥ an a bhāga lopaḥ kanati dibbati iti  nikkhosuvaṇṇa vikāraḥ mayā eti gamana atthaḥ daṇḍakaḥ dhātu khassa yāti iti
translated: therefore ray = line. Kana- is in the sense of going, shining, and beauty, nipubbo, anabhāgalopo, it shines, it shines forth,🔽therefore sun = a form of gold. Maya- is a root in the sense of going, the element daṇḍa, khassa ūña, it goes, it goes,

original: mayūkho-kiraṇo. Lū-chedane, otthābhāvo, lunāti chindati sobhanti lūkho=asiniddho.
analyzed: lū chedane lū chedane lūkha uasi niddhaḥ
translated: therefore sunbeam = a ray. Lū- is cutting, otthā is the state of being, lunāti chindati sobhanti lūkho = a sword-whetstone.

original: Ara-gamane, aranti yanti etenāti akkho=sakaṭāvayavā, pāsako ca. Yasa-payatane, yassati
analyzed: ara gamane aranti yanti etena ati akkhosa kaṭa avayavā pāsakaḥ ca yasa payatane
translated: Ara- is in the sense of going, they go by this, therefore axle = a part of a cart, and a plough. Yasa- is in the sense of paying respect, yassati

original: payatati balimāharaṇatthāyāti yakkho=amanusso, ruha-janane, ruhati jāyatīti rukkho=pādapo,
analyzed: payatati balim āharaṇa atthāya ati yakkhaḥ amanussaḥ ruha janane ruhati jāyati iti rukkha upādapaḥ
translated: it pays respect, it pays respect in order to take an offering, therefore spirit = a non-human, ruha- is in the sense of arising, it arises, it is born, therefore tree = a tree.

original: usa-dāhe, usati dahati kāmaggināti ukkho=balībaddo. Saha-marisane ‘halopo, sahati
analyzed: usa dāhe usati dahati kāmagginā ati ukkhobalībaddaḥ saha marisane ha lopaḥ sahati
translated: In a forest fire, it burns in a forest fire. The fire of passion is a bull.

original: attani katāparādhaṃ khamatīti sakhā=sahāyo, evamaññepi.
analyzed: attani kata aparādham khamati iti sakhā sahāyaḥ evam aññe pi
translated: In the destruction of enemies, it is a friend. It endures, it forgives the offence done to itself, therefore a friend is a companion, so in other cases too.

original: 32. Aja vaja muda gada gamā gaka.
analyzed: aja vaja muda gada gamā gaka
translated: . Aja vaja muda gada gamā gaka.

original: Aja vaja-gamane, muda-tose, gada-vacane, ama gama-gamane, etehi gaka hoti. Ajati
analyzed: aja vaja gamane gada vacane ama gama gamane etehi hoti ajati
translated: Aja vaja-gamane, muda-tose, gada-vacane, ama gama-gamane, these have gaka. It goes,

original: gacchati seṭṭhabhāvanti aggo-seṭṭho. Vajati samūhattaṃ gacchatīti vaggo=samūho. Mudanti🔽etenāti muggo=dhaññaviseso. Gadatīti gaggo=isi. “Manānaṃ niggahīta”nti (5.96) massa
analyzed: gacchati seṭṭha bhāvanti aggo seṭṭhaḥ vajati samūha ttam gacchati iti vaggo samūhaḥ mudanti  etena ati muggodhañña visesaḥ gadati iti gaggoisi manānam niggahītanti
translated: it goes as the best, therefore the best, the foremost. It goes as a collected group, therefore a group is a collection. It is pleased

original: niggahītaṃ, gacchatīti gaṅgā=surāpagā.
analyzed: niggahītam gacchati iti gaṅgā asurāpagā
translated: by this, therefore a mung bean is a kind of grain. It speaks, therefore a sage is a seer. “The pride is restrained” (.) the pride is restrained by it, it goes, therefore the Ganges is a river.

original: 33. Siṅgādayo.🔽Siṅgaādayo saddā gakaantā nipaccante. Sī-saye, niggahītāgamo, rassattañca, sayati
analyzed: siṅga ādayaḥ  siṅga ādayaḥ saddāḥ ga ka antāḥ nipaccante niggahīta āgamaḥ ras sattam ca
translated: . Siṅgādayo.🔽The sounds beginning with siṅga are inflected with gaka at the end. It lies, the addition of niggahīta, and the short vowel, it lies on the head,

original: pavattati matthaketi siṅgaṃ=visāṇaṃ. Phura-calane, limuṅa, phurati calatīti puliṅgo=jalitaṅgā
analyzed: pavattati matthaka iti siṅgam visāṇam phura calane phurati calati iti
translated: therefore a horn is a tusk. It moves, it is trembling, therefore a lizard is a burning limb.

original: rāvayavo. Cala-kampane, upubbo, calassa cāliṃ, uccalati kampatīti uccāliṅgo=sukkakīṭo,
analyzed: cala kampane upubbaḥ calassa uccalati kampati iti uccāliṅga usukka kīṭaḥ
translated: Rā- is a prefix meaning “to cry out”. Cala- means “to shake”. Kampane means “in shaking”. Upubbo means “the shaking one”. Calassa cāliṃ means “the shaking of the shaking one”. Uccalati kampatīti means “it shakes and trembles”. Uccāliṅgo means “the shaking one”. Sukkakīṭo means “the white worm”.

original: kala-sadde, imuka, kalati abhinādaṃ karoti bahurajjatāyā ti kaliṅgo=dakkhiṇāpatho.
analyzed: kala sadde kalati abhinādam karoti bahu rajja tāya ti kaliṅgaḥ dakkhiṇāpathaḥ
translated: Kala- means “to make a sound”. Imuko means “the one who”. Kalati abhinādaṃ karoti means “it makes a sound”. Bahurajjatāyā ti means “because of the great thread”. Kaliṅgo means “the shaking one”. Dakkhiṇāpatho means “the southern region”.

original: Bhama-anavaṭṭhāne, assa ittaṃ, bhamatīti bhiṅgo=bhamaro. Paṭa aṭa-gamane, paṭissa
analyzed: bhama anavaṭṭhāne assa ittam bhamati iti bhiṅgobhamaro paṭa aṭa gamane
translated: Bhama- means “to carry”. Anuvaṭṭhāne means “in following”. Assa ittaṃ means “its carrying”. Bhamatīti means “it carries”. Bhiṅgo means “the carrying one”. Bhamaro means “the bee”. Paṭa aṭa- means “to go”. Paṭissa means “of the going”.

original: amuka, aka ca. Paṭati patanto gacchatīti paṭaṅgo, paṭago=salabho, evamaññepi.
analyzed: ca paṭati patantaḥ gacchati iti paṭaṅgo paṭagosalabho evam aññe pi
translated: Amuko means “the one who”. Paṭati patanto gacchatīti means “it goes by flying”. Paṭaṅgo means “the flying one”. Paṭago means “the bird”. So also with the others.

original: 34. Agā gi.
analyzed: a gāḥ gi
translated: . Agā gi.

original: Aga-kuṭilagamanetīmasmā gi hoti. Agati kuṭilo hutvā gacchatīti aggi=pāvako.
analyzed: aga kuṭila gamana iti imasmai hoti agati kuṭilaḥ hutvā gacchati iti aggi pāvakaḥ
translated: Agā- means “to go”. Kuṭilagamanetīmasmā gi hoti. Agati kuṭilo hutvā gacchatīti means “it goes crookedly”. Aggi means “the crooked one”. It means “the fire”.

original: 35. Yāvalā gu.
analyzed: yāvalā gu
translated: . Yāvalā gu.

original: Yā-pāpuṇane, vala valla-saṃvaraṇe, etehi gu hoti. Yātīti yāgu=peyyā. Valīyati saṃvarīyatīti vaggu=manuñño.
analyzed: yā pāpuṇane vala valla saṃvaraṇe etehi hoti yāti iti valīyati saṃvarīyati iti
translated: Yā- means “to reach”. Vala- means “to restrain”. Vala means “the restraining one”. Gu is added to these. Yātīti means “it goes”. Yāgu means “the drink”. Valīyati saṃvarīyatīti means “it is restrained”. Vaggu means “the restrained one”. It means “the pleasant one”.

original: 36. Pheggādayo.
analyzed: phegga ādayaḥ
translated: . Pheggādayo.

original: Pheggu ādayo guantā nipaccante. Phala-nipphattiyaṃ, assa ettaṃ, phalati niṭṭhānaṃ
analyzed: pheggu ādayaḥ gu antāḥ nipaccante phala nipphattiyam assa ettam phalati niṭṭhānam
translated: Pheggu ādayo guantā nipaccante. Phala-nipphattiyaṃ means “in the production of fruit”. Assa ettaṃ means “its”. Phalati niṭṭhānaṃ means “it ripens”.

original: gacchatīti pheggu=asāro. Bhara-bharaṇe, ralopo. Bharatīti bhagu=isi. Hi-gatīyaṃ,
analyzed: gacchati iti phegguasāraḥ bhara bharaṇe ra lopaḥ bharati iti higatīyam
translated: Going, it is a reed = without substance. Bhara-bearing, ralopo. It bears, it is a bhag = a seer. Hi-going,

original: niggahītāgamo, hino ti pavattatīti hiṅgu=rāmaṭhajaṃ. Kama-icchāyaṃ, kāmīyatīti kaṅgu=dhaññaviseso, evamaññepi.
analyzed: niggahīta āgamaḥ ti pavattati iti hiṅgu rāmaṭha jam kāmīyati iti evam aññe pi
translated: niggahīta, hino is the form. It goes, it is a hingu = garlic. Kama-desire, it is desired, it is a kangu = a kind of grain, so also with the others.

original: 37. Janā gho.
analyzed: janā gho
translated: . People, gho.

original: Jana-jananetīmasmā gho hoti. “Manānaṃ niggahīta”nti (5.96) nassa niggahītaṃ, jāyati gamanametāyāti jaṅghā=pāṇyaṅgaviseso.
analyzed: gha u hoti manānam niggahītanti nassa niggahītam jāyati jaṅghā pāṇi aṅga visesaḥ
translated: Jana-it causes people, gho is the form. “The nasals are niggahīta” (.) the nasal is niggahīta, it is born, it goes, it is a shank = a special part of the foot.

original: 38. Meghādayo.
analyzed: megha ādayaḥ
translated: . Clouds, etc.

original: Meghaādayo ghantā nipaccante. Miha-secane, halopo, mehati siñcatīti megho=ambudo.
analyzed: megha ādayaḥ nipaccante miha secane ha lopaḥ mehati siñcati iti
translated: Clouds, etc. are niggahīta by gha. Miha-sprinkling, ralopo, it sprinkles, it is a megha = a water-cloud.

original: Muha-mucchāyaṃ, halopo, muyhanti sattā etthāti mogho=tuccho. Sī-saye, ettābhāvo,
analyzed: ha lopaḥ sattāḥ ettha ati mogha utucchaḥ
translated: Muha-delusion, ralopo, beings are deluded here, it is a mogha = void. Sī-lying down, ettābhāvo,

original: seti lahu hutvā pavattatīti sīghaṃ=āsu. Aha-bhasmīkaraṇe, nipubbo, halopadīghā, nidahatīti
analyzed: sā iti lahu hutvā pavattati iti aha bhasmīkaraṇe nipubbaḥ ha lopa dīghā nidahati iti
translated: it lies down, it moves quickly, it is a sīgha = swift. Aha-burning, nipubbo, ralopo, it burns, it is a

original: nidāgho=gimho. Mahīssa halopo, mahīyati pūjīyatīti maghā=nakkhattaṃ, evamaññepi.
analyzed: mahīssa ha lopaḥ mahīyati pūjīyati iti maghā nakkhattam evam aññe pi
translated: nidāgho = hot. Mahīssa ralopo, it is worshipped, it is a maghā = a constellation, so also with the others.

original: (Iti kavaggapaccayavidhānaṃ).🔽39. Cusaravarā co.
analyzed: iti ka vagga paccaya vidhānam  cu sara varā caḥ
translated: (Thus ends the section on the method of the group of prepositions).🔽Cu, ca, va, and ra.

original: Cu-cavane, sara-gati hiṃsā cintāsu, vara-varaṇa sambhattīsu, eyehi co hoti. Cavati
analyzed: cucavane saragati hiṃsā cintāsu varavaraṇa sambhattīsu eyehi caḥ hoti cavati
translated: Cu is used in the sense of “to flow,” sara in the sense of “to go,” hiṃsā in the sense of “to harm,” cintā in the sense of “to think,” and vara in the sense of “to choose.”

original: rukkhāti cocaṃ=upabhuttaphala- viseso. Sarati āyatiṃ dukkhaṃ hiṃsatīti saccaṃ=avitathaṃ.
analyzed: sarati āyatim dukkham hiṃsati iti saccam avitatham
translated: Rukkha is a tree whose fruit has been eaten. Sara is truth, i.e., what is not false.

original: Vāreti sukhanti vaccaṃ=gūtho.
analyzed: vāreti
translated: Vara is feces, i.e., what is covered and pressed down.

original: 40. Marā cuīcī ca.
analyzed: marā cuīcī ca
translated: Mara, cu, and īcī.

original: Mara-pāṇacāge tīmasmā cuīcī honti co ca. Maraṇaṃ maccu=maraṇaṃ. Māreti andhakāraṃ vināsetīti marīci=raṃsi, migataṇhikā ca. Maratīti macco=satto.
analyzed: honti co ca maraṇam maccu maraṇam māreti andhakāram vināseti iti marīci raṃsi miga taṇhikā ca marati iti maccosatto
translated: Cu and īcī are used in the sense of “to die,” and co in the sense of “to flow.” Maraṇa is death, i.e., dying. Marīci is a ray of light, i.e., what destroys darkness, and a mirage. Maccho is an animal, i.e., what dies.

original: 41. Kusa pasā chika.
analyzed: kusa pasā chika
translated: Kusa, pasa, and chika.

original: Kusa-akkose, pasa-bādhane, etehi chika hoti. Kusīyati akkosīyatīti kucchi=udaraṃ. Pasīyati bādhīyati etthāti pacchi=bhājanaviseso.
analyzed: kusa akkose pasa bādhane etehi hoti kusīyati akkosīyati iti kucchi udaram pasīyati bādhīyati ettha ati pacchibhājana viseso
translated: Kusa is used in the sense of “to scold,” and pasa in the sense of “to obstruct.” Chika is used in the sense of “to be scolded” and “to be obstructed.” Kucchi is the belly, i.e., what is scolded. Pacchi is a kind of vessel, i.e., what is obstructed.

original: 42. Kasa usā chuka.
analyzed: kasa usā chuka
translated: Kasa, usā, and chuka.

original: Kasa-vilekhane, usa-dāhe, etehi chuka hoti. Kasanti vilekhanti etthāti kacchu=pāmaṃ. Usati dahati santāpanti ucchu=rasālo.
analyzed: kasa vilekhane usa dāhe etehi hoti kasanti vilekhanti ettha ati kacchu pāmam usati dahati santāpanti ucchura sālaḥ
translated: In the case of scratching, in the case of burning, the suffix cho is used. In the case of scratching and scraping, kacchu = pus. In the case of burning and scorching, ucchu = sap.

original: 43. Asa masa vada kuca kacā cho.🔽Asa-khipane, masa-āmasane, vada-vacane, kuca-saṃkocane, kaca-bandhane, etehi cho
analyzed: asa masa vada kuca kacā cho  asa khipane masa āmasane vada vacane kuca saṃkocane kaca bandhane ete hi cho
translated: . Asa, masa, vada, kuca, kacā, cho.

original: hoti. Asati chipatīti accho=bhallūko. Masati jalanti maccho=mīno. Vadatīti vaccho=nelako.
analyzed: asati chipati iti acchobhallūkaḥ masati jalanti macchomīnaḥ vadati iti vacchonelakaḥ
translated: In the case of throwing, in the case of touching, in the case of speaking, in the case of contracting, in the case of binding, the suffix cho is used. In the case of throwing, accho = bear. In the case of touching, maccho = fish. In the case of speaking, vaccho = calf.

original: Kucīyati saṃkocīyatīti koccho=bhaddapīṭṭhaṃ. Kacīyati bandhīyatīti kaccho=tanupadeso, anūpo ca.
analyzed: kucīyati saṃkocīyati iti kocchobhaddapīṭṭham kacīyati bandhīyati iti ca
translated: In the case of contracting, koccho = good seat. In the case of binding, kaccho = part of the body, and also a small place.

original: 44. Gucchādayo.🔽Gucchaādayo chantā nipaccante. Gupa-gopane, ottābhāvo, gopīyatīti guccho=thavako.
analyzed: guccha ādayaḥ  guccha ādayaḥ chantā nipaccante gopīyati iti
translated: . Guccha and so on.🔽Guccha and so on are soft and tender. In the case of covering, in the case of absence of light, guccho = grass.

original: Tusa-tuṭṭhimhī, tusanti etenāti tucchaṃ=musā. Pusa-posane, posanti tanumanenāti puccho=vāladhi, evamaññepi.
analyzed: tusa tuṭṭhimhī tusanti etena ati tucchaṃmusā pusa posane posanti tanumanena ati evam aññe pi
translated: In the case of being satisfied, tucchaṃ = false. In the case of nourishing, puccho = hair, so with others.

original: 45. Arā ju ñaṭa ca.
analyzed: arāḥ ju ñaṭa ca
translated: . Arā, ju, ñaṭa, ca.

original: Ara-gamanetīmasmā ju hoti, arissa uṭa ca. Ṭakāro sabbādesattho, arati akuṭilabhāvena pavattatīti uju=avaṅko.🔽46. Rajjādayo.🔽Rajjuādayo juantā nipaccante. Rudha-āvaraṇe, ussa attaṃ, rundhanti etenāti rujju-yottaṃ. Mana-ñāṇe, amaññitthāti mañju=mañjulaṃ, evamaññepi.🔽47. Gidhā jhaka.🔽Gidha-abhikaṅkhāyamiccasmā jhaka hoti. Gedhatīti gijjho=pakkhiviseso.
analyzed: hoti arissa hoti arissa ca ṭakāraḥ sabba ādesa atthaḥ arati akuṭila bhāvena pavattati iti uju avaṅkaḥ  rajju ādayaḥ  rajju ādayaḥ nipaccante rudha āvaraṇe attam rundhanti etena ati mana ñāṇe amaññittha iti mañju mañjulam evam aññe pi  gidhā jhaka  hoti gedhati iti
translated: The words arati and uju are derived from the root √raj, to go straight, with the prefix a- and the suffix -i respectively. The prefix ṭa- is added to the root √raj, to go straight, with the suffix -a, to give the word ṭhaṅka, which means “crooked.”

original: 48. Vañjhādayo.🔽Vañcyaādayo jhaka antā nipaccante. Vana-yācane, vanoti attānaṃ anubhavituṃ yācatīti🔽vañjho=aphalarukkho, vañjhā=apasavā itthī, assa ittaṃ viñjho=pabbato, saṃja-saṅge,
analyzed: vañjha ādayaḥ  vañcya ādayaḥ jhaka antāḥ nipaccante vana yācane vanoti attānam anubhavitum yācati iti  vañjho aphala rukkhaḥ vañjhā apasavā itthī asse ittam viñjho pabbataḥ saṃjasaṅge
translated: The words rujjhu, mañju, and gijjha are derived from the root √raj, to go straight, with the prefix ru-, the prefix ma-, and the prefix gi- respectively. The suffix -jha is added to the root √raj, to go straight, with the prefix ru-, to give the word rujjhu, which means “a rope.” The suffix -jha is added to the root √raj, to go straight, with the prefix ma-, to give the word mañju, which means “gentle.” The suffix -jha is added to the root √raj, to go straight, with the prefix gi-, to give the word gijjha, which means “vulture.”

original: niggahītalopo, sañjiyatīti sajjhaṃ=rajataṃ, evamaññepi.🔽49. Kamayajā ño.
analyzed: niggahīta lopaḥ evam aññe pi 🔽kama ya jāḥ ñaḥ
translated: The words vañjha, sajjha, and sañjha are derived from the root √vaj, to deceive, with the suffix -jha. The suffix -jha is added to the root √vaj, to deceive, to give the word vañjha, which means “a barren tree.” The suffix -jha is added to the root √vaj, to deceive, to give the word sajjha, which means “silver.” The suffix -jha is added to the root √saj, to join, with the prefix sa-, to give the word sañjha, which means “a meeting.”

original: Kama-icchāyaṃ, yaja-devapūjāsaṅgatikaraṇadānesu, etehi ño hoti, massa niggahītavaggantā, kāmīyatīti kaññā=kumārī. Jassa pararūpattaṃ, yajantyanenāti yañño=yāgo.
analyzed: yaja deva pūjā saṅgati karaṇa dānesu etehi ñaḥ hoti massa niggahīta vaggantā kāmīyati iti kaññā kumārī jassa para rūpa ttam yajanti anena ati yañ yāgaḥ
translated: In the desire for love, in the sacrifice, in the worship of the gods, in the giving of gifts, the affix ño is added to these, and the vowel a of the base is lengthened. One who desires love is a kaññā = a virgin. By this one sacrifices the state of being another’s wife, therefore yañña = sacrifice, giving.

original: 50. Puññaṃ.
analyzed: puññam
translated: . Merit.

original: Punāti puṇatismā vā ñoottābhāvo ca nipaccante. Punāti, puṇati sundarattaṃ karotīti vā puññaṃ=kusalaṃ.
analyzed: punāti puṇati smā vā ñaḥ o tta a bhāvaḥ ca nipaccante punāti puṇati sunda rattam karoti iti vā puññaṃkusalam
translated: It purifies, or it is purified, the affix ño is added, and the vowel a of the base is lengthened. It purifies, it makes beautiful, therefore puñña = good.

original: 51. Ara hāñño hāssa hira ca.
analyzed: ara hā aññaḥ hāssa hira ca
translated: . Ara, hā, ñño, hā, hira.

original: Ara-gamane, vā-cāge, etehi añño hoti, hāssa hirañcādeso. Arīyate gamyateti araññaṃ=vanaṃ. Jahāti sattānaṃ hīnattanti hiraññaṃ=dhanaṃ, suvaṇṇañca.
analyzed: ara gamane vācāge etehi aññaḥ hoti ha assa hirañca ādesaḥ arīyate gamyate iti araññaṃvanam jahāti sattānam hiraññaṃdhanam suvaṇṇam ca
translated: In the going to the forest, in the giving up, the affix ñño is added to these, and the vowel a of the base is lengthened. It is gone to, it is gone, therefore arañña = forest. It gives up the inferiority of beings, therefore hirañña = wealth, and gold.

original: (Iti cavaggapaccayavidhānaṃ).
analyzed: iti ca vagga paccaya vidhānam
translated: (Thus ends the section on the rules for the avagga and paccaya affixes).

original: 52. Kira tarā kīṭo.
analyzed: kira tarā kīṭo
translated: . Kira, tara, kīṭa.

original: Kira-vikiraṇe, tara-taraṇe, etehi, kīṭo hoti. Sobhetumettha ratanāni vikirīyantīti kirīṭaṃ=makuṭaṃ. Taraiti niddesā assa ittaṃ, taranti yanti surūpatta manenāti tirīṭaṃ=veṭṭhanaṃ.🔽53. Sakādīhyaṭo.
analyzed: kira vikiraṇe tara taraṇe etehi kīṭaḥ hoti sobhetum ettha ratanāni vikirīyanti iti kirīṭam makuṭam tara eti niddesāḥ assa taranti yanti tirīṭam veṭṭhanam 🔽saka ādi hi aṭaḥ
translated: In the scattering, in the crossing, the affix kīṭa is added to these. Jewels are scattered here for the sake of beauty, therefore kirīṭa = a diadem. It is his, by the rule of tara, therefore ittaṃ = his. They cross, they go, by the idea of beauty, therefore tirīṭa = a creeper.

original: Saka-sattiyaṃ, kasa-gamane, kara-karaṇe, makka iti suttiyo dhātu, deva-devane, kama-icchāyaṃ,
analyzed: sakasattiyam kasa gamane kara karaṇe makkaḥ iti suttiyaḥ dhātu deva devane
translated: In saka-satthi, kasa-gamane, kara-karane, makka, these are the roots. In deva-devane, kama-icchāyaṃ,

original: evamādihi aṭo hoti. Saṇṇoti bhāraṃ vahitunti sakaṭo=yānaṃ. Akasi nirojattaṃ agamīti
analyzed: evamādihi aṭaḥ hoti bhāram vahitunti sa kaṭoyānam akasi nirojattam agami iti
translated: thus, etc., aṭo is. Saṇṇo=bhāraṃ vahitunti sakaṭo=yānaṃ. Akasi nirojaṃ agamīti

original: kasaṭaṃ=nirojaṃ. Karoti amanāpanti karaṭo=kāko. Makkati calatīti makkaṭo=vānaro.
analyzed: karoti karaṭokākaḥ makkati calati iti makkaṭovānaraḥ
translated: kasaṭaṃ=nirojaṃ. Karoti amanāpanti karaṭo=kāko. Makkati calatīti makkaṭo=vānaro.

original: Devīyati pūjīyatīti devaṭo=isi. Kamati icchati ārohatthanti kamaṭo=vāmano.
analyzed: devīyati pūjīyati iti kamati icchati kamaṭa vāmanaḥ
translated: Devīyati pūjīyatīti devaṭo=isi. Kamati icchati ārohatthanti kamaṭo=vāmano.

original: 54. Makuṭāvāṭa kavāṭa kukkuṭā.
analyzed: makuṭāvāṭa kavāṭa kukkuṭā
translated: . Makuṭāvāṭa kavāṭa kukkuṭā.

original: Ete saddā nipaccante. Maṃkismā uṭo, niggahītalopo ca, maṃketi sobhetīti makuṭaṃ=kirīṭaṃ.
analyzed: ete saddāḥ nipaccante uṭaḥ niggahīta lopo ca maṃketi sobheti iti makuṭaṃkirīṭam
translated: These words are contracted. Maṃkismā uṭo, niggahītalopo ca, maṃketi sobhetīti makuṭaṃ=kirīṭaṃ.

original: Avatismā āṭaṇa, avyate khaññateti āvāṭo=kāsu. Ku-saddetīmasmā āṭo, oavādesā yathāyogaṃ,
analyzed: āṭaḥ yathāyogam
translated: Avatismā āṭaṇa, avyate khaññateti āvāṭo=kāsu. Ku-saddetīmasmā āṭo, oavādesā yathāyogaṃ,

original: kavati ravatīti kavāṭaṃ=dvārapidhānaṃ. Kuka vaka-ādānetīmasmā kuṭaka, kukati gocaramādadātīti kukkuṭo=tambacūḷo.
analyzed: kavati ravati iti kavāṭam dvāra pidhānam kuka gocaram ādadāti iti
translated: kavati ravatīti kavāṭaṃ=dvārapidhānaṃ. Kuka vaka-ādānetīmasmā kuṭaka, kukati gocaramādadātīti kukkuṭo=tambacūḷo.

original: 55. Kamusa kusa kasā ṭho.
analyzed: kamusa kusa kasā ṭhaḥ
translated: . Kamusa kusa kasā ṭho.

original: Kama-icchāyaṃ, usa-dāhe, kusa-akkose, kasa-gamane, etehiṭho hoti, niggahītavaggantā,
analyzed: usa dāhe kusa akkose kasa gamane etehiṭhaḥ hoti niggahīta vagga antā
translated: In the desire for sensual pleasure, in the burning of the fire, in the abuse of the grass, in the going of the dust, by these here it is, the one who is restrained, the one who has gone,

original: odanādīni kāmetīti kaṇṭho=galo. Okkapararūpādīni, odanādīsu uṇhena usīyatī ti oṭṭho=dantacchado,
analyzed: odana ādīni kāmeti iti odana ādīsu uṇhena ti oṭṭha udantacchadaḥ
translated: he desires rice, etc., therefore the throat = the gullet. The form, etc., of the other, in the rice, etc., is heated by the heat, therefore the chest = the palate,

original: karabho ca. Kusīyati akkosīyatīti koṭṭho=dhaññanilayo. Kasati yāti vināsanti kaṭṭhaṃ=dāru.
analyzed: karabhaḥ ca kusīyati akkosīyati iti koṭṭhodhañña nilayaḥ kasati yāti vināsanti kaṭṭhaṃdāru
translated: and the hump. It is bent, it is abused, therefore the granary = the place for grain. It burns, it goes, it is destroyed, the wood = the tree.

original: 56. Kuṭṭhādayo.🔽Kuṭṭhaādayo saddā ṭhantā nipaccante. Kusismā ṭho, ottābhāvo ca, kusīyati akkosīyatīti
analyzed: kuṭṭha ādayaḥ  kuṭṭha ādayaḥ saddāḥ ṭhantā nipaccante ca kusīyati akkosīyati iti
translated: . The leprosy, etc.🔽The sounds such as leprosy, etc., are bent down. The bent one is the throat, and the absence of light, it is bent, it is abused,

original: kuṭṭhaṃ=chavirogo. Kuṇa-sadde, pararūpābhāvo ottābhāvo ca, kuṇati nadatīti kuṇṭho=atikhiṇo,🔽kuṇīyati akkosīyatīti kuṇṭho= chinnahatthapādādiko. Daṃsissa dā, daṃsati etāyāti
analyzed: kuṭṭhaṃ chavi rogaḥ kuṇa sadde ca kuṇati nadati iti  kuṇīyati akkosīyati iti kuṇṭhaḥ chinna hattha pāda ādikaḥ daṃsissa dā daṃsati
translated: therefore leprosy = a disease of the head. In the sound kuṇa, the absence of the form of the other, the absence of light, it makes a sound, it is bent, therefore the cripple = the very sharp one,🔽it is bent, it is abused, therefore the cripple = the one with a cut hand, foot, etc. In the bite, the bite, it bites with this,

original: dāṭhā=dantaviseso. Kamissa aka ca. Kāmīyāti dīnetīti kamaṭho=bhikkhābhājanaṃ, vāmano,
analyzed: dāṭhā danta visesaḥ kamissa ca kāmīyāti dīneti iti kamaṭhaḥ bhikkhā bhājanam vāmanaḥ
translated: therefore the fang = a special tooth. In the desire for, and the absence, it desires, it is bent, therefore the bowl = the alms bowl, the dwarf,

original: kummo ca. Phassissa phuṭo, phassīyatīti phuṭṭho=phasso, evamaññepi.
analyzed: kummo ca phassissa phuṭaḥ phassīyati iti phuṭṭhophassaḥ evam aññe pi
translated: and the crab. In the touch, the touched, it is touched, therefore the touched = the touch, so also in the other.

original: 57. Vara karā aṇḍo.
analyzed: vara karā aṇḍo
translated: 57. The suffix -aṇḍo.

original: Vara-varaṇe, kara-karaṇe, etehi aṇḍo hoti. Attani pephaṃ vārayatīti varaṇḍo=mukharogo. Karīyatīti karaṇḍo=bhaṇḍaviseso.
analyzed: vara varaṇe kara karaṇe etehi aṇḍaḥ hoti attani pepham vārayati iti varaṇḍomukha rogaḥ karīyati iti karaṇḍobhaṇḍa visesaḥ
translated: Vara-varaṇe, kara-karaṇe, etehi aṇḍo hoti. Attani pephaṃ vārayatīti varaṇḍo=mukharogo. Karīyatīti karaṇḍo=bhaṇḍaviseso.

original: 58. Manantā ḍo.
analyzed: man antā ḍaḥ
translated: . Manantā ḍo.

original: Makāra nakārantehi kriyatthehi bahulaṃ ḍappaccayo hoti. Sama-upasame, samanaṃ saṇḍaṃ=samūho.
analyzed: makāra nakāra antehi kriyatthehi bahulam ḍap paccayaḥ hoti sama upasame samanam saṇḍam samūhaḥ
translated: Makāra nakārantehi kriyatthehi bahulaṃ ḍappaccayo hoti. Sama-upasame, samanaṃ saṇḍaṃ=samūho.

original: Kama-padavikkhepe, kamati yātīti kaṇḍo=saro, paricchedo ca, dama-damane, damantvyanenāti
analyzed: kama pada vikkhepe kamati yāti iti paricchedo ca dama damane damantvi anena ati
translated: Kama-padavikkhepe, kamati yātīti kaṇḍo=saro, paricchedo ca, dama-damane, damantvyanenāti

original: daṇḍo=niggaho. Ama gama-gamane, amanti uppajjanti etthāti aṇḍo=pakkhipasavo, koso
analyzed: daṇḍaḥ niggahaḥ ama gama gamane amanti uppajjanti ettha ati aṇḍa upakkhipa savaḥ kosaḥ
translated: daṇḍo=niggaho. Ama gama-gamane, amanti uppajjanti etthāti aṇḍo=pakkhipasavo, koso

original: ca. Gacchati sūnabhāvanti gaṇḍo=byādhi, vadanekadeso ca. Ramu-kīḷāyaṃ, ramanti etthāti
analyzed: ca gacchati ca ramu kīḍāyam ramanti ettha ati
translated: ca. Gacchati sūnabhāvanti gaṇḍo=byādhi, vadanekadeso ca. Ramu-kīḷāyaṃ, ramanti etthāti

original: ruṇḍā=vidhavā. Mana-ñāṇe, maññanti etenāti maṇḍo=odanādinissāvo. Khana khaṇa=avadāraṇe,
analyzed: ruṇḍā vidhavā mana ñāṇe maññanti etena ati maṇḍa oodana ādi nissāvaḥ khana khaṇa avadāraṇe
translated: ruṇḍā=vidhavā. Mana-ñāṇe, maññanti etenāti maṇḍo=odanādinissāvo. Khana khaṇa=avadāraṇe,

original: khaññatīti khaṇḍo=ucchuvikāra viseso. Lama-hiṃsāyaṃ, lamati hiṃsati sucibhāvanti
analyzed: visesaḥ lama hiṃsā ayam lamati hiṃsati suci bhāvanti
translated: khaññatīti khaṇḍo=ucchuvikāra viseso. Lama-hiṃsāyaṃ, lamati hiṃsati sucibhāvanti

original: laṇḍo=vaccaṃ, evamaññepi.
analyzed: evam aññe pi
translated: laṇḍo=vaccaṃ, evamaññepi.

original: 59. Kuṇḍā dayo.
analyzed: kuṇḍāḥ dayaḥ
translated: 59. The words beginning with kuṇḍa.

original: Kuṇḍaādayo ḍantā nipaccante. Kama mana tanānaṃ assa uttaṃ, kāmīyatīti kuṇḍaṃ=bhājanaṃ.
analyzed: kuṇḍa ādayaḥ ḍantāḥ nipaccante kama mana tanānam assaḥ uttam kāmīyati iti kuṇḍaṃbhājanam
translated: The teeth are ground down. The mouth is the best of the three, namely, the body, the mind and the mouth, because it is desired.

original: Maññati hitāhitanti muṇḍo= chinnakeso. Tanoti etenāti tuṇḍaṃ=lapanaṃ. Īra-khepe,
analyzed: maññati hita ahitanti muṇḍaḥ chinna keso tanoti etena ati tuṇḍaṃlapanam īra khepe
translated: He thinks of what is beneficial and harmful, therefore he is muṇḍa = one with a shaven head. It is extended by this, therefore it is tuṇḍa = a beak. Īra-khepe,

original: eraṃādeso. Īrati kampatīti eraṇḍo=byagghapuccho, si-sevāyaṃ, sissa khamuka, sugandhaṃ
analyzed: eraṃ ādesaḥ īrati kampati iti eraṇḍaḥ byaggha pucchaḥ sugandham
translated: eraṃādeso. It moves, it trembles, therefore it is eraṇḍa = a tiger’s tail. Si-sevāyaṃ, sissa khamuka, it serves fragrant

original: sevatīti sikhaṇḍo=cūḷā, evamaññepi.
analyzed: sevati iti sikhaṇḍocūḷā evam aññe pi
translated: things, therefore it is sikhaṇḍa = a tuft of hair, so also in other words.

original: 60. Tija kasa tasa dakkhā kiṇo jassa kho ca.
analyzed: tija kasa tasa dakkhā kiṇaḥ jassa kho ca
translated: . Tija kasa tasa dakkhā kiṇo jassa kho ca.

original: Tija-nisāne, kasa-gamane, tasa-pipāsāyaṃ, dakkha-vuddhiyaṃ, etehi kiṇo hoti, jassa
analyzed: tija nisāne kasa gamane tasa pipāsāyam dakkha vuddhiyam etehi kiṇaḥ hoti jassa
translated: Tija-nisāne, kasa-gamane, tasa-pipāsāyaṃ, dakkha-vuddhiyaṃ, by these kiṇo is made, jassa

original: kho ca, tejayitthāti tikhiṇaṃ=nisitaṃ. Kasati pavattatīti kasiṇaṃ=asesaṃ. Tasanaṃ
analyzed: kho ca tejayittha iti tikhiṇaṃnisitam kasati pavattati iti kasiṇaṃasesam tasanam
translated: kho ca, it is sharpened, therefore it is tikhiṇa = sharp. It is ground, it moves, therefore it is kasiṇaṃ = complete. Tasanaṃ

original: tasiṇā=taṇhā. Dakkhati vuddhiṃ gacchati etāyāti dakkhīṇā=kusalaṃ.
analyzed: dakkhati vuddhim gacchati dakkhīṇa akusalam
translated: tasiṇā = craving. It sees, it goes to growth by this, therefore it is dakkhīṇā = good.

original: 61. Vīādito ṇi.
analyzed: vī āditaḥ ṇi
translated: . Vīādito ṇi.

original: Vī-tantasantāne, si-sevāsaṃ, sū-passavane, du-gamane, kī-dabbavinīmaye, sā-tanukaraṇāvasānesu,
analyzed: vī tanta santāne sisevāsam su upassavane du gamane kīdabba vinīmaye sa a tanu karaṇa avasānesu
translated: Vī-tantasantāne, si-sevāsaṃ, sū-passavane, du-gamane, kī-dabbavinīmaye, sā-tanukaraṇāvasānesu,

original: evamādīhi ṇi hoti. Vīyatīti veṇi=kesakalāpo. Sevanaṃ seṇi=sajātīnaṃ kārūnaṃ samūho.
analyzed: evamādīhi hoti vīyati iti veṇi kesa kalāpaḥ sevanam seṇisa jātīnam kārūnam samūhaḥ
translated: The following words are formed with ṇi: Veṇi = a braid of hair, from vīyati (to be braided). Seṇi = a group of kinsmen, from sevanaṃ (to serve).

original: Nipubbo, nisevīyatīti niseṇi=sopānaṃ. Savati passavatīti soṇi=kaṭi. Davati vahatīti
analyzed: nipubbaḥ nisevīyati iti niseṇi sopānam savati passavati iti soṇi kaṭi davati vahati iti
translated: Niseṇi = a staircase, from nipubbo (new) and nisevīyati (to be used). Soṇi = the hip, from savati (to flow). Doṇi = a boat, from davati (to carry).

original: doṇi=kaṭṭhambuvāhanī, nāvā ca. Nadādipāṭhā vimhi soṇī doṇī tipi hoti. Kayanaṃ, kīyate🔽etāyāti vā keṇi=kayo sāti dukkhaṃ tanuṃ karotīti sāṇi=tirokaraṇī, evamaññepi.
analyzed: doṇika ṭṭhambuvāhanī nāvā ca nada ādi pāṭhāḥ vimhi soṇī doṇī tipi hoti kayanam kīyate  vā keṇikayo sā ati dukkham tanum karoti iti sāṇitirokaraṇī evam aññe pi
translated: Nadādipāṭhā vimhi soṇī doṇī tipi hoti (the words soṇi and doṇi are formed with ti and pi respectively in the above manner). Keṇi = the body, from kayanaṃ (body).

original: 62. Gahādīhyaṇi.🔽Gaha-upādāne, ara-gamane, dhara-dhāraṇe, sara-gatiyiṃsā cintāsu, tara-taraṇe, evamādīhi
analyzed: gaha ādi aṇi  gaha aupādāne ara gamane dhara dhāraṇe sara gati yiṃsā cintāsu tara taraṇe evamādīhi
translated: Sāṇi = a cloth, from sāti (to make thin). Gahādīhyaṇi.

original: aṇippaccayo hoti. Gaṇhātīti gahaṇi=asitādipācako aggi. Arīyati gamīyatīti araṇi=aggimanthanakaṭṭhaṃ.
analyzed: hoti gaṇhāti iti gahaṇi asita ādi pācakaḥ aggi arīyati gamīyati iti araṇi aggi manthana kaṭṭham
translated: Gaha-upādāne, ara-gamane, dhara-dhāraṇe, sara-gatiyiṃsā cintāsu, tara-taraṇe, aṇippaccayo hoti (the affix ṇi is added to the above roots in the above meanings). Gahaṇi = fire, from gaṇhāti (to grasp). Araṇi = a piece of wood for kindling fire, from arīyati (to be moved).

original: Dhāretīti dharaṇi=mahī. Sarīyati gamīyatīti bharaṇi=maggo. Tarantyanenāti taraṇi=nāvā, sūriyo ca.🔽63. Rīvībhāhi ṇu.
analyzed: dhāreti iti dharaṇi mahī sarīyati gamīyati iti bharaṇi maggo taranti anena ati taraṇi nāvā sūriyaḥ ca 🔽rīvībhāhi ṇu
translated: Dharaṇi = the earth, from dhāreti (to hold). Bharaṇi = a path, from sarīyati (to be moved). Taraṇi = a boat, from tarantyanena (to cross by this). Rīvībhāhi ṇu.

original: Rī-passavane, vī vā-gamane, bhā-dittiyaṃ, etehiṇu hoti. Rīyati passavatīti reṇu=rajo. Veti pavattatīti veṇu=veḷu. Bhāti dibbatīti bhāṇu=raṃsi.
analyzed: rī passavane vī vā āgamane bha ādittiyam hoti rīyati passavati iti reṇu rajaḥ veti pavattati iti veṇu veḷu bhāti dibbati iti bhāṇu raṃsi
translated: In the sense of “to be scattered,” “to be split,” “to shine,” the syllable ṇu is added. It is scattered, it is scattered about, therefore reṇu = dust. It goes, it moves, therefore veṇu = bamboo. It shines, it shines forth, therefore bhāṇu = sun.

original: 64. Khāṇvā dayo.🔽Khāṇuādayo ṇuantā nipaccante. Khaṇa khana-avadāraṇe, ṇassa ā, khaññati avadārīyatīti
analyzed: khāṇvāḥ dayaḥ  kha aṇu ādayaḥ ṇu antāḥ nipaccante khaṇa khana avadāraṇe ṇassa ā khaññati avadārīyati iti
translated: . The words beginning with khāṇu.

original: khāṇu=chinnasākho rukkho. Jana-janane, nassa vā āttaṃ, jāyati gamana manenāti jāṇu,
analyzed: rukkhaḥ jana janane vai āttam jāyati
translated: The words beginning with khāṇu are declined in the ṇu group. It is broken, it is broken up, therefore khāṇu = a tree with a broken branch. It is born, it is born by the act of going, therefore jāṇu = the knee-pan.

original: jaṇṇu=jaṅghorūnaṃ sandhi. Hara-haraṇe, eka, harīyatīti hareṇu=gandhadabba, evamaññepi.
analyzed: sandhi hara haraṇe harīyati iti hareṇu gandha dabbe evam aññe pi
translated: Jaṇṇu = the joint of the calf and the thigh. It is carried, it is carried by one, therefore hareṇu = a fragrant unguent. So with the rest.

original: 65. Kvādito ṇo.
analyzed: kva ādi taḥ ṇaḥ
translated: . The words beginning with kvā are declined in the ṇo group.

original: Ku-sadde, su-savane, du-gamane, vara-varaṇe, kara-karaṇe, paṇa-byavahārathutisu,🔽tā-pālane, lī-nilīyane, evamādīhi ṇo hoti. Kavati nadati etthāti koṇo=assi, vīṇādivādanadaṇḍo
analyzed: kusadde susavane dugamane varavaraṇe karakaraṇe paṇa byavahāra thutisu  tā pālane lī nilīyane evamādīhi ṇo hoti kavati nadati ettha ati vīṇā ādi vādana daṇḍaḥ
translated: In the sense of “to make a sound,” “to hear,” “to go,” “to choose,” “to do,” “to swear,”

original: ca. Suṇotīti soṇo=sunakho, naro ca. Davati pavattatīti doṇo=parimāṇaviseso. Virūpatta
analyzed: ca suṇoti iti soṇo sunakhaḥ naro ca davati pavattati iti doṇo parimāṇa visesaḥ
translated: “to protect,” “to hide,” the syllable ṇo is added. It makes a sound, it makes a sound here, therefore koṇo = the handle of a vīṇā, etc. It hears, therefore soṇo = a dog, a man. It goes, it moves, therefore doṇo = a measure.

original: vāretīti vaṇṇo=nīlādi. Savanaṃ karotīti kaṇṇo=savanaṃ. Paṇīyati voharīyatīti paṇṇo=palāso.
analyzed: vāreti iti vaṇṇaḥ nīla ādi savanam karoti iti kaṇṇosavanam paṇīyati voharīyati iti paṇṇopalāsaḥ
translated: Colour is what is seen. The ear is so called because it hears. The leaf is so called because it is spread out.

original: Lāyatīti tāṇaṃ=rakkhā. Nilīyanti etthāti leṇaṃ=nilīyanaṭṭhānaṃ.🔽66. Suvīhi ṇaka.
analyzed: lāyati iti tāṇaṃrakkhāḥ nilīyanti ettha ati leṇaṃnilīyana ṭṭhānam  suvīhi ṇaka
translated: A shelter is so called because it shelters. A cave is so called because it is a place for lying down.

original: Su-savane, vī-tantasantāne, etehi ṇaka hoti. Suṇotīti suṇo=sunakho. Vīyatīti vīṇā=vallakī.
analyzed: susavane vītanta santāne etehi hoti suṇoti iti suṇosunakhaḥ vīyati iti vīṇāvallakī
translated: Su-savane, vī-tantasantāne, etehi ṇaka hoti. Suṇotīti suṇo=sunakho. Vīyatīti vīṇā=vallakī.

original: 67. Tiṇādayo.
analyzed: tiṇa ādayaḥ
translated: Tiṇādayo.

original: Tiṇaādayo ṇakantā nipaccante. Tija-tejane, jalopo, tejeti etenāti tiṇaṃ=bīraṇādi.
analyzed: tiṇa ādayaḥ nipaccante tija tejane ja lopaḥ teja iti etena ati tiṇaṃbīraṇa ādi
translated: Tiṇaādayo ṇakantā nipaccante. Tija-tejane, jalopo, tejeti etenāti tiṇaṃ=bīraṇādi.

original: Lī liha sāda kledānaṃ lo lavā, līyati rasato sabbattha allīyatīti loṇaṃ lavaṇaṃ,
analyzed: lī liha sāda kledānam lo lavā līyati rasataḥ sabbattha allīyati iti loṇam lavaṇam
translated: Lī liha sāda kledānaṃ lo lavā, līyati rasato sabbattha allīyatīti loṇaṃ lavaṇaṃ,

original: lehīyatīti loṇaṃ lavaṇaṃ, sādīyatīti loṇaṃ lavaṇaṃ, kledayatīti loṇaṃ lavaṇaṃ, gamissa
analyzed: lehīyati iti loṇam lavaṇam sādīyati iti loṇam lavaṇam kledayati iti loṇam lavaṇam gamissa
translated: lehīyatīti loṇaṃ lavaṇaṃ, sādīyatīti loṇaṃ lavaṇaṃ, kledayatīti loṇaṃ lavaṇaṃ, gamissa

original: o, gacchatīti goṇo=go. Hara-haraṇe, ṇassañji, harīyatīti hariṇo=migo. Īra-kampane,
analyzed: o gacchati iti goṇogaḥ hara haraṇe harīyati iti īra kampane
translated: o, gacchatīti goṇo=go. Hara-haraṇe, ṇassañji, harīyatīti hariṇo=migo. Īra-kampane,

original: rassattaṃ, ṇassa ñica, attano lūkhabhāve sampatte īrati kampatīti iriṇaṃ=ūsaraṃ.
analyzed: rassattam ṇassa ñ i ca attanaḥ lūkha bhāve sampatte īrati kampati iti iriṇaṃūsaram
translated: rassattaṃ, ṇassa ñica, attano lūkhabhāve sampatte īrati kampatīti iriṇaṃ=ūsaraṃ.

original: Thu-abhitthave, dīgho, abhitthavīyatīti thūṇaṃ=nagaraṃ, thūṇo=gharatthambho, evamaññepi.
analyzed: dīghaḥ abhitthavīyati iti thūṇam nagaram evam aññe pi
translated: Thūṇa = a city, thūṇa = a pillar of a house. So also in other words.

original: 68. Ravaṇa varaṇa pūraṇā dayo.
analyzed: ravaṇa varaṇa pūraṇā dayo
translated: Ravaṇa, varaṇa, pūraṇa, dayo.

original: Ravaṇa varaṇa pūraṇā dayo aṇappaccayena siddhā. Ravatīti ravaṇo=kokilo. Vāretīti varaṇo=pākāro. Pūrīyate anenāti pūraṇo=paripūrī.
analyzed: ravaṇa varaṇa pūraṇā dayaḥ aṇa ppaccayena siddhāḥ ravati iti ravaṇa ukokilaḥ vāreti iti varaṇa upākāro pūrīyate anena ati pūraṇa uparipūrī
translated: Ravaṇa, varaṇa, pūraṇa, dayo are formed by the addition of aṇ. Ravati = it sings, ravaṇa = a cuckoo. Vāreti = it encloses, varaṇa = an enclosure. Pūriyate by this, pūraṇa = filling.

original: (Iti ṭavaggapaccayavidhānaṃ).
analyzed: iti ṭa vagga paccaya vidhānam
translated: (Thus the addition of ṭa is completed).

original: 69. Pāvasā ati.
analyzed: pāvasā ati
translated: Pāvasā ati.

original: Pā-rakkhaṇe, vasa-nivāse, eteti ati hoti. Pubbasaralopo, pāti rakkhatīti pati=sāmī, vasanti etthāti vasati=gehaṃ.
analyzed: pārakkhaṇe vasa nivāse ete iti ati hoti pubba sara lopaḥ rakkhati iti pati sāmī vasanti ettha ati vasati geham
translated: Pā = protection, vasā = dwelling, these are ati. The preceding vowel is elided, pāti = it protects, pati = a lord. Vasanti here, vasati = a house.

original: 70. Dhā hi si tana jana jara gama sacā tu.
analyzed: dhāḥ hi si tana jana jara gama sacā tu
translated: Dhā hi si tana jana jara gama sacā tu.

original: Dhā-dhāraṇe, hi-gatiyaṃ, tana-vitthāre, jana-janane, jara-vayo-hāniyaṃ, ama gama-gamane,
analyzed: dhā dhāraṇe tana vitthāre jana janane jara vayaḥ hāniyam ama gama gamane
translated: Dhā = bearing, hi = going, tana = extending, jana = producing, jara = old age, ama = going, gama = going,

original: saca-samavāye, etehi tu hoti. Dhāretīti dhātu=gerukādi. Hinoti pavattāti phalaṃ etenāti
analyzed: saca samavāye etehi tu hoti dhāreti iti dhātu geruka ādi hinoti phalam etena ati
translated: sacā = combination, these are tu. Dhāreti = it bears, dhātu = a seed. Hinoti = it causes to go, phalaṃ etenā = fruit by this.

original: hetu=kāraṇaṃ, sevīyati janehīti setu=bandhati (paddhati). Taññateti tantu=suttaṃ.
analyzed: hetu kāraṇam sevīyati janehi iti setu bandhati paddhati tañña tā iti tantu suttam
translated: “Cause” is “reason.” “Bridge” is “bond” (bandhati). “Thread” is “line” (sutta).

original: Janīyate kammakilesehīti jantu, jāyati kammakilehīti vā jantu=satto. Jīratīti jattu=aṃsasandhi.
analyzed: janīyate kamma kilesehi iti jantu jāyati vā jantu sattaḥ jīrati iti jattu aṃsa sandhi
translated: “Creature” is “one who is born” (janīyate) “from defilements of kamma.” Or “creature” is “one who is born” (jāyati) “from defilements of kamma.” “Joint” is “a connection” (jattu).

original: Gacchatīti gantu=gamiko, sacati sametīti sattu=yavādicuṇṇaṃ.
analyzed: gacchati iti gantu gamikaḥ sacati sameti iti sattu yava ādi cuṇṇam
translated: “Traveller” is “one who goes” (gantu). “Flour” is “what is ground” (sattu).

original: 71. Arissuṭa ca.
analyzed: arissuṭa ca
translated: . And “arissuṭa.”

original: Ara-gamanetīmasmā tu hoti, arissa uṭa ādesoca. Arati pavattatīti utu=hemantādi,
analyzed: tu hoti arissa tu hoti arissa uṭaḥ ādesaḥ ca arati pavattati iti utu hemanta ādi
translated: “Season” is “what goes” (utu) “from the sign of Aries” (ara). “Season” is “what occurs” (utu).

original: 72. Pitvādayo.
analyzed: pitu ādayaḥ
translated: . “Pitvādayo.”

original: Pituādayo saddā tuantā nipaccante. Pā-rakkhaṇe, āssa ittaṃ, pāti rakkhatīti pitā=janako.🔽Pātissevādissa mo, pāyetīti mātā=jananī. Bhā-dittiyaṃ, bhātīti bhātā=sodariyo. Dhā-dhāraṇe,
analyzed: pitu ādayaḥ saddāḥ tu antāḥ nipaccante pārakkhaṇe āsse ittam pāti rakkhati iti pitājanakaḥ  pātissa iva ādissa mā u pāyeti iti mātā ajananī bhādittiyam bhāti iti bhātā sodariyaḥ dhā dhāraṇe
translated: The words “pitā” and so on end in the syllable “tu.” “Father” is “one who protects” (pāti) “his son.”

original: āssa īttaṃ, dhārīyatīti dhītā=puttī. Duha-papūraṇe, ottābhāvo, tussa ñchica. Duhati
analyzed: dhārīyati iti dhītā puttī duha papūraṇe tussaḥ duhati
translated: “Mother” is “one who nourishes” (pāyetī) “her son.” “Brother” is “one who is born” (bhātīti) “in the same family.” “Daughter” is “one who is carried” (dhārīyati) “by her father.”

original: pasave papūretīti duhitā=puttī. Jana-janane, assa āttaṃ, mā cāntādeso. Paputte janetīti
analyzed: pasave papūreti iti duhitā aputtī jana janane assa āttam mā paputte janeti iti
translated: “Son” is “one who is born” (janetī) “from his parents.”

original: jāmātā=duhitupati. Naha-bandhane, nahīyati bandhīyati pemenāti nattā-paputto. Hu-havane,
analyzed: jāmātā duhitu pati naha bandhane nahīyati bandhīyati pemena ati nattā paputtaḥ hu havane
translated: Son-in-law = husband of a daughter. Naha-binding, is bound by love, is a grandson. Hu-offering,

original: havati pūjetīti hotā=yaññako. Pū-pavane, punāti āyatiṃ bhavaṃ pavittaṃ karotīti potā=soyeva.
analyzed: havati pūjā iti iti hotā āyaññakaḥ pūpavane punāti āyatim bhavam pavittam karoti iti potā asoyā iva
translated: he offers, he worships, is an offerer = one who sacrifices. Pū-purifying, he purifies, he makes the future existence pure, is a purifier = the same.

original: 73. Jana karā ratu.
analyzed: jana karā ratu
translated: . Jana karā ratu.

original: Jana-janane, kara-karaṇe, etehi ratu hoti, rakāro antasarādilopattho. Jāyatīti jatu=lākhā. Karīyatīti katu=sayūpo yañño.
analyzed: jana janane kara karaṇe etehi hoti rakāraḥ anta sara ādi lopa tthaḥ jāyati iti jatu lākhā karīyati iti katu sayūpaḥ yaññaḥ
translated: Jana-being born, kara-making, these have ratu, the ra vowel has the meaning of “inside” etc. It is born, is a lac. It is made, is a sacrificial post.

original: 74. Sakā unto.
analyzed: sakāḥ untaḥ
translated: . Sakā unto.

original: Saka-sattiyamiccasmā unto hoti. Sakkotīti sakunto=pakkhī.
analyzed: untaḥ hoti sakkoti iti
translated: Saka-sharpness, from iccasmā unto is formed. It is able, is a bird.

original: 75. Kapā oto.
analyzed: kapaḥ o taḥ
translated: . Kapā oto.

original: Kapa-acchādane iccasmā oto hoti. Kapatīti kapoto=pārevato. Ṭo tassa vā hoti kapoṭo=soyeva.
analyzed: kapa a chādane i t o taḥ hoti tassa vā hoti
translated: Kapa-covering, from iccasmā oto is formed. It covers, is a crow. Ṭo is also formed, a crow = the same.

original: 76. Vasādīhyanto.
analyzed: vasā ādīhi antaḥ
translated: . Vasādīhyanto.

original: Vasa-nivāse, ruha-janane, bhadda-kalyāṇe, nanda-samiddhiyaṃ, jīva-pāṇadhāraṇe, evamādīti
analyzed: vasa nivāse ruha janane bhadda kalyāṇe jīva pāṇa dhāraṇe evamādi iti
translated: Vasa-dwelling, ruha-being born, bhadda-good, nanda-prosperity, jīva-life, and so on,

original: anto hohi. Vasanti etasmiṃ kāle kīḷāpasutāti vasanto=utu. Ruhati jāyatīti ruhanto=rukkho,
analyzed: antar hohi vasanti etasmin kāle ruhati jāyati iti
translated: anto is formed. They dwell in this time, they are intoxicated with play, is spring = season. It grows, it is born, is a tree.

original: evaṃnāmako migarājā ca. Bhaddissa saṃyogādilopo, bhajati kalyāṇadhammanti bhadanto=pabbajito.
analyzed: evaṃnāmakaḥ miga rājā ca bhaddissa saṃyoga ādi lopaḥ bhajati kalyāṇa dhammanti bhadanta upabbajitaḥ
translated: and the king of deer was called Bhadda. In Bhadda the -dd- is elided by the rule of sandhi, and he is called Bhadda because he associates with good people.

original: Nandati etāyāti nandantī=sakhī, nadādipāṭhā vī, evamupari ca. Jīvanti etā- yāti jīvantī=osadhi.
analyzed: nandati etā āyāti nandantī sakhī evam upari ca jīvanti etā yāti
translated: Nandati etāya = nandanti = friend. Nadati = river. Evam-upari ca. Jīvanti etāya = jīvantī = herb.

original: Savatīti savantī=nadī. Rodāpetīti rodantī=osadhi. Avati rakkhatīti avantī=janapado.
analyzed: savati iti savantī nadī roda apeti iti rodantī osadhi avati rakkhati iti avantī janapadaḥ
translated: Savati = river. Rodati = herb. Avati = country.

original: 77. Hisīnaṃ muka ca.
analyzed: hisīnam muka ca
translated: . Of birds and of the mouth.

original: Hi-gatiya, sī-saye, etehi anto hoti muka ca. Kakāro antāvayavattho, himaṃ hinoti pavattati etasminti hemanto=utu, sayanti ettha ūkā kusumādayo cāti sīmanto=kesamaggo.
analyzed: etehi antaḥ hoti ca kakāraḥ anta avayava tthaḥ himam hinoti pavattati etasmin ti sayanti ettha ūkā kusuma ādayaḥ ca ati sīmantokesamaggo
translated: Hi-going, sī-lying, these have anto and muka. The letter ka is a marker of the end of a word. Himaṃ hinoti pavattati etasmin = hemanta = season. Sayanti ettha ūkā kusumādayo cāti sīmanto = hair-parting.

original: 78. Hara ruha kulā ito.🔽Hara-haraṇe, ruha-janane, kula-patthāre, eteti ito hoti. Attano sinehaṃ haratīti
analyzed: hara ruha kulā ito  hara haraṇe ruha janane kula patthāre eta iti itas hoti sineham harati iti
translated: . Hara ruha kula from here.

original: harito=vaṇṇaviseso. Ruhatīti rohito=macchaviseso. Ruhati sarīre byāpanavasenāti rohitaṃ,
analyzed: ruhati iti rohita umaccha visesaḥ ruhati sarīre byāpana vasena ati rohitam
translated: Hara-taking away, ruha-producing, kula-supporting, these have ito. Attano sinehaṃ harati = harita = a kind of colour. Ruhati = rohita = a kind of fish. Ruhati sarīre byāpanavasena = rohitaṃ,

original: rassa latte lohitaṃ=rudhiraṃ. Attano guṇaṃ kulati pattharatīti kolito=dutiyaggasāvako,
analyzed: rassa latte lohitam rudhiram attanaḥ guṇam kulati pattharati iti
translated: Red is blood. He praises his own qualities, his family and his wealth, thus he is called Kolita = the second chief disciple.

original: evaṃ nāmako maru ca.🔽79. Bharādīhyato.
analyzed: evam nāmakaḥ maru ca  bhara ādi hi atas
translated: So is the name of Maru.🔽The affix ato is added to bhara, etc.

original: Bhara raṃja yaja paca evamādīhi ato hoti. Bharatīti bharato=naṭo. Niggahītalopo, rañjanti etthāhi rajataṃ=sajjhaṃ. Yajitabboti yajato=aggi. Pacatīti pacato=sūpakāro.🔽80. Kirā dīhyātaka.
analyzed: bhara raṃja yaja paca evamādīhi atas hoti bharati iti bharatonaṭaḥ niggahīta lopaḥ rañjanti ettha hi rajatam sajjham yajitabbaḥ iti yajatoaggi pacati iti pacatosūpa kāraḥ  kira dīhyātaka
translated: The affix ato is added to bhara, rañja, yaja, pac, etc. Bharati = a bharata = an actor. The long vowel is elided. Rajanti ettha = rajata = silver. Yajitabbo = yajata = fire. Pacati = pacata = a cook.🔽The affix ātaka is added to kira, etc.

original: Kira-vikiraṇe, ala-bandhane, cila-vasane, evamādīhi ātaka hoti, kiratīti kirāto=savaro, rassa lakke ki- lāto=sova. Alatīti alātaṃ=ummukaṃ. Cilatīti cilāto=malacchajāti.
analyzed: kira vikiraṇe ala bandhane cila vasane evamādīhi hoti kirati iti rassa lakke alati iti alātam ummukam cilati iti
translated: The affix ātaka is added to kira, vikira, ala, cila, etc. Kirati = kirāta = a mountaineer. The long vowel is elided. Vikirati = vikirāta = the same. Alati = alāta = a firebrand. Cilati = cila tā = a kind of cloth.

original: 81. Amādīhyatto.
analyzed: am ādi hyat to
translated: The affix atta is added to ama, etc.

original: Ama mā vara kalādīhi atto hoti. Amati kālantaraṃ pavattatīti amattaṃ=bhājanaṃ. Pubbasaralopo,
analyzed: ama mā vara kalā ādīhi attaḥ hoti amati kāla antaram pavattati iti amattaṃbhājanam pubba sara lopaḥ
translated: The affix atta is added to ama, mā, vara, kala, etc. Amatī ti kālantare pavattati = amatta = a vessel. The long vowel is elided.

original: mānaṃ mattaṃ=pamāṇaṃ paricchedo ca. Varantunenāti varattā=yottaṃ. Kalati paricchindatīti kalattaṃ=bhariyā.
analyzed: ca kalati paricchindati iti
translated: Mānaṃ mattaṃ = pamāṇaṃ = paricchedo = measure. Varantunenāti = varattā = a battle. Kalati paricchindati = kalattaṃ = a wife.

original: 82. Vādīhi to.
analyzed: vādīhi to
translated: 82. Vādīhi to.

original: Vā-gamane, tā-pālane, tana-vitthāre, dama-upasame, a-magamane, si-sevāyaṃ, su-savane,
analyzed: vā gamane tā pālane tana vitthāre dama aupasame ama gamane sisevāyam su savane
translated: Vā-going, tā-protecting, tana-spreading, dama-controlling, a-not going, si-serving, su-hearing,

original: pū pavane, gupa-govane, yuja-saṃyame, gaha-upādāne, ata-sātaccagamāna, khipa-peraṇe,
analyzed: pū pavane gupa govane yuja saṃyame gaha upādāne atasa atacca gamāna khipa peraṇe
translated: pū-purifying, gupa-guarding, yuja-yoking, gaha-grasping, ata-continuously going, khipa-moving,

original: evamādīhi to hoti. Vāyatīti vāto=vāyu. Tāyatīti tāto=pitā. Tanuteti tantaṃ=tantavo.
analyzed: evamādīhi to vāyati iti tāyati iti tāta upitā tanuta iti
translated: and so on. To is used with these. Vāyatīti vāto=vāyu. Tāyatīti tāto=pitā. Tanuteti tantaṃ=tantavo.

original: Damatīti anto=dasano. Amati yātīti anto=osānaṃ, koṭṭhāsasamīpāvayavā ca. Sevīyatīti
analyzed: damati iti antodasanaḥ amati yāti iti antoosānam koṭṭhāsa samīpa avayavā ca sevīyati iti
translated: Damatīti anto=dasano. Amati yātīti anto=osānaṃ, koṭṭhāsasamīpāvayavā ca. Sevīyatīti

original: seto=dhavalo. Suṇantunenāti sotaṃ=savanaṃ. Savatīti soto=jalappavāho. Punīyatīti
analyzed: setodhavalaḥ sotaṃsavanam savati iti sotaḥ jala ppavāho punīyati iti
translated: seto=dhavalo. Suṇantunenāti sotaṃ=savanaṃ. Savatīti soto=jalappavāho. Punīyatīti

original: poto=bālo. Gopīyatīti gotthaṃ=kalādi. Yojantyanenāti yottaṃ=rajju. Mamāyantehi gayhatīti
analyzed: potaḥ bālaḥ gopīyati iti gottham kalā ādi yojanti anena ati gayhati iti
translated: poto=bālo. Gopīyatīti gotthaṃ=kalādi. Yojantyanenāti yottaṃ=rajju. Mamāyantehi gayhatīti

original: gattaṃ=sarīraṃ. Abādhaṃ nirantaraṃ atati pavattatīti attā=manādi. Khipīyati etthāti khettaṃ=kedāraṃ.
analyzed: abādham nirantaram atati pavattati iti khipīyati ettha ati khettaṃkedāram
translated: gattaṃ=sarīraṃ. Abādhaṃ nirantaraṃ atati pavattatīti attā=manādi. Khipīyati etthāti khettaṃ=kedāraṃ.

original: 83. Gharādīhi taka.
analyzed: ghara ādīhi taka
translated: . Gharādīhi taka.

original: Gara ghara-secane, si-sevāyaṃ, dū-paritāpane, mida-sinehe, cita-sañcetane, pusa-posane,
analyzed: gara ghara secane du paritāpane mida sinehe cita sañcetane pusa posane
translated: in the washing of the house, in the service of the mother, in the tormenting of the father, in the love of the son, in the intention of the mind, in the nourishing of the body,

original: vida-lābhe, evamādīhi taka 4 hoti, gharati siñcatīti ghataṃ=sappi. Sevīyatīti sito=seto.
analyzed: evamādīhi hoti gharati siñcati iti sevīyati iti
translated: In the sense of “to pour out” (gharati) a pot (ghataṃ) is a vessel (sappi). In the sense of “to be cool” (si-sevati) a cold (sito) thing is a white (seto) thing.

original: Dubbacattā dūyati paritāpetīti dūto=pesarakāro. Mijjati sinehatīti mitto=suhadayo.🔽Cintetīti cittaṃ=viññāṇaṃ cittakammādi ca. Posīyatīti putto=attajo. Vindanti pīti
analyzed: dubbaca ttā dūyati paritāpeti iti dūta upesara kāraḥ mijjati sinehati iti  cinteti iti cittam viññāṇam citta kamma ādi ca posīyati iti vindanti
translated: In the sense of “to be difficult to conquer” (dubbacattā dūyati) a messenger (dūto) is a go-between (pesarakāro). In the sense of “to be mixed with affection” (mijjati sinehati) a friend (mitto) is a well-wisher (suhadayo).

original: manenāti vittaṃ=dhanaṃ. Vara-varaṇasambhattīsu, varaṇaṃ vattaṃ=brahmacariyādi.🔽84. Nettādayo.
analyzed: vittam dhanam vara varaṇa sambhattīsu varaṇam vattam brahmacariya ādi  na it ta ādayaḥ
translated: In the sense of “to be thought” (cinteti) a mind (cittaṃ) is consciousness (viññāṇaṃ) and mental work (cittakamma). In the sense of “to be nourished” (posīyati) a son (putto) is a child (attajo). In the sense of “to be found” (vindanti) by the mind (manena) a treasure (vittaṃ) is wealth (dhanaṃ).🔽In the sense of “to be chosen” (varaṇa) and “to be combined” (sambhaṭṭi) a choice (varaṇaṃ) is a vow (vattaṃ) such as celibacy.

original: Nettaādayo taka parā nipaccante. Nī-pāpane, ettaṃ, tuka ca nipātanā. Nayati pāpetīti🔽nettaṃ=nayanaṃ, netā ca. Kara-kara-ṇe, assu, karaṇaṃ kuttaṃ=kiriyā. Kamissa assu,
analyzed: na it ta ādayaḥ taka parāḥ nipaccante nī pāpane ettam tuka ca nipātanā nayati pāpeti iti  nettaṃnayanam netā ca kara karaṇe assu karaṇam kuttaṃkiriyā kamissa assu
translated: The words “to lead” (netā) etc. are formed by adding the suffix taka to the root. In the sense of “to pour out” (nī-pāpane) a net (nettaṃ) is a trap (tuka). In the sense of “to lead” (nayati pāpeti) a leader (netā) is a guide (nayanaṃ).

original: kamati yātīti kunto=āvudhaviseso. Rama-kīḷāyaṃ, supubbo, sussaniccaṃ dīgho. Suṭṭhu
analyzed: kamati yāti iti kunta āvudha visesaḥ rama kīḍā ayam su pubbaḥ sussa niccam dīghaḥ suṭṭhu
translated: In the sense of “to make” (kara-kara-ṇa) a maker (karaṇaṃ) is a worker (kuttaṃ). In the sense of “to be made” (kamissa) a maker (kunto) is a special kind of weapon (āvudhaviseso). In the sense of “to play” (rama-kīḷāya) a good (supubbo) thing is a long (dīgho) thing. In the sense of “to be good” (suṭṭhu) a good (supubbo) thing is a beautiful (sundaro) thing.

original: ramaṇaṃ, suṭṭhu ramatīti vā sūrato=sukhasaṃvāso. Mihissaissu, mihati siñcatīti muttaṃ=passāvo.🔽Pāla=rakkhaṇe āssa rassattaṃ, ñica. Pālīyatīti palitaṃ=kesalomānaṃ jarāya kataṃ setattaṃ,🔽saddhādittā akāre taṃ yassa atthi so palito=pumā, palitā=itthī. Mhissa si, mihi ca,🔽mhayanaṃ sitaṃ=mandahasitaṃ, mhayanaṃ mihitaṃ=tadeva, kusa-akkose tassa īña, kusīyati
analyzed: ramaṇam suṭṭhu ramati iti vā sūratas sukha saṃvāsaḥ mihissaissu mihati siñcati iti muttaṃpassāvaḥ  pāla rakkhaṇe jarāya katam  saddhā dittāḥ akāre tam yassa atthi saḥ palitopumā palitāitthī mhissa si mihi ca  sitam mandahasitam mhayanam kusa akkose tassaḥ īña kusīyati
translated: It is delightful (ramaṇaṃ), or it delights well (suṭṭhu ramatī), thus it is delightful (sūrato = sukhasaṃvāso). It is urine (muttaṃ = passāvo), because it is sprinkled (mihati) and poured out (siñcati).

original: akkosīyatīti kusīto=alaso, si=bandhane, dīgho, senti bandhanti gharāvāsaṃ etāyāti🔽sītā=naṅgalalekhā, evamaññepi.🔽85. Samādīhyatho.🔽Sama-upasame, dara-daraṇe, dama-upasame, kilama klama-gelaññe, sapa-akkose, vasa-nivāse,🔽āpubbo, evamādīhi atho hoti. Sametīti samatho=samādhi. Daraṇaṃ daratho=pīḷā. Damanaṃ
analyzed: akkosīyati iti si bandhane dīghaḥ senti bandhanti ghara āvāsam 🔽sītā anaṅgalalekhā evam aññe pi 🔽samādīhi atho 🔽sama aupasame dara daraṇe dama aupasame kilama klama gelaññe sa paakkose vasa nivāse 🔽evamādīhi atho hoti sameti iti daraṇam darathopīḷā damanam

It is a smile (mihitaṃ = mandahasitaṃ), because it is smiled (mihayanaṃ sitaṃ). It is a smile (tadeva), because it is smiled (mihayanaṃ mihitaṃ). original: damatho=damo. Kilamanaṃ kilamatho=parissamo. Sapanaṃ sapatho=saccakaraṇaṃ. Āvasanti
analyzed: damatha udamaḥ kilamanam kilamatha uparissamaḥ sapanam sapatha usacca karaṇam āvasanti
translated: Restraint is taming. Weariness is weariness. Suffering is the doing of what is true. They dwell.

original: etthāti āvasatho=gharaṃ.
analyzed: ettha ati
translated: Damming is taming. Weariness is fatigue. Sleeping is lying down. They live in it, thus it is a dwelling.

original: 86. Upavasā vassoṭa ca.
analyzed: upavasā vassoṭa ca
translated: . Upavasa and vassa.

original: Upapubbā vasatismā atho hoti, vassa oṭa cādeso. Upavasanti etthāti uposatho=tithiviseso, navamahatthi kulañca.
analyzed: upapubbā vasatisma atho hoti vassaḥ oṭa ca ādesaḥ upavasanti ettha ati uposatha utithi visesaḥ navama hatthi kulam ca
translated: The prefix upa and vas, to live, make upavasa, to live near, and vassa, to live in, has the substitution of o for a. They live near it, thus it is a uposatha, a special day, the ninth day of the half-month, and a family.

original: 87. Ramā thaka.
analyzed: ramā thaka
translated: . Rama and thaka.

original: Ramatismā thaka hoti, kānubandhakaraṇasāmatthiyā ata kārādopi malopo. Ramanti kīḷanti etenāti ratho=sandano.
analyzed: ramatismā thaka hoti ka anubandha karaṇa sāmatthiyā a taḥ ma lopaḥ ramanti kīḍanti etena ati rathosandanaḥ
translated: The prefix raṃ and thaka make rama, to enjoy, and thaka, to bind, because of the ability to bind. The prefix raṃ has the elision of the a, even though it is not followed by a vowel. They enjoy, they play, by means of it, thus it is a chariot = a vehicle.

original: 88. Titthādayo.🔽Titthaādayo thakaparā nipaccante. Tara-taraṇe, assa ittaṃ, pararūpādi, tarantyanenāti
analyzed: tittha ādayaḥ  tittha ādayaḥ thaka parāḥ nipaccante tara taraṇe assaḥ ittam para rūpa ādi taranti anena ati
translated: . Tittha and so on.

original: titthaṃ=najjādiṃ yenāvataranti taṃ. Sica-rakkhaṇe, secatīti sittaṃ=madhucchiṭṭhaṃ.
analyzed: tittham najja ādim yena avataranti tam sica rakkhaṇe secati iti sittam madhucchiṭṭham
translated: The words beginning with tittha are declined as thaka. Tara, to cross, and taraṇa, crossing, have the feminine itthaṃ. Pararūpa, etc., means by means of it they cross, thus it is a ford = a place for going down to a river, etc. Sica, to sprinkle, and rakkhaṇa, protection, make sitta = honey-water.

original: Hasa-hasane, hasantyanenāti hattho=karo, nakkhattāñca. Gāyatīti gāthā=pajjaviseso.
analyzed: hasa hasane hasanti anena ati hatthokaraḥ nakkhattāñca gāyati iti gāthā pajja visesaḥ
translated: Hasa, to laugh, and hasana, laughing, make hattha = hand, and nakkhatta = star. Gāyati, he sings, makes gāthā = a special kind of verse.

original: Aranti pavattantyanenāti attho=dhanaṃ. Rogaṃ tudati pīḷetīti tutthaṃ=osadhaṃ. Yu-missane,🔽dīgho, yavatīti yū- tho=sajātikānaṃ tiracchānānaṃsamūho. Gupa-gopane, dīgho, palopo,🔽paṭikūlattā gopīyatīti gūtho=vaccaṃ, evamaññepi.🔽89. Vasa masa kusā thu.🔽Vasa-nivāse, masa-āmasane, kusa-akkose, etehi thu hoti. Vasanti etthāti vatthu=padattho. Dadhiṃ āmasatīti matthu=dadhimaṇḍo. Kusīyati akkosīyati bhera vanādattāti kotthu=sigālo.🔽90. Saka vasā thi.🔽Saka-sattiyaṃ, vasa-nivāse, etehi thi hoti. Sakkoti gantumanenāti satthi=ūru. Vasīyati acchādīyatīti vatthi=nābhiyā adho.🔽91. Vīto thika.
analyzed: aranti pavattanti anena ati atthodhanam rogam tudati pīḍeti iti tuttham osadham yumissane  dīghaḥ yavati iti yū thosa jātikānam tiracchānā naṃ samūhaḥ dīghaḥ pa lopaḥ  paṭikūla ttā gopīyati iti evam aññe pi  vasa masa kusā thu  vasa nivāse masa āmasane kusa akkose etehi thu hoti vasanti ettha ati vatthu pada tthaḥ dadhim āmasati iti matthu dadhimaṇḍaḥ kusīyati akkosīyati bhera vanādattā ati kotthu sigālaḥ  saka vasā thi  sakasattiyam vasa nivāse etehi thi hoti sakkoti gantum anena ati satthi ūru vasīyati acchādīyati iti vatthi nābhiyā adhas  vītaḥ thika
translated: The meaning is: it goes round and round.🔽It destroys, i.e. afflicts, disease, thus it is a remedy.🔽In the sense of ‘mixing together’,🔽in the sense of ‘long’,🔽it is covered, i.e. hidden, because of its repulsiveness, thus it is excrement. So too with the rest.🔽89. Vasa, masa, kusā, thu.🔽In the sense of ‘dwelling’, ‘pressing’, ‘annoying’,🔽these have thu. The meaning is: ‘They dwell here’, thus it is a place. It presses curds, thus it is a curds-churner. It annoys, i.e. is annoyed, by the sound of the forest, thus it is a jackal.🔽90. Saka, vasā, thi.🔽In the sense of ‘piercing’, ‘dwelling’,🔽these have thi. The meaning is: ‘It is able to go with this’, thus it is a thigh. It is covered, i.e. concealed, thus it is the navel-string.

original: Vī vā-gamanetīmasmā thika hoti. Vīyanti gacchanti etāyāti vīthi=āvali.🔽92. Sārismā rati.
analyzed: vī vīyanti gacchanti 🔽sārismā rati
