original: Sārismā ṇyantā rathi hoti. Sāretīti sārathi=ratha-vāho.
analyzed: rathi sāra iti iti sārathi ratha vāhaḥ
translated: A charioteer has a chariot. He drives it, thus he is a charioteer .

original: 93. Tā-tā ithi.
analyzed: tāta ithi
translated: . Tā-tā ithi.

original: Tā-pālane, ata-sātaccagamane, etehi ithi hoti. Tāyati pāletīti tithi=paṭipadādi, atati gacchatīti atithi=abbhāgato.
analyzed: tā pālane atasā tacca gamane etehi ithi hoti tāyati pāleti iti tithi paṭipad ādi atati gacchati iti atithi abbhāgato
translated: Tā-pālane, ata-sātaccagamane, these are ithi. He protects by carrying, thus he is a carrier . He goes by passing over, thus he is a guest .

original: 94. Isā thī.
analyzed: isā thī
translated: . Isā thī.

original: Isatismā thī hoti. Icchati icchīyatīti vā itthī=nārī.
analyzed: thī icchati icchīyati iti vā itthī nārī
translated: Isatismā thī hoti. She is desired, thus she is a woman .

original: 95. Ruda khuda muda mada chida sūda sapa kamā daka.🔽Etehi daka hoti. Rudatīti ruddo=umāpati. Rassa latte luddo=nesādo. Khudati asahatīti🔽khuddo=nīco. Modanti etāyāti muddā=sakkharamaṅguliyaṃ. Majjanti asminti maddo=janapado.
analyzed: ruda khuda muda mada chida sūda sapa kamā daka  etehi hoti rudati iti ruddoumāpati rassa latte khudati asahati iti  modanti etāya ati muddā sakkharam aṅguliyam majjanti asmin ti maddo janapadaḥ
translated: . Ruda khuda muda mada chida sūda sapa kamā daka.🔽These are daka. He weeps, thus he is a ruddy goose . He is low, thus he is a low-caste man . They rejoice in it, thus it is a dice-game . They are intoxicated in it, thus it is a country .

original: Chijjatīti chiddaṃ=randhaṃ. Ūssa rassattaṃ, sūdati sāmikehi bhatiṃ pakkharatīti suddo=vasalo.
analyzed: chijjati iti sūdati sāmikehi bhatim pakkharati iti
translated: It is cut, thus it is a hole . It is low, thus it is a low-caste man . He serves for wages his masters, thus he is a slave .

original: Sapantunenāti saddo=sotavisayo. Kāmīyatīti kando=mūlaviseso.
analyzed: kāmīyati iti kando mūla visesaḥ
translated: It is sounded, thus it is a sound . It is desired, thus it is a root .

original: 96. Kundādayo.
analyzed: kunda ādayaḥ
translated: . Kundādayo.

original: Kundaādayo dakaantā nipaccante. Kamissa assu, kāmīyatīti kundo=pupphavidhasaso, maṇissa🔽mana, maññateti mando=jaḷo. Vuṇātissa buna, vuṇīyati saṃvarīyatīti bundo=mūlappadeso.🔽Ninda-garahāyaṃ, nalopo, nindīyatīti niddā=soppaṃ. Unda-kiledane, nalopo, undati
analyzed: kunda ādayaḥ daka antāḥ nipaccante kamissa assu kāmīyati iti maṇissa  mana maññata iti mandojaḷaḥ vuṇātissa vuṇīyati saṃvarīyati iti bundomūla ppadeso  ninda gara hā ayam na lopaḥ nindīyati iti unda kiledane na lopaḥ undati
translated: The water-endings kunda, etc., are formed by adding -a to the roots. Kunda is formed by adding -a to the root kunda, to be wet, because it is wet with water. Manda is formed by adding -a to the root man, to think, because it is thought to be slow. Bundo is formed by adding -a to the root vuṇ, to be wet, because it is wet with water.

original: kiledatīti uddo=jalabiḷālo. Saṃpubbassa undissa ca, sammā undati kiledatīti samuddo=sāgaro.
analyzed: kiledati iti uddo jala biḷālo saṃpubbassa undissa ca sammā undati kiledati iti samuddo sāgaro
translated: Niddā is formed by adding -a to the root ninda, to blame, because it is blamed. Uddo is formed by adding -a to the root unda, to be muddy, because it is muddy. Samuddo is formed by adding -a to the root unda, to be muddy, because it is well muddy.

original: Pula-mahattahiṃ sāñāṇesu, imuña, pulati hiṃsatīti pulindo=savaro. Evaṃ-maññepi.
analyzed: sā ñāṇesu evaṃmaññe pi
translated: Pulindo is formed by adding -a to the root pula, to hurt, because it hurts. Evaṃ-maññepi is formed by adding -a to the root evaṃ-maññ, to think thus.

original: 97. Dadā du.
analyzed: dadā du
translated: Dadā du.

original: Dada-dānetīmasmā du hoti. Dukkhaṃ dadātīhi daddu=kuṭṭhaviseso.
analyzed: dadadānā iti imasmai du hoti dukkham dadātīhi daddu kuṭṭha viseso
translated: Du is added to dada, to give, because it gives suffering. Daddu is formed by adding -a to the root dad, to give, because it gives suffering.

original: 98. Khanāna dama ramā dho.🔽Khana khaṇa-avadāraṇe, ana-pāṇane, dama-upasame, rama-kīḷāyaṃ, etehi dho hoti. Ñāṇena
analyzed: khanāna dama rama dho  khana khaṇa avadāraṇe an apāṇane dama aupasame rama kīḷāyam etehi dhaḥ hoti ñāṇena
translated: Khanāna dama ramā dho.🔽Dho is added to khana, to dig, ana, to breathe, dama, to control, ram, to play, because it is dug, because it breathes, because it is controlled, because it plays. Khandho is formed by adding -a to the root khan, to dig, because it is dug by knowledge.

original: dhaññateti khandho=rāsi. Anati jīvati etenāti andho=acakkhuko. Dametabboti dandho=jaḷo,
analyzed: dhaññatā iti jīvati etena ati andhoacakkhukaḥ dametabbo ti dandhojaḷaḥ
translated: Andho is formed by adding -a to the root ana, to live, because it lives without this. Dandho is formed by adding -a to the root dama, to be controlled, because it is slow.

original: ramanti ettha sappādayoti randhaṃ=chiddaṃ.
analyzed: ramanti ettha sappādayo ti
translated: The place where they are delighted in is a randha = hole.

original: 99. Muddhā dayo.
analyzed: muddhā dayo
translated: Muddhā dayo.

original: Muddhaādayo dhantā nipaccante. Muda-tose, ottābhāvo, modanti ettha ūkāti muddhā=matthako.
analyzed: muddha ādayaḥ dhantā nipaccante mudatose otta abhāvaḥ modanti ettha ūkā ati muddhāmatthakaḥ
translated: The words muddhādayo are declined. Muda-tose, ottābhāvo, modanti ettha ūkāti muddhā=matthako.

original: Ara-gamane, aranti yanti etthāti addhā=maggo, kālo ca, addhaṃ=upaddhaṃ. Gidha-abhi
analyzed: ara gamane aranti yanti ettha ati addhā maggo kālaḥ ca addham upaddham gidha abhi
translated: Ara-gamane, aranti yanti etthāti addhā=maggo, kālo ca, addhaṃ=upaddhaṃ. Gidha-abhi

original: kaṅkhāyaṃ, issa attaṃ, gedhatīti gaddho=gijjho. Vidha-vedhane, ettābhāvo, parivajjhatīti
analyzed: kaṅkhāyam issa attam gedhati iti gaddhaḥ gijjhaḥ vidha vedhane parivajjhati iti
translated: Kaṅkhāyaṃ, issa attaṃ, gedhatīti gaddho=gijjho. Vidha-vedhane, ettābhāvo, parivajjhatīti

original: viddhaṃ=vimalaṃ, evamaññepi.
analyzed: viddham vimalam evam aññe pi
translated: Viddhaṃ=vimalaṃ, so also in other words.

original: 100. Sīto dhuka.
analyzed: sīto dhuka
translated: . Sīto dhuka.

original: Setismā dhuka hoti. Sayanti etāyāti sīdhu=surāviseso.
analyzed: seti sma hoti sīdhu surā visesaḥ
translated: Setismā dhuka hoti. Sayanti etāyāti sīdhu=a kind of liquor.

original: 101. Varārakarataradarayamaajjamithasakā kuno.
analyzed: vara ara kara tara dara ya maajja mitha sakā kunaḥ
translated: . Varārakarataradarayamaajjamithasakā kuno.

original: Vara-varaṇasambhattīsu, ara-gamane, kara-karaṇe, tara-tara-ṇe dara-vidāraṇe, yama-uparame,
analyzed: vara varaṇa sambhattīsu ara gamane kara karaṇe tara taraṇe dara vidāraṇe yama auparame
translated: Vara-varaṇasambhattīsu, ara-gamane, kara-karaṇe, tara-taraṇe dara-vidāraṇe, yama-uparame,

original: ajja sajja-ajjane, mitha-saṅgame, saka-sattiyaṃ, etehi kuno hoti. “Rā nassa ṇo”ti
analyzed: ajja sajja ajjane mitha saṅgame etehi ku naḥ hoti rā nassa ṇa iti
translated: Ajja sajja-ajjane, mitha-saṅgame, saka-sattiyaṃ, etehi kuno hoti. “Rā nassa ṇo”ti

original: (5-171) nassa ṇattaṃ, vāretīti varuṇo=evaṃnāmako isi, devarājā, pādapo ca. Arati
analyzed: nassa ṇattam vāreti iti varuṇaḥ evaṃnāmakaḥ deva rājā pādapaḥ ca arati
translated: (5-171) The state of being destroyed is nassa, and he who keeps back is Varuna, the name of a sage, a king of the gods, and a tree. Arati

original: gacchatīti aruṇo=sūriyo, tassa sārathi ca. Paradukkhe sati sādhūnaṃ hadayakammanaṃ🔽karotīti karuṇā=dayā. Bālabhāvaṃ atarīti taruṇo=yuvā. “Ṇiṇāpina”nti (5.160) yogavibhāgā
analyzed: gacchati iti aruṇosūriyo tassa sārathi ca para dukkhe sati sādhūnam hadaya kammanam  karoti iti karuṇā dayā bāla bhāvam yogavibhāgā
translated: goes away is aruna, the sun, and his charioteer. When there is suffering of others, the good make a movement of the heart🔽towards them is karuna, compassion. He who has crossed over the state of being a child is taruna, a youth. “Ninapina” (.) is a

original: ṇilopo, vidāretīti dāruṇo=kakkhaḷo. Yameti pāvaṃ nāsetīti yamunā=ekā mahānadī. Ajjati🔽dhanasañcayaṃ karotīti ajjuno=rājā, rukkhaviseso ca. Mitho saṅgamo mithunaṃ=pumitthiyugaḷaṃ.
analyzed: ṇi lopaḥ vidāreti iti dāruṇa ukakkhaḷaḥ yameti pāvam nāseti iti yamunā ekā mahā nadī ajjati  dhana sañcayam karoti iti ca mithas saṅgamaḥ
translated: division of the yogas. The wind is removed is anilo, and he who tears is daruna, harsh. He who causes the sin to go away is🔽Yamuna, a great river. It shines is ajja, and it makes a heap of wealth is ajjuna, a king, and a kind of tree. The union of two is

original: Sakkotīti sakuno=pakkhī. Nadādipāṭhā vīmhi=sakunī. “Tathanarānaṃṭaṭṭhaṇalā”ti (1-27)
analyzed: sakkotīti sakuna upakkhī nada ādi pāṭhā vīmhi sakunī
translated: mithuna, a pair of male and female. He is able is sakuna, a bird. The reading nadati etc. is sakuni. “Tathanarana ntattha na la” (.)

original: vā ṇatte=sakuṇo, sakuṇi.
analyzed: vā sakuṇi
translated: is sakuna, sakuni.🔽. Ajina, etc.

original: 102. Ajā ino.
analyzed: ajaḥ inaḥ
translated: 102. The unproduced.

original: Aja vaja-gamane tīmasmā ino hoti. Ajati vikkayaṃ yātīti ajinaṃ=cammaṃ.
analyzed: aja vaja gamane tīmasmai inaḥ hoti ajati vikkayam yāti iti ajinaṃcammaṃ
translated: Ajina, etc. is formed from the root aj, to go, with the suffix ino. He who goes to sell is ajina, a skin.🔽. Vipina, etc.

original: 103. Vipinādayo.
analyzed: vipina ādayaḥ
translated: 103.The “forest” and so on.

original: Vipinaādayo inantā nipaccante. Vapa-bījanikkhepe, assa ittaṃ, vapanti etthāti vipinaṃ=vanaṃ.
analyzed: vipina ādayaḥ in antāḥ nipaccante vapa bīja nikkhepe assa ittam vapanti ettha ati vipinam vanam
translated: Vapa-bījanikkhepe, assa ittaṃ, vapanti etthāti vipinaṃ=vanaṃ.

original: Supa-saye, supanti etenāti supinaṃ=niddā, supantena diṭṭhañca. Tuda-byathane, dassa
analyzed: su pa saye supanti etena ati supinaṃniddā supantena diṭṭham ca tuda byathane dassa
translated: Supa-saye, supanti etenāti supinaṃ=niddā, supantena diṭṭhañca. Tuda-byathane, dassa

original: ho, tudati satte pīḷetīti tuhinaṃ=himaṃ. Kappa-sāmatthiye, kappati ripavo vijetuṃ
analyzed: ho tudati satte pīḍeti iti tuhinaṃhimam kappa sāmatthiye kappati ripavaḥ vijetum
translated: ho, tudati satte pīḷetīti tuhinaṃ=himaṃ. Kappa-sāmatthiye, kappati ripavo vijetuṃ

original: samatthetīti kappino=rājā. Kama-padavikkhepe, assa uttaṃ, kamanti ettha mīnādayo
analyzed: samattheti iti kappinorājā kama pada vikkhepe assa uttam kamanti ettha mīna ādayaḥ
translated: samatthetīti kappino=rājā. Kama-padavikkhepe, assa uttaṃ, kamanti ettha mīnādayo

original: pavisantīti kuminaṃ=macchabandhanopakaraṇaviseso. Dā-dāne, denti etasminti dinaṃ=divaso, evamaññepi.
analyzed: pavisanti iti dādāne denti etasmin ti dinaṃdivaso evam aññe pi
translated: pavisantīti kuminaṃ=macchabandhanopakaraṇaviseso. Dā-dāne, denti etasminti dinaṃ=divaso, evamaññepi.

original: 104. Kirā kano.
analyzed: kira kano
translated: . Kirā kano.

original: Kiratismā kano hoti. Nassa ṇo, kiranti vikirantīti kiraṇā=raṃsiyo.
analyzed: kiratisma hoti nassa no kiranti vikiranti iti kiraṇāraṃsiyaḥ
translated: Kiratismā kano hoti. Nassa ṇo, kiranti vikirantīti kiraṇā=raṃsiyo.

original: 105. Dī jiimīhi naka.
analyzed: dī jiimīhi naka
translated: . Dī jiimīhi naka.

original: Dī-khaye, ji-jaye, i-ajjhenagatīsu, mī-hiṃsāyaṃ, etehi naka hoti. Adesi khayamagamāsīti
analyzed: dīkhaye jijaye etehi hoti adesi khayam agamāsi iti
translated: Dī-khaye, ji-jaye, i-ajjhenagatīsu, mī-hiṃsāyaṃ, etehi naka hoti. Adesi khayamagamāsīti

original: dīno=niddhano. Pañcamāre ajinīti jino=buddho. Esi issarattamagamāsīti ino=sāmī. Mīyate
analyzed: pañca māre ajinī iti jinobuddhaḥ esi iti inosāmī mīyate
translated: Dīna = low. Pañcamāre ajinī = jino = Buddha. Esi issarattamagamāsī = ino = lord. Mīyate

original: hiṃsīyateti mīno=maccho.
analyzed: hiṃsīyata iti mīnomacchaḥ
translated: hiṃsīyate = mīno = fish.

original: 106. Sidhāvīvāhi no.
analyzed: sidhāvī iva naḥ
translated: Sidhāvīvāhi no.

original: Si-bandhane, dhā-dhāraṇe, vī vā-gamane, etehi no hoti. Seti bandhatīti seno=sasādano
analyzed: si bandhane dhā dhāraṇe vī vā gamane sā iti bandhati iti senā usasādanaḥ
translated: Si-in binding, dhā-in bearing, vī-in going, no is added to these. Seti bandhatīti = seno = one who binds, an assailant.

original: senā=camū. Dhāretīti dhānā=bhajjitayavo. Veti pavattatīti veno=hīnajāti. Sattesu
analyzed: senā camū dhāreti iti dhānā bhajjita yavaḥ vā iti pavattati iti sattesu
translated: Senā = an army. Dhāretīti = dhānā = parched grain. Veti pavattatīti = veno = one of low birth. In beings

original: vāti pavattatīti vānaṃ=taṇhā.
analyzed: vāti pavattati iti vānaṃtaṇhā
translated: vāti pavattatīti = vānaṃ = craving.

original: 107. Ūnādayo.
analyzed: ūna ādayaḥ
translated: Ūnādayo.

original: Ūnaādayo nantā nīpaccante. Ūha-vitakke, halopo, ūhanaṃ ūno=apuṇṇo. Hi-gatiyaṃ, dīghattaṃ,
analyzed: ūna ādayaḥ na ntāḥ nī paccante ūha vitakke ha lopaḥ ūhanam ūna u a puṇṇaḥ hi gatiyam dīgha ttam
translated: Ūnaādayo nantā nīpaccante. Ūha-vitakke, halopo, ūhanaṃ ūno = not full. Hi-in going, dīghattaṃ,🔽hesi hīnattamagamīti = hīno = nihīno = low. Ci-in heaping, dīghattaṃ,

original: hesi hīnattamagamīti hīno=nihīno. Ci-caye, dīghattaṃ, cayanti ettha ratanānīti cīno=janapado.
analyzed: hesi hīnattamagami iti cicaye dīghattam cayanti ettha ratanāni iti cīnaḥ janapadaḥ
translated: cayanti ettha ratanānīti = cīno = a country.

original: Hanissa jagho, haññatīti jaghanaṃ=kaṭi. Ṭhāssa the ṭhāti pavattatīti theno=coro.
analyzed: hanissa haniḥ haññati iti jaghanaṃkaṭi ṭhāssa the pavattati iti
translated: Hanissa jagho, haññatīti = jaghanaṃ = hip. Ṭhāssa the ṭhāti pavattatīti = theno = a thief.

original: Undissa odo, undīyatīti odano=annaṃ. Annaṃ. Raṃjissa niggahītalopo, aka ca, raṃjate
analyzed: undissa odaḥ undīyati iti odanaḥ annam annam raṃjissa niggahīta lopaḥ ca raṃjate
translated: Undissa odo, undīyatīti = odano = food. Food. Raṃjissa niggahītalopo, aka ca, raṃjate

original: anenāti rajanaṃ=rāgo. Rañjanti etthāti rajanī=ratti. Padissa junuka, pajjati gacchatīti
analyzed: anena ati rajanaṃrāgaḥ rañjanti ettha ati rajanīratti padissa pajjati gacchati iti
translated: By this (means) red colour = passion. They are delighted in it = the night. It is the young of the bird padī, it flies, it goes =

original: pajjunno=indo, megho ca. Gamissa gaṅa, gacchanti ettha vihaṅgādayoti gaganaṃ=antalikkhaṃ, evamaññepi.
analyzed: meghaḥ ca gamissa gacchanti ettha vihaṅga ādayaḥ ti evam aññe pi
translated: the sun, and a cloud. They go in it = the sky = the firmament. So also in the other (words).

original: 108. Vī patā tano.
analyzed: vī pata tano
translated: . Vī patā tano.

original: Vī vā-gamane, pata patha-gamane, etehi tano hoti. Veti pavattati etenāti vetanaṃ=bhati. Patanti etthāti pattanaṃ=nagaraṃ.
analyzed: vī vā āgamane pata patha gamane etehi tanaḥ hoti vā iti pavattati etena ati vetanaṃbhati patanti ettha ati pattanaṃnagaram
translated: Vī-to fly, pata-to go, from these tano is formed. It is spread by this = wages = service. They fall in it = a port = a town.

original: 109. Ramā tanaka.
analyzed: ramā tanaka
translated: . Ramā tanaka.

original: Rama kīḷāyamicasmā tanaka hoti. “Gamādirānaṃ lopontassā”ti (5.109) malopo, ramanti etthāti ratanaṃ=maṇi ādī, hatthamattañca.
analyzed: rama tanaka hoti ma lopaḥ ramanti ettha ati hattha mattam ca
translated: Ram-to play, from this tanaka is formed. “The locative ending of gamādirānaṃ is dropped” (Pāṇini 1.1.58), therefore the locative ending is dropped. They play in it = a gem = a jewel, and so on, (even) a hand’s breadth.

original: 110., Sū bhāhi nuka,
analyzed: su bhāhi nuka
translated: ., Sū bhāhi nuka,

original: Sū-pasave, bhā-dittiyaṃ, etehi nuka hoti. Pasavīyatīti sūnu=putto. Bhāti dibbatīti bhānu=sūriyo.
analyzed: su upasave bhādittiyam etehi nuka hoti pasavīyati iti sūnu puttaḥ bhāti dibbati iti bhānu sūriyaḥ
translated: Sū-to increase, bhā-to shine, from these nuka is formed. It increases = a son = a child. It shines, it burns = the sun = the sun.

original: 111. Dhāsse ca.
analyzed: dhāsse ca
translated: . Dhāsse ca.

original: Dhā-dhāraṇetīmasmā nuka hoti, dhāssa e ca. Dhāretīti dhenu=gāvī.
analyzed: hoti hoti ca dhārā iti iti dhenugāvī
translated: Dhā-to bear, from this nuka is formed, and e is added to dhā. It bears = a milch cow.

original: 112. Vattā ṭāva dhamāsehyani.
analyzed: vattā ṭāva
translated: . Vattā ṭāva dhamāsehyani.

original: Vatta-vattane, aṭa-gamanattho, ava-rakkhaṇe, dhama-sadde, asa-khepane, etehi ani🔽hoti. Vattanti etenāti vattani=tasaradaṇḍaṃ. Vīmhi vattanī=pantho. Aṭate gammateti
analyzed: vatta vattane aṭa gamanatthaḥ avarakkhaṇe dhama sadde asa khepane etehi ani  hoti vattanti etena ati vattanita sara daṇḍam vīmhi vattanī panthaḥ aṭate
translated: In the sense of ‘going round and round’, in the sense of ‘standing’, in the sense of ‘protecting’, in the sense of ‘sound’, in the sense of ‘hurling’, these have

original: aṭani= mañcaṅgo. Satte avati rakkhatīti avani=mahī. Dhamanti etena vīṇādayoti dhamani=sīrā.
analyzed: aṭani mañcaṅgo satte avati rakkhati iti avani mahī dhamanti etena vīṇā ādayo ti dhamani sīrā
translated: ani. Vattanti etenā ti vattani = a plough. Vīmahi vattani = a path. Aṭate gammate ti aṭani = a bedstead. Sattā avati rakkhatī ti avani = the earth. Dhamanti etena vīṇādayo ti dhamani = a bow.

original: Daṇḍatthāya asīyate khipīyateti asani=kulisaṃ.
analyzed: daṇḍatthāya asīyate khipīyate iti asani kulisam
translated: Daṇḍatthāya asīyati khipīyati ti asani = a stone.

original: 113. Yuto ni.
analyzed: yu taḥ ni
translated: . Yuto ni.

original: Yu-missanetīmasmā ni hoti. Yavanti sattā anena etībhāvaṃ gacchantīti yoni=bhagaṃ, aṇḍajādiyoni ca.
analyzed: ni hoti yavanti sattāḥ anena etībhāvam gacchanti iti yoni bhagam aṇḍaja ādi yoni ca
translated: Yu-missanettimasmā ni hoti. Yavanti sattā anena etībhāvaṃ gacchantī ti yoni = a womb, and the womb of the egg-born, etc.

original: (Iti tavaggapaccayavidhānaṃ).
analyzed: iti ta vagga paccaya vidhānam
translated: (Thus ends the section on the conditions of the tav-group).

original: 114. Camāpa pā vapā po.
analyzed: camāpa pā vapā po
translated: . Camāpa pā vapā po.

original: Cama-adane, apa-pāpuṇane, pā-rakkhaṇe, vapa-bījanikkhepe, etehi po hoti. Camanti
analyzed: cama adane apapāpuṇane pārakkhaṇe vapa bīja nikkhepe etehi po hoti camanti
translated: In the sense of ‘eating’, in the sense of ‘reaching’, in the sense of ‘protecting’, in the sense of ‘sowing’, these have po. Camanti

original: adanti etthāti campā=nagaraṃ, apesi īsakamattamagamāsīti appaṃ=abahu. Apāyaṃ pāti
analyzed: adanti ettha ati campā nagaram apesi īsaka mattama gamāsi iti apāyam pāti
translated: adanti etthā ti campā = a city. Apesi īsakamattamagamāsī ti appaṃ = not much. Apāyaṃ pāti

original: rakkhatīti pāpaṃ-kibbisaṃ. Vapanti etthāti vappo=kedāraṃ.
analyzed: rakkhati iti pāpaṃkibbisam vapanti ettha ati vappokedāram
translated: rakkhatī ti pāpaṃ = a sin, a crime. Vapanti etthā ti vappo = a field.

original: 115. Yu thu kūnaṃ dīgho ca.
analyzed: yu thu kūnam dīghaḥ ca
translated: 115. Yu, thu, kūnaṃ, dīgho ca.

original: Yu-missane, thu-abhitthave, ku-sadde, etehi po hoti, etesaṃ dīgho ca. Dīghavidhānasāmatthiyā
analyzed: yu missane thu abhitthave ku sadde etehi paḥ hoti etesam dīghaḥ ca dīgha vidhāna sāmatthiyā
translated: In the preposition yu, in abhitthave, in the sound ku, po is added to these, and their long is also.🔽The absence of the acute accent is due to the power of the rule about the long.

original: ottābhāvo. Yavanti saha vattanti etthāti yūpo=yaññayaṭṭhi, pāsādo ca. Thavīyatīti
analyzed: yavanti saha vattanti ettha ati pāsādaḥ ca thavīyati iti
translated: In yavanti saha vattanti ettha, yūpo = sacrificial post, and palace.🔽Thavīyati,

original: thūpo=cetiyaṃ. Kavanti nadanti etthāti kūpo=udapāno.
analyzed: thūpocetiyam kavanti nadanti ettha ati kūpoudapānaḥ
translated: thūpo = a shrine. Kavanti nadanti ettha, kūpo = a well.

original: 116. Khipa supa nīsū pūhi paka.
analyzed: khipa supa nīsū pūhi paka
translated: . Khipa, supa, nī, sū, pū, paka.

original: Khipa-peraṇe, supa-saye, nī-naye, sū-pasave, pū-pavane, etehi paka hoti. Khapati
analyzed: khipa peraṇe supasaye nīnaye sūpasave pūpavane etehi hoti khapati
translated: In the preposition khipa, in supa, in nī, in sū, in pū, paka is added. Khapati

original: khayaṃ gacchatīti khippaṃ=sīghaṃ. Supanti ettha sunakhādayoti suppaṃ=papphoṭanaṃ.
analyzed: khayam gacchati iti khippam sīgham supanti ettha su nakha ādayaḥ ti
translated: khayaṃ gacchati, khippaṃ = quickly. Supanti ettha sunakhādayo, suppaṃ = a rubbing.

original: Nayanti etasmā phalanti nipo=rakkho. Savati ruciṃ janetīti sūpo=byañjanaviseso. Pavīyati
analyzed: nayanti etasmai phalanti niporakkhaḥ savati rucim janeti iti pavīyati
translated: Nayanti etasmā phalanti, nipo = a demon. Savati ruciṃ janetīti, sūpo = a special condiment. Pavīyati

original: maricajīrakādīhi pavittaṃ karīyatīti pūpaṃ=khajjakaṃ.
analyzed: marica jīraka ādīhi pavittam karīyati iti pūpam khajjakam
translated: maricajīrakādīhi pavittaṃ karīyati, pūpaṃ = a snack.

original: 117. Sippādayo.
analyzed: sippa ādayaḥ
translated: . Sippādayo.

original: Sippaādayo pakaantā nipaccante. Sapissa assaittaṃ, sapati anenāti sippaṃ=kalā. Vapissa
analyzed: sippa ādayaḥ nipaccante sapissa assa ettam sapati anena ati sippaṃkalā vapissa
translated: Sippādayo pakaantā nipaccante. Sapissa assaittaṃ, sapati anenāti, sippaṃ = an art. Vapissa

original: assi, vijjaṃ vapatīti vippo=brāhmaṇo. Vassa bo, vapati bahi nikkhamati hadayaṅgatasokenāti
analyzed: assi vijjam vapati iti vippo brāhmaṇaḥ vapati bahi nikkhamati hadayaṅgata sokena ati
translated: A horse, one who sows seed is a Vippa = brahmin. A rain-cloud, one who sows outside, goes out, is gone, is a rain-cloud.

original: bappaṃ=assu. Chupa-samphasse, usse, chupati anenāti cheppaṃ=naṅguṭṭhaṃ. Rupa=ruppane,
analyzed: bappaṃ assu chupa samphasse usse chupati anena ati cheppaṃn aṅguṭṭham rupa ruppane
translated: A tear, one who is dried up by contact, one who is dried up, is a Cheppa = nose. A form, one who is formed,

original: palopa dīghā, ruppati vikāramāpajjatīti rūpaṃ-bhūtabhūtikaṃ, evamaññepi.
analyzed: dīghā vikāram āpajjati iti evam aññe pi
translated: is lengthened by elision, one who is formed, who undergoes a change, is a form = an element and an elemental. So too with the rest.

original: 118. Sāsā apo.
analyzed: sāsā apaḥ
translated: . A rice-grain, a rice-grain.

original: Sāsa anusiṭṭhiyamiccasmā apo hoti. Sāsīyanti etenāti sāsapo=vīhiviseso.
analyzed: apaḥ hoti etena ati
translated: A rice-grain has the meaning of “instruction” , so it becomes apo . It is called a rice-grain because it is what is instructed by this .

original: 119. Viṭapādayo.
analyzed: viṭapa ādayaḥ
translated: . A tree, etc.

original: Viṭapaādayo apantā nipaccante. Vaṭa-veṭṭhane, assa ittaṃ, vaṭati veṭṭhati etenātiviṭapo=gumbaviseso,
analyzed: viṭapa ādayaḥ apantā nipaccante vaṭa veṭṭhane assa vaṭati veṭṭhati etena ati viṭa pogumba visesaḥ
translated: Trees, etc., are gathered in a forest. A tree, one who spreads out, one who spreads, is a Viṭapa = a kind of creeper.

original: kutha-pūtibhāve, thassa ṇo, akuthi pūtibhāvamagamīti kuṇapo=matako. Maṇḍa=bhūsane,
analyzed: kutha pūti bhāve thassa no a kuthi pūti bhāvam agami iti kuṇapomatakaḥ maṇḍa bhūsane
translated: A corpse, one who is putrid by corruption, has the state of, has the nature of, is a Kuṇapa = a dead body. A pavilion, one who adorns,

original: maṇḍeti janaṃ, maṇḍīyati janehīti vā maṇḍapo=janālayo, evamaññepi.
analyzed: maṇḍeti janam maṇḍīyati janehi iti vā maṇḍapaḥ jana ālayaḥ evam aññe pi
translated: is adorned by people, is adorned with people, is a Maṇḍapa = a people’s shelter. So too with the rest.

original: 120. Gupā pho.
analyzed: gupā phaḥ
translated: . A lump, a lump.

original: Gupismā pho hoti. Gopīyatīti goppho=caraṇagaṇṭhi.
analyzed: gupismā hoti gopīyati iti
translated: A lump has the meaning of “protection” , so it becomes pho . It is called a lump because it is protected by this .

original: 121. Garasarādīhi bo.
analyzed: gara sara ādīhi bo
translated: . A root, etc.

original: Garasarādīhi bo hoti. Garati aññe anena pīḷetīti gabbo=abhimāno. Sarati pavattatīti
analyzed: gara sara ādīhi baḥ hoti garati aññe anena pīḷeti iti gabbo abhimāno sarati pavattati iti
translated: It is gabbha because it gabbhati, that is, it torments others. It is gabbha because it sarati, that is, it occurs.

original: sabbo=sakalo. Phalakāmehi janehi amīyati gamīyatīti ambo=cūto. Puttena amīyati gamīyatīti ambā=mātā.
analyzed: phala kāmehi janehi amīyati gamīyati iti ambocūto puttena amīyati gamīyati iti ambāmātā
translated: It is gabba = conceit, because it gabbati = torments others by it. It is sabba = all, because it sarati = occurs. It is amba = mango, because it is amīyati = gone to by people who want fruit. It is ambā = mother, because it is amīyati = gone to by a son.

original: 122. Nimbādayo.🔽Nimbaādayo bantā nipaccante. Namissa assi, namati phalabhārenāti nimbo=ariṭṭho. Vamissa🔽vassa bittaṃ. Pittādayo vamati uggiratīti bimbaṃ=sarīraṃ. Kusissa amuka, tittena🔽kusīyati akkosīyatīti kosambo=rukkho. Kadatissa amuka, kadanti etena dvārādīnīti🔽kadambo=rukkho. Kuṭissa umuka, janehi koṭīyati pavattīyatīti kuṭumbaṃ=catuppado,
analyzed: nimba ādayaḥ  nimba ādayaḥ bantā nipaccante namissa assi namati phala bhārena ati nimbaḥ ariṭṭhaḥ vamissa  bittam pitta ādayaḥ vamati uggirati iti bimba sarīram tittena  kusīyati akkosīyati iti kosamborukkho kadatissa amuka kadanti etena dvāra ādīni iti  janehi koṭīyati pavattīyati iti kuṭumbaṃ catuppadaḥ
translated: Nimba and the rest.

original: khettaṃ, gharaṃ, kalattaṃ, dāsā ca. Kaṇḍissa kuḍu. Taṇḍulādayo anena kaṇḍanti paricchindantīti🔽kuḍubo=mānaṃ, evamaññepi.
analyzed: khettam gharam kalattam dāsā ca kaṇḍissa kuḍu taṇḍula ādayaḥ anena kaṇḍanti paricchindanti iti  kuḍubomānam evam aññe pi
translated: Nimba and the rest are bantā = bent down. It is nimba = the margosa tree, because it namati = it bends down with the weight of its fruit. It is bimba = the body, because it vamati = it vomits phlegm, etc. It is kosambha = a tree, because it kusīyati = it is reviled by people because of its titta = bitterness. It is kadamba = a tree, because it kadanti = people go to it for its doors, etc. It is kuṭumba = a quadruped, a field, a house, a cart, and slaves, because it koṭīyati = it is gone to by people. It is kuḍuba = a measure, because it kuḍanti = they cut up rice, etc., by it. So too with the rest.

original: 123. Darā bi.
analyzed: darā bi
translated: Darā and the rest.

original: Dara vidāraṇetīmasmā bi hoti. Odanādīni dārenti jatāyāti dabbi=kaṭacchu, vīmhi dabbī.
analyzed: bi hoti odana ādīni dārenti
translated: The word dabbī is derived from the root dab, to give, with the affix -ī.

original: 124. Kara sara sala kala valla vasā abho.
analyzed: kara sara sala kala valla vasā abho
translated: Kara, sara, sala, kala, valla, and vasā have the affix -abho.

original: Kara-karaṇe, sara-gati hiṃsācintāsu, sala-gamanattho, kala-saṅkhyāne, vala valla-saṃvaraṇe,🔽vasa-nivāse, etehi abho hoti. Karotīti karabho=oṭṭhā, pāṇippadeso ca. Sarati gacchatīti🔽sarabho=migaviseso. Salati gacchatīti salabho=paṭaṅgo. Kalīyati parimīyati vayasāti🔽kalabho=hatthipotako. Tadaminādipāṭhā ḷatte kaḷabho=sova. Valleti saṃvaraṇaṃ karotīti
analyzed: kara karaṇe hiṃsā cintāsu kala saṅkhyāne vala valla saṃvaraṇe  vasa nivāse etehi abhaḥ hoti karoti iti pāṇippadeso ca sarati gacchati iti  sarabha umiga visesaḥ salati gacchati iti salabha upaṭaṅgaḥ kalīyati parimīyati vayasā ati  ḷatte saṃvaraṇam karoti iti
translated: Kara means “to do”; sara means “to go,” “to hurt,” “to think”; sala means “to go”; kala means “to count”; valla means “to restrain”;

original: vallabho=piyo. Vasantyanenāti vasabho=puṅgavo.
analyzed: vasanti anena ati
translated: vasa means “to dwell.” These have the affix -abho. One who does is a karaṃbho = a cart, and the back of the hand. One who goes and hurts is a saraṃbho = a deer. One who goes and is scattered is a salaṃbho = a butterfly. One who is counted and measured by age is a kalaṃbho = a young elephant. In the reading tadaminādipāṭhā ḷatte kaḷabho = the same. One who restrains by restraining is a vallabho = a dear one. One in whom they dwell is a vasabho = a bull.

original: 125. Gadā rabho.
analyzed: gada rabho
translated: Gadā has the affix -abho.

original: Gadatismā rabho hoti. Gadatīti gadrabho=kharo.
analyzed: gadati sma rabhaḥ gadati iti gadrabha ukharaḥ
translated: Gadā has the affix -abho. One who goes is a gadrabho = an ass.

original: 126. Usarāsā kabho.
analyzed: usarāsā kabho
translated: Usarāsā has the affix -akabho.

original: Usa-dāhe, rāsa-sadde, etehi kabho hoti. Usati paṭipakkhe dahatīti usabho=seṭṭho. Rāsati nadatīti rāsabho=gadrabho.
analyzed: usadāhe rāsasadde etehi kabhaḥ hoti usati paṭipakkhe dahati iti usabhoseṭṭhaḥ rāsati nadati iti rāsabhogadrabho
translated: In the burning of the sun, in the sound of a crowd, from these kabho is formed. He burns against his opponent, thus he is a bull (usabho) = best. He sounds, he makes a noise, thus he is an ass (rāsabho) = a mule.

original: 127. Ito bhaka.
analyzed: i taḥ bha ka
translated: . From bhaka.

original: I itismā bhaka hoti. Eti gacchatīti ibho=hatthī.
analyzed: i itismā bhaka hoti eti gacchati iti ibhohatthī
translated: Itismā bhaka is formed. He goes, thus he is an elephant (ibho).

original: 128. Garāvā bho.
analyzed: garāvā bho
translated: . From bho, out of respect.

original: Gara ghara-secane, ava-rakkhane, etehi bho hoti. Garati bahi nikkhamanavasena siñcatīti gabbho=pasavo, ovarako ca. Avati satte rakkhatīti abbhaṃ=megho.
analyzed: gara ghara secane avarakkhane etehi bho hoti garati bahi nikkhamana vasena siñcati iti gabbhopasavaḥ ovarako ca avati satte rakkhati iti abbhaṃmegho
translated: He pours out, he sprinkles, he goes out, thus he is a womb (gabbho) = a living being, and a pot. He protects beings, thus he is the sky (abbhaṃ) = a cloud.

original: 129. Sobbhādayo.
analyzed: sa ubbha ādayaḥ
translated: . From sobbha and so on.

original: Sobbhaādayo bhantā nipaccante. Sadatissa assa ottaṃ, sīdanti etthāti sobbhaṃ=vivaraṃ,🔽sobbho=jalāsayaviseso. Kamissa assu, kāmīyatīti kumbho=dasambaṇamatto, ghaṭo ca.🔽(Kena jalena umbhīyati pūrīyatīti vā kumbho=ghaṭo.) Kusissa umuka, kusati avhāyatīti
analyzed: sobbha ādayaḥ bhantā nipaccante sadatissa assa ottam sīdanti ettha ati sobbham vivaram  kamissa assu kāmīyati iti kumbhoda sambaṇa mattaḥ ghaṭaḥ ca  kena jalena umbhīyati pūrīyati iti vā kumbhoghaṭaḥ kusissa avhāyati iti
translated: Sobbha and so on are formed by nipāta. It is a place where horses rest, thus it is a stable (sobbhaṃ) = a hole,

original: kusumbhaṃ=mahārajanaṃ. Kusumbho=kanakaṃ, evamaññepi.
analyzed: kusumbham mahārajanam kusumbhokanakam evam aññe pi
translated: sobbha = a special place for water. It is desired, thus it is a pot (kumbho) = a measure of ten (dasambaṇamatto), and a jar. (By what water is it filled, thus it is a pot = a jar.) It is desired, it is called, thus it is a flower (kusumbhaṃ) = a great crowd. Kusumbha = gold, and so on.

original: 130. Usa kusa pada sukhā kumo.
analyzed: usa kusa pada sukhā kumo
translated: . From kusa, from pada, from sukha, from kumo.

original: Usādīhi kumo hoti. Usati dahatīti usumaṃ=uṇhaṃ. Kusati avhāyatīti sukumaṃ=pupphaṃ. Pajjati devapūjādiṃ yātīti padumaṃ=paṅkajaṃ. Sukhayatīti sukhuma=aṇu.
analyzed: usa ādīhi kumaḥ hoti usati dahati iti usumaṃ uṇham kusati avhāyati iti sukumaṃ puppham pajjati deva pūjā ādim yāti iti padumam paṅkajam sukhayati iti sukhuma aṇu
translated: It is a cloud by reason of its raining down. It is hot because it burns. It is a flower because it is scattered. It is a lotus because it goes to worship of the gods, etc. It is subtle because it delights.

original: 131. Vaṭumādayo.
analyzed: vaṭuma ādayaḥ
translated: . Vaṭuma, etc.

original: Vaṭumaādayo kumantā nipaccanthe. Vajissa-ntassa ṭo, vajanti etthāti vaṭumaṃ=patho.
analyzed: vaṭuma ādayaḥ kumantāḥ ni pad canthe vajissantassa ṭaḥ vajanti ettha ati vaṭumaṃpatho
translated: Vaṭuma, etc., are formed by the adding of kum to the roots. The ṭo is for the sake of the metre. It is a path because it is trodden.

original: Silisassa lisse, silissatīti silesupaṃ=semhaṃ. Kamissa kuṅkādeso, kāmīyatīti kuṅkamaṃ=kasmīrajaṃ, evamaññepi.
analyzed: silisassa lisse silissati iti silesupaṃsemham kamissa kuṅkā deso kāmīyati iti evam aññe pi
translated: It is phlegm because of the root silis. It is a lotus because of the root kamis. So too with the rest.

original: 132. Gudhā umo.
analyzed: gudhā umo
translated: . Gudha, etc.

original: Gudha pariveṭṭhanetīmasmā umo hoti. Gudhati pariveṭṭhatīti godhumo=dhaññaviseso.
analyzed: pariveṭṭhane iti imasmai umaḥ hoti gudhati pariveṭṭhati iti
translated: The syllable um is added to gudha, etc. It is a kind of grain because it hides and covers.

original: 133. Paṭha carā amimā.
analyzed: paṭha carā amimā
translated: . Paṭha, etc.

original: Paṭhaticaratismā ama imā honti yathākkamaṃ. Paṭṭhīyati uccārīyati uttamabhāvenāti paṭhamaṃ=seṭṭhaṃ. Carati hīnattaṃ yātīti carimaṃ=pacchimaṃ.
analyzed: paṭhati carati smai imāḥ honti yathākkamam paṭṭhīyati uccārīyati uttama bhāvena ati paṭhamaṃseṭṭham carati hīnattam yāti iti carimaṃpacchimam
translated: The syllables ama and im are added to paṭha, etc., in due order. It is first because it is lifted up and exalted. It is last because it goes to inferiority.

original: 134. Hidhūhi maka.
analyzed: hidhūhi maka
translated: . Hidhū, etc.

original: Hi-gatiyaṃ, dhū-kampane, etehi maka hoti. Hinoti pavattahīti himaṃ=tuhinaṃ. Dhunāti kampatīti dhūmo=aggipasavo.
analyzed: higatiyam dhū kampane etehi hoti hinoti hi maṃtuhinam dhunāti kampati iti
translated: In the sense of ‘going’ and ‘shaking’, the affix maka is added to these. The sun is so called because it moves (hi) and shines (ma). Smoke is so called because it shakes (dhū) and moves (ma).

original: 135. Bhīto rīsano ca.
analyzed: bhītaḥ rīsanaḥ ca
translated: Bhī and rīsana.

original: Bhī-bhayetīmasmā rīsano hoti makaca. Antasarādilopo, bhāyanti etasmāti bhīsano=bhayānako. Bhīmo=sova.🔽136. Khī su vī yā gāhi sā lū khu hu mara dhara ghara jamāma samā mo.
analyzed: rīsanaḥ anta sara ādi lopaḥ bhāyanti etasmāt  khī su vī yā gāhi sā lū khu hu mara dhara ghara jamāma samā mo
translated: The affix rīsana is added to bhī in the sense of ‘fear’. Bhīsana is so called because it causes fear (bhāyanti etasmā). Bhīma is so called because it causes fear (bhāyanti etasmā).🔽Khī, su, vī, yā, gā, hi, sā, lū, khu, hu, mara, dhara, kara, ghara, jama, ama, gama, sama, mo.

original: Khī-khaye. Su-savane, vī-tantasantāne, yā-pāpuṇane, gā-sadde, hi-gatiyaṃ, sā-tanukaraṇāvasānesu,
analyzed: khī khaye su savane vītanta santāne yā pāpuṇane gā sadde hi gatiyam sa a tanu karaṇa avasānesu
translated: The affix mo is added to these roots: khī in the sense of ‘decay’, su in the sense of ‘hearing’, vī in the sense of ‘continuously extending’, yā in the sense of ‘reaching’, gā in the sense of ‘sound’, hi in the sense of ‘going’, sā in the sense of ‘the end of the sense faculties’,

original: lū-chedane, khu-sadde, hu-havane, mara-pāṇacāge, dhara-dhāraṇe, kara-karaṇe, ghara-secane,
analyzed: lū chedane khusadde huhavane mara pāṇa cāge dhara dhāraṇe kara karaṇe ghara secane
translated: lū in the sense of ‘cutting’, khu in the sense of ‘sound’, hu in the sense of ‘burning’, mara in the sense of ‘giving up life’, dhara in the sense of ‘bearing’, kara in the sense of ‘doing’, ghara in the sense of ‘sprinkling’,

original: jama-adane, ama gama-gamane, sama-upame, etehi dhātūhi mo hoti. Khepanaṃ nirupaddavakaraṇatāya
analyzed: jama adane ama gama gamane sama aupame etehi dhātūhi maḥ hoti khepanam nirupaddava karaṇa tāya
translated: jama in the sense of ‘eating’, ama in the sense of ‘going’, gama in the sense of ‘going’, sama in the sense of ‘comparison’, mo in the sense of ‘protection’.

original: khemo=nirupaddavo. Sunotīti somo=cando. Vāyanti etenāti vemo=tantavāyopakaraṇaṃ.
analyzed: khemaḥ nirupaddavaḥ sunoti iti somaḥ candaḥ vāyanti etena ati vemotantavāya upakaraṇam
translated: Khepanam is so called because it makes (nirupaddavakaraṇatāya) free from danger (khe). Khema is so called because it is free from danger (nirupaddava). Soma is so called because it is heard (sunoti). Vemo is so called because it moves (vāyanti etenā).

original: Yātīti yāmo=dinassa chaṭṭho bhāgo, aṭṭhamo vā. Gāyanti etthāti gāmo=saṃvasatho. Hinoti
analyzed: yāti iti yāmodinassa chaṭṭhaḥ bhāgaḥ aṭṭhamaḥ vā gāyanti ettha ati gāmosaṃvasathaḥ hinoti
translated: Yātī = yāmo = the sixth or eighth part of a day. Gāyanti ettha = gāmo = a dwelling place. Hino =

original: pavattatīti hemaṃ=suvaṇṇaṃ. Sāti sundarattaṃ tanuṃ karotīti sāmo=kāḷo. Lūyateti lomaṃ=tanuruhaṃ.
analyzed: pavattati iti hemaṃsuvaṇṇam sā ati sundara ttam tanum karoti iti sāmokāḷaḥ lūyate iti lomaṃtanuruham
translated: Pavattati = hemaṃ = gold. Sāti = sundarattaṃ = tanuṃ karotī = sāmo = black. Lūyate = lomaṃ = tanuruhaṃ.

original: Khūyate uttamabhāvenāti khomaṃ=atasi. Havanaṃ, hūyate vā homaṃ=huti. Marantyanenāti
analyzed: khūyate uttama bhāvena ati havanam hūyate vā homaṃhuti maranti anena ati
translated: Khūyate = uttamabhāvenāti = khomaṃ = atasi. Havanaṃ, hūyate = homaṃ = huṭṭhi. Marantyanena =

original: mambaṃ=yasmiṃ tāḷite na jīvati taṃ. Attānaṃ dhārente apāye vaṭṭadukkhe ca apatamāne
analyzed: tāḷite na jīvati tam attānam dhārente apāye vaṭṭa dukkhe ca a patamāne
translated: Mambaṃ = yasmiṃ tāḷite na jīvati taṃ. Attānaṃ dhārente = apāye vaṭṭadukkhe ca apatamāne

original: katvā dhāretīti dhammo=pariyatyādi. Karaṇaṃ, karīyatīti vā kammaṃ=sukhadukkhaphalādi.
analyzed: katvā dhāreti iti karaṇam karīyati iti vā kammaṃ sukha dukkha phala ādi
translated: Katvā dhāretīti = dhammo = pariyattiādi. Karaṇaṃ, karīyatīti = kammaṃ = sukhadukkhaphalādi.

original: Sedo paggharati anenāti ghammo=nidāgho. Jameti abhakkhi tabbaṃ adatīti jammo=nihīno,
analyzed: sedaḥ paggharati anena ati ghammonidāghaḥ jameti a bhakkhi tabbam adati iti jammonihīnaḥ
translated: Sedo paggharati anenāti = ghammo = nidāgho. Jameti = abhakkhi tabbaṃ adatīti = jammo = nihīno,

original: anisammakārī ca. Ameti pemena puttakesu pavattatīti ammā=mātā. Samenti anenāti sammā=piyasamudācāro.
analyzed: ca amā iti puttakesu pavattati iti ammā mātā anena ati sammāpiya samudācāraḥ
translated: Anisammakārī ca. Ameti = pemena puttakesu pavattatīti = ammā = mātā. Samenti = anenāti = sammā = piyasamudācāro.

original: 137. Asmādayo.
analyzed: asma ādayaḥ
translated: . Asmādayo.

original: Asmaādayo mantā nipaccante, pararūpādīnamabhāvo nipātanā. Asa-khepane, assateti asmā=pāsāṇo.
analyzed: asma ādayaḥ mantāḥ nipaccante para rūpa ādīnam abhāvaḥ nipātanā asa khepane assateti asmāpāsāṇaḥ
translated: Asa-khepane, assateti asmā=pāsāṇo.

original: Bhasa-bhasmīkaraṇe, bhasati pakkharatīti bhasmā=chārikā. Usa-dāhe, usati dahatīti
analyzed: bhasa bhasmīkaraṇe bhasati pakkharati iti bhasma āchārikā usa dāhe usati dahati iti
translated: Bhasa-bhasmīkaraṇe, bhasati pakkharatīti bhasmā=chārikā. Usa-dāhe, usati dahatīti

original: usmā=tejodhātu. Visa-pavisane, pavisanti etthāti vesmaṃ=gharaṃ. Bhī-bhaye, massa
analyzed: usmā tejaḥ dhātu visa pavisane pavisanti ettha ati bhī bhaye massa
translated: usmā=tejodhātu. Visa-pavisane, pavisanti etthāti vesmaṃ=gharaṃ. Bhī-bhaye, massa

original: suña, bhāyanti etasmāti bhesmā=bhayānako. Asatissa dhaṅa, assati janehi cajīyatīti
analyzed: bhāyanti etasma ati asatissa dhaṅa assati janehi cajīyati iti
translated: suña, bhāyanti etasmāti bhesmā=bhayānako. Asatissa dhaṅa, assati janehi cajīyatīti

original: adhamo=nihīno. Karotissa assa uttaṃ, karotīti kummo=kacchapo. Evamaññepi.
analyzed: adhamaḥ nihīnaḥ karoti assa uttam karoti iti kummokacchapaḥ evam aññe pi
translated: adhamo=nihīno. Karotissa assa uttaṃ, karotīti kummo=kacchapo. Evamaññepi.

original: 138. Nīto mi.
analyzed: nī taḥ mi
translated: . Nīto mi.

original: Nayatismā mi hoti. Nayatīti nemi=cakkantaṃ.
analyzed: nayatisma mi hoti nayati iti nemi cakkantam
translated: Nayatismā mi hoti. Nayatīti nemi=cakkantaṃ.

original: 139. Ūmi bhūminimi rasmi.
analyzed: ūmi bhūmi nimi rasmi
translated: . Ūmi bhūminimi rasmi.

original: Etesaddā miantā nipaccante. Ūha-vitakke, halopo, ūhanti vitakkenti etenāti ūmi=taraṅgo.
analyzed: ete saddāḥ mi antāḥ nipaccante ūha vitakke ha lopaḥ ūhanti vitakkenti etena ati ūmi taraṅgaḥ
translated: These words ending in mi are nouns formed by adding the suffix mi. Ūha-vitakke, halopo, ūhanti vitakkenti etenāti ūmi=taraṅgo.

original: Bhū-sattāyaṃ ottābhāvo, bhavanti etthāti bhūmi=mahī. Ni-pāpane, ettābhāvo, sugatiṃ
analyzed: bhavanti ettha ati bhūmi mahī sugatim
translated: Bhū-sattāyaṃ ottābhāvo, bhavanti etthāti bhūmi=mahī. Ni-pāpane, ettābhāvo, sugatiṃ

original: neti pāpetīti nimi=rājā. Rasa-assādane, pararūpābhāvo, rasanti sattā etāyāti rasmi=rajju.
analyzed: na iti pāpa iti iti nimi rājā para rūpa abhāvaḥ rasanti sattā
translated: He leads them away, thus he is a king (rājan). He tastes, thus he is a rope (rajju), because beings are bound by it.

original: (Iti pavaggapaccayavidhānaṃ).
analyzed: iti pavagga paccaya vidhānam
translated: (Thus the explanation of the word pavagga and its derivation is finished).

original: 140. Māchāhi yo.
analyzed: mā āchāhi
translated: He who is with māchā.

original: Mā-māne-chā-chādane, etehi yo hoti. Meti parimeti aññena uttamena guṇena attano aguṇanti māyā=santadosa paṭicchādana lakkhaṇā. Cheti chindati saṃsayanti chāyā=paṭibimbaṃ.
analyzed: etehi yaḥ hoti mā iti parimā iti aññena uttamena guṇena attanaḥ māyā santa dosa paṭicchādana lakkhaṇā cheti chindati saṃsayanti chāyā paṭibimbam
translated: He who is with mā-māne-chā-chādane, he is māchā. He conceals, thus he is māyā (deceit), which is characterized by concealing one’s own faults by means of another’s superior qualities. He cuts, thus he is chāyā (shadow), which is a reflection.

original: 141. Janissa jā ca.
analyzed: janiḥ sa jā ca
translated: He who is with janissa jā.

original: Janismā yo hoti, janissa jā ca, janetīti jāyā=bhariyā.
analyzed: janismai yaḥ hoti janissa jā ca janeti iti jāyā bhariyā
translated: He who is with janissa jā, he is janissa jā. He generates, thus he is jāyā (wife), which is a woman.

original: 142. Hadayā dayo.
analyzed: hadayā dayo
translated: He who is with hadayā dayo.

original: Hadayaādayo yantā nipaccante. Harissa daṅa, haratīti hadayaṃ=cittaṃ, manodhātu manoviññāṇadhātu
analyzed: hadaya ādayaḥ yantā nipaccante harissa daṅa harati iti hadayam cittam manaḥ dhātu manaḥ viññāṇa dhātu
translated: The heart and so on are carried away, thus he is hadayā dayo. He carries away, thus he is hadaya (heart), which is the mind element and mind-consciousness element.

original: nissayo ca, tanissaaka, attani pemaṃ tanotīti tanayo=putto. Saratissa suri, sarati
analyzed: nissayo ca attani pemam tanoti iti tanayoputto saratissa suri sarati
translated: And he is with nissayo ca, tanissaaka. He generates love in himself, thus he is tanayo (son), which is a child. He remembers, thus he is suri.

original: gacchatīti sūriyo=ādicco. Haratissa mmiṅa, sukhamāharatīti hammiyaṃ=muṇḍacchadanapāsādo.
analyzed: gacchati iti haratissa sukham āharati iti
translated: He goes, thus he is sūriyo (sun), which is the sun. He carries away, thus he is hammiyaṃ. He carries away happiness, thus he is hammiyaṃ (palace), which is a peaked-roofed building.

original: Kasa-gamane, kasassa alaka, assa i ca, kasati vuddhiṃ yātīti kisalayaṃ=pallavaṃ, evamaññepi.
analyzed: kasa gamane ca kasati vuddhim yāti iti kisalayaṃ pallavam evam aññe pi
translated: In the word kasala, kas means “to go,” ala means “to be born,” and ka means “to grow.” Thus kasala means “a shoot.” So too in the other words.

original: 143. Khī si si nī sī su vī kusūhi raka.
analyzed: khī si si nī sī su vī
translated: Khī, si, si, nī, sī, su, vī, kusūhi, raka.

original: Khī-khaye, si-sevāyaṃ, si-bandhane, nī-pāpane, sī-saye, su-savane, vī vā-gamane,🔽ku-sadde, sū-pasave, etehi raka hoti. Khayati duhanenāti khīraṃ=payo. Kusumādīhi🔽sevīyatīti siro=muddhā. Seti sarīraṃ bandhatīti sirā=dehabandhanī. Neti, parehivānīyatīti
analyzed: khīkhaye sisevāyam sibandhane nīpāpane sīsaye susavane vī vā āgamane  kusadde sūpasave etehi hoti khayati duhanena ati kusuma ādīhi  sevīyati iti sirā muddhā sā iti sarīram bandhati iti sirā deha bandhanī na iti parehivā ānīyati iti
translated: Khī means “to be destroyed,” si means “to serve,” si means “to bind,” nī means “to lead,” sī means “to lie,” su means “to hear,” vī means “to go,”🔽ku means “sound,” and sū means “to increase.” The word raka is formed from these. Khīra means “milk,” because it is destroyed by milking. Kusūhi means “a flower,” because it serves to adorn. Siro means “the head,” because it is served by the body. Sirā means “a vein,” because it binds the body. Nīra means “water,” because it is led by others.

original: nīraṃ=jalaṃ. Sayatīti sīro=halaṃ. Aniṭṭhaphala- dāyakattaṃ savatīti surā=madirā.🔽Suṇoti uttamagītādinti suro=devo. Veti uttamabhāvaṃ yātīti vīro=vikkanto. Kavati
analyzed: nīraṃjalam sayati iti sīrohalam savati iti surā madirā  suṇoti surodevaḥ vā iti uttama bhāvam yāti iti
translated: Sīro means “a plough,” because it lies. Surā means “spirits,” because it increases the state of being drunk.

original: nadatīti kuraṃ=bhattaṃ. Bhayaṭṭitānaṃ paṭhamakappiyānaṃ sūrattaṃ pasavatīti sūro=sūriyo, vikkanto ca.🔽144. Hi ci du minaṃ dīgho ca.
analyzed: nadati iti kuraṃbhattam bhayaṭṭitānam paṭhama kappiyānam sūrattam pasavati iti sūrosūriyaḥ vikkanto ca 🔽hi ci du minam dīghaḥ ca
translated: Su means “to hear,” and ro means “a song,” etc. Thus suro means “a god.” Vī means “to go,” and ro means “an excellent state.” Thus vīro means “a hero.” Kura means “food,” because it is uttered by hunger. Sūro means “the sun,” because it increases the state of being drunk for those frightened by the first unallowable thing, and it is a hero.

original: Hi-gatiyaṃ, ci-caye, du-gatiyaṃ, mi-pakkhepane, etehi raka hoti, dīgho cāntassa.
analyzed: higatiyam cicaye dugatiyam mi pa kkhepane etehi raka hoti dīghaḥ ca antassa
translated: Hi-gatiyaṃ, ci-caye, du-gatiyaṃ, mi-pakkhepane, etehi raka hoti, dīgho cāntassa.

original: Hinoti pavattatīti hīraṃ=tālahīrādi. Cayatīti cīraṃ=vakkalaṃ. Dūyati dukkhena gamīyatīti
analyzed: hinoti pavattati iti hīraṃtāla hīra ādi cayati iti cīraṃvakkalam dūyati dukkhena gamīyati iti
translated: Hinoti pavattatīti hīraṃ=tālahīrādi. Cayatīti cīraṃ=vakkalaṃ. Dūyati dukkhena gamīyatīti

original: dūraṃ=anāsannaṃ. Mīyate pakkhīpīyateti mīro=samuddo.
analyzed: dūram anāsannam mīyate pakkhīpīyate iti mīrosamuddaḥ
translated: dūraṃ=anāsannaṃ. Mīyate pakkhīpīyateti mīro=samuddo.

original: 145. Dhā tānamī ca.
analyzed: dhā tān amī ca
translated: . Dhā tānamī ca.

original: Dhā-dhāraṇe, tā-pālane, etehi raka hoti, ī cāntādeso. Dhāretītidhīro=dhitimā. Jalaṃ tāyatīti tīraṃ=taṭaṃ.
analyzed: dhā dhāraṇe tā pālane jalam tāyati iti tīram taṭam
translated: Dhā-dhāraṇe, tā-pālane, etehi raka hoti, ī cāntādeso. Dhāretītidhīro=dhitimā. Jalaṃ tāyatīti tīraṃ=taṭaṃ.

original: 146. Bhadrāyo.
analyzed: bhadrāyo
translated: . Bhadrāyo.

original: Bhadraādayo rakaantā nipaccante. Bhadda-kalyāṇe, dalopo pararūpābhāvo, bhajīyatīti
analyzed: bhadra ādayaḥ ra ka antāḥ nipaccante bhadda kalyāṇe da lopaḥ para rūpa abhāvaḥ bhajīyati iti
translated: Bhadraādayo rakaantā nipaccante. Bhadda-kalyāṇe, dalopo pararūpābhāvo, bhajīyatīti

original: bhadraṃ=kalyāṇaṃ. Bhī-bhaye, nadādipāṭhā vī, bhāyanti etāyāti bherī=dundubhi. Cita-sañcetane,
analyzed: bhadram kalyāṇam bhī bhaye nada ādi pāṭhāḥ bhāyanti bherī dundubhi cita sañcetane
translated: bhadraṃ=kalyāṇaṃ. Bhī-bhaye, nadādipāṭhā vī, bhāyanti etāyāti bherī=dundubhi. Cita-sañcetane,

original: vipubbo, vicintitabbanti vicitraṃ=nānākāraṃ, yā-pāpuṇane, rassa tuña, gamanaṃ yātrā=yānaṃ.
analyzed: vipubbaḥ vicintitabbanti vicitram nānā ākāram yāpa āpuṇane rassa tuña gamanam yātrā yānam
translated: vipubbo, vicintitabbanti vicitraṃ=nānākāraṃ, yā-pāpuṇane, rassa tuña, gamanaṃ yātrā=yānaṃ.

original: Gupa-gopane, ussa o, passa tañca gopīyatīti gotraṃ=kulādi, bhasa-bhasmīkaraṇe, rassa
analyzed: gupa gopane ussa o passa tat ca gopīyati iti gotraṃkula ādi bhasa bhasmīkaraṇe
translated: Gupa-gopane, ussa o, passa tañca gopīyatīti gotraṃ=kulādi, bhasa-bhasmīkaraṇe, rassa

original: tuña, bhasati bhakkhaṃ karoti toyāti bhastā-kammāragaggarī. Usa=dāhe, salopo, sokena
analyzed: bhasati bhakkham karoti bhastā kammāra gaggarī usa dāhe sa lopaḥ sokena
translated: tuña, bhasati bhakkhaṃ karoti toyāti bhastā-kammāragaggarī. Usa=dāhe, salopo, sokena

original: tāḷite usati dahatīti uro=sarīrekadeso, evamaññepi.
analyzed: tāḷite usati dahati iti uro sarīra eka deso evam aññe pi
translated: tāḷite usati dahatīti uro=sarīrekadeso, evamaññepi.

original: 147. Mandaṅka sasāsa matha catā uro.
analyzed: mandaṅka sasāsa matha catā uro
translated: . Mandaṅka sasāsa matha catā uro.

original: Manda-jaḷatte, aṅka-lakkhaṇe, sasa-gatihiṃsāpāṇanesu, asa-khepane, matha mantha-viloḷane,
analyzed: manda jaḷatte aṅka lakkhaṇe asa sa gati hiṃsā pāṇanesu asa khepane matha mantha viloḷane
translated: Manda-jaḷatte, aṅka-lakkhaṇe, sasa-gatihiṃsāpāṇanesu, asa-khepane, matha mantha-viloḷane,

original: cata-yācane, etehi uro hoti. Amandi asundarattā jaḷatthamagamīti mandurā=vājisālā.
analyzed: cata yācane etehi uraḥ amandi a sunda rattā jaḷattham agami iti mandurā vāji sālā
translated: cata-yācane, etehi uro hoti. Amandi asundarattā jaḷatthamagamīti mandurā=vājisālā.

original: Aṅkīyati lakkhīyatīti aṅkuro=bījapasavo. Sasati hiṃsatīti sasuro=jayampatīnaṃ pitā.
analyzed: sasati hiṃsati iti pitā
translated: Aṅkīyati lakkhīyatīti aṅkuro=bījapasavo. Sasati hiṃsatīti sasuro=jayampatīnaṃ pitā.

original: Asīyitthāti asuro=dānavo, arīhi mathīyati āloḷīyatīti mathurā=nagaraṃ. Catīyatīti caturo=dakkho.
analyzed: asīyittha ati asuraḥ dānavaḥ arīhi mathīyati āloḍīyati iti mathurā nagaram catīyati iti caturodakkhaḥ
translated: Asīyitthāti asuro=dānavo, arīhi mathīyati āloḷīyatīti mathurā=nagaraṃ. Catīyatīti caturo=dakkho.

original: 148. Vidhurādayo.
analyzed: vidhura ādayaḥ
translated: . Vidhurādayo.

original: Vidhuraādayo urantā nipaccante. Vidha-vedhane, ettābhāvo, vedhati hiṃsatīti vidhuro=viruddho.
analyzed: vidhura ādayaḥ nipaccante vidha vedhane ettā bhāvaḥ vedhati hiṃsati iti
translated: Vidhura and the others are the roots. Vidh- is for seeking; vidhuro = viruddho (opposed), because he seeks (vidhati) and harms (hiṃsatī).

original: Unda-kiledane, undati kiledatīti unduro=ākhu. Maṃka-maṇḍane, niggahītalopo, maṅkati
analyzed: unda kiledane undati kiledati iti maṃka maṇḍane niggahīta lopaḥ
translated: Unda- is for scratching; undati kiledatīti unduro = ākhu (snake). Maṅka- is for adorning; niggahītalopo, maṅkati

original: anena attānaṃ alaṅkarotīti makuro=ādāso, ratho, kakko, maccho ca. Kuka vaka-ādāne,
analyzed: anena attānam alaṅkaroti iti makuraḥ ādāsaḥ rathaḥ kakkaḥ macchaḥ ca kuka vaka ādāne
translated: anena attānaṃ alaṅkarotīti makuro = ādāso (mirror), ratho (chariot), kakko (crab), maccho (fish). Kuka- is for taking;

original: kassa dvittaṃ. Kukati salādayo ādadātīti kukkuro=sā. Maṅga-maṅgalye, amaṅgi pasatthamagamīti
analyzed: kassa dvittam ādadāti iti kukku rosā maṅga maṅgalye amaṅgi pasattham agami iti
translated: kassa dvittaṃ. Kukati salādayo ādadātīti kukkuro = sā (dog). Maṅga- is for auspiciousness; amaṅgi pasatthamagamīti

original: maṅguro=macchaviseso, evamaññepi.
analyzed: evam aññe pi
translated: maṅguro = macchaviseso (a kind of fish). So also with the others.

original: 149. Tima ruha rudha badha mada manda vajāja ruca kasā kiro.
analyzed: tima ruha rudha badha mada manda vajāja ruca kasā kiro
translated: . Tima ruha rudha badha mada manda vajāja ruca kasā kiro.

original: Tima-temane, ruha-janane, rudha-āvaraṇe, badha-bādhane, madaummāde, manda-modanathutijaḷattesu,
analyzed: tima temane ruha janane rudha āvaraṇe badha bādhane mada ommāde manda modana thuti ja ḷattesu
translated: Tima- is for covering; ruha- is for producing; rudha- is for obstructing; badha- is for hindering; mada- is for intoxication; manda- is for delight, praise, and dullness;

original: vaja aja-gamane, ruca-dittiyaṃ, kasa-gamane, etehi kiro hoti. Temetīti timiraṃ=andhakāraṃ,
analyzed: vaja ajagamane rucadittiyam kasagamane etehi kiraḥ hoti temeti iti timiram andhakāram
translated: vaja- is for going; ruca- is for seeing; kasa- is for going. Kiro is formed from these. Temetīti timiraṃ = andhakāraṃ (darkness),

original: āpo ca. Ruhati pavattatīti ruhiraṃ=lohitaṃ. Jīvitaṃ rundhatīti rudhiraṃ=tadeva. Bādhīyatīti
analyzed: āpaḥ ca ruhati pavattati iti ruhiram lohitam jīvitam rundhati iti rudhiram tat eva bādhīyati iti
translated: and water. It spreads out, thus it is blood (ruhiraṃ = lohitaṃ). It supports life, thus it is blood (rudhiraṃ = tadeva). It is deafened, thus

original: badhiro=sotavikalo. Janā majjanti etāyāti madirā=surā. Modanti etthāti mandiraṃ=
analyzed: janāḥ majjanti etāyāḥ ati madirā asurāḥ modanti etthā ati mandiram
translated: a deaf person (badhiro = sotavikalo). People are intoxicated by it, thus it is liquor (madirā = surā). They rejoice in it, thus it is a mansion (mandiraṃ =

original: gharaṃ. Vajatīti vajiraṃ=kulisuṃ. Ajanti gacchantī etthāti ajiraṃ=aṅgaṇaṃ gharavisayokāso
analyzed: gharam vajati iti ajanti gacchantī ettha ati ghara visaya ukāsaḥ
translated: house). It goes, thus it is a thunderbolt (vajiraṃ = kulisuṃ). They go, thus it is a courtyard (ajiraṃ = aṅgaṇaṃ gharavisayokāsa ca).

original: ca. Rocatīti ruciraṃ=manuññaṃ. Kasīyati dukkhena gamīyatīti kasiraṃ=kicchaṃ.
analyzed: ca rocati iti ruciraṃmanuññam kasīyati dukkhena gamīyati iti kasiraṃkiccham
translated: It shines, thus it is beautiful (ruciraṃ = manuññaṃ). It is carried with difficulty, thus it is a difficulty (kasiraṃ = kicchaṃ).

original: 150. Thirādayo.
analyzed: thira ādayaḥ
translated: . Thirā, etc.

original: Thiraādayo kirantā nipaccante. Ṭhā-gatinivattiyaṃ, ṭhassa thattaṃ, ṭhāti pavattatīti
analyzed: thira ādayaḥ kirantā nipaccante ṭhā gati nivattiyam ṭhassa thattam ṭhāti pavattati iti
translated: The words beginning with “thira” are formed by adding the verbal nouns in -ana to the roots. In the formation of ṭhā-gata, the ṭh of ṭhā is changed to that of gat, and ṭhāti pavattatīti is the meaning.

original: thiraṃ=ciraṭṭhāyī. Isa siṃsa-icchāyaṃ, niggahītalopo, icchīyatīti sisiro=utuviseso.
analyzed: niggahīta lopaḥ icchīyati iti
translated: It lasts for a long time, thus it is stable (thiraṃ = ciraṭṭhāyī). In the root isa, the siṃsa is elided, and it is wished for, thus it is cold (sisiro = utuviseso).

original: Ada khāda-bhakkhane, āssa rassatthaṃ, khādīyati pāṇakehīti khadiro=dantadhāvano, evamaññepi.
analyzed: ada khāda bhakkhane āssa rassattham khādīyati pāṇakehi iti khadira udanta dhāvanaḥ evam aññe pi
translated: In the root ada, the ā of āda is elided, and it is eaten by creatures, thus it is khadira (khadiro = dantadhāvano), and so on for the others.

original: 151. Dada garehi durabharā.
analyzed: dada garehi durabharā
translated: . Dada, etc.

original: Dada-dāne, gara ghara-secane, etehi yathākkamaṃ durabharā honti. Antānaṃ dadātīti dadduro=bheko. Garati siñcatīti gabbharaṃ=guhā.🔽152. Cara dara jara gara marehi te.
analyzed: dadadāne ghara secane etehi yathākkamam durabharāḥ honti antānam dadāti iti garati siñcati iti  cara dara jara gara mara ihi te
translated: The words dadduro and gabbhara are derived from the roots dad and gara respectively.

original: Carādīhi dhātūhi te carādayo honti yathākkamaṃ. Caragatibhakkhanesu caranti etthāti
analyzed: cara ādīhi dhātūhi te cara ādayaḥ honti yathākkamam cara gati bhakkhanesu caranti ettha ati
translated: The words car, dara, jara, gara, and mara are the bases of the following words.🔽The words caccara, daddara, jajjaro, gaggaro, and mammaro are derived from the roots car, dara, jara, gara, and mara respectively.🔽The word caccara is derived from the root car. It means a crossroad or a courtyard.

original: caccaraṃ=vīthicatukkaṃ, aṅgaṇañca, dara-vidāraṇe, darīyatīti daddaraṃ=vādittaṃ, bherī🔽ca. Jara-vayohāniyaṃ, ajarīti jajjaro=jiṇṇo. Gara ghara-secane, garati siñcatīti
analyzed: aṅgaṇam ca dara vidāraṇe darīyati iti bherī  ca ghara secane garati siñcati iti
translated: The word daddara is derived from the root dara. It means a musical instrument such as a drum or a tabor.🔽The word jajjaro is derived from the root jara. It means an old man.

original: gaggaro=bhinnassaro, haṃsassaro ca. Mara-pāṇacāge, maratīti mammaro=sukkhapaṇṇaṃ,🔽patthapaṇṇānaṃ saddo ca.🔽153. Pīto kvaro.🔽Pī-tappanetīmasmā kvaro hoti. Appiṇīti pīvaraṃ=thūlaṃ.
analyzed: gaggarobhinnassaraḥ haṃsassaraḥ ca marati iti mammarosukkhapaṇṇam  pattha paṇṇānam saddaḥ ca  pītaḥ kvaraḥ  kvaraḥ hoti
translated: The word gaggaro is derived from the root gara. It means a broken-voiced man or a swan.

original: 154. Cīvarādayo.🔽Cīvaraādayo kvarantā nipaccante. Cinātissa dīghattaṃ. Cīyatīti cīvaraṃ=kāsāvaṃ. Sama-upasame,
analyzed: cīvara ādayaḥ 🔽cīvara ādayaḥ kva rantāḥ nipaccante cinātissa dīgha ttam cīyati iti cīvaraṃkāsāvam sama a upasame
translated: The word mammaro is derived from the root mara. It means a dry leaf or the sound of pattha leaves.

original: nadādittā vī, pariḷāhaṃ sametīti saṃvarī=ratti. Dhāssa ī, jālakuminādīni dhāretīti
analyzed: vī pariḷāham sameti iti saṃvarīratti dhāsse ī jāla kumina ādīni dhāreti iti
translated: The night is so called because it “covers” (sam-vr) the world, as it were, with darkness.

original: dhīvaro=koṭṭo, tāyatissa ī, yena kenaci attānaṃ tāyatīti tīvaro=hīnajāti. Nayatissī,
analyzed: dhīvarokoṭṭaḥ yena kenacid attānam tāyati iti nayatissī
translated: The day is so called because it “bears” (dhā-) the light.🔽The village is so called because it “protects” (tī-) one from wild beasts, etc.

original: nayanti ettha sattāti nīvaraṃ=gharaṃ, evamaññepi.🔽155. Kuto kriro.
analyzed: nayanti ettha evam aññe pi  kutas kriraḥ
translated: The house is so called because it “protects” (nī-) one from wind, rain, etc.🔽The bird is so called because it “cries” (kur-) out.

original: Ku-saddetīmasmā kriro hoti. Kavati nadatīti kuraro=pakkhī, itthiyaṃ vīmhi kurarī.🔽156. Vasāsā charo.
analyzed: kriraḥ hoti kavati nadati iti kurara upakkhī itthiyam vīmhi kurarī  vasāsā charo
translated: The rainy season is so called because it “rains” (vas-) here.🔽The year is so called because it “rains together” (saṃ-vas-) here.

original: Vasa-nivāse, asa-khepane, etehi charo hoti. Vasanti etthāti vaccharo=vasso. Saṃpubbo, saṃvasanti etthāti saṃvaccharo=sova. Asati vissajjetīti accharā=devakaññā, aṅguliphoṭanañca.🔽157. Masā chero ca.🔽Masa-amasanetīmasmā chero hoti charo ca. Taṇhāya parāmasanaṃ maccheraṃ=sakasampattiniguhanaṃ, maccharaṃ=tadeva.
analyzed: vasa nivāse asa khepane etehi charaḥ hoti vasanti ettha ati vaccharovasso saṃpubbo saṃvasanti ettha ati asati vissajjeti iti accharā deva kaññā aṅguli phoṭanañca  masā chero ca  cheraḥ hoti charaḥ ca taṇhāya parāmasanam cheraḥ ca taṇhāya parāmasanam
translated: The fairy is so called because it “scatters” (acch-) its rays.🔽The miser is so called because he “hoards” (mac-) his wealth.

original: 158. Dhū vāto saro.
analyzed: dhū vāto saro
translated: The wind is so called because it “blows” (vā-) here.

original: Dhunāti vātīhi saro hoti. Dhunātīti dhūsaro=lūkho īsaṃpaṇḍu ca. Vāti gacchatīti vāsaro=divaso.
analyzed: dhunāti vāti ihi saraḥ dhunāti iti dhūsara ulūkhaḥ ca vāti gacchati iti
translated: It is shaken by the winds, therefore it is called dhūsara = rough, grey. It goes, therefore it is called vāsara = day.

original: 159. Bhamādīhyaro.🔽Bhama tasa manda kandādīhi aro hoti. Bhamatīti bhamaro=madhukaro. Tasati tantaṃ gaṇhātīti🔽tasaro=suttaveṭṭhano. Mandanti modanti etthāti mandaro=pabbato. Kandati avhāyatīti
analyzed: bhama ādi ī hi a ro  bhama tasa manda kanda ādīhi araḥ hoti bhamati iti tasati tantam gaṇhāti iti  mandanti modanti ettha ati mandaropabbato kandati avhāyati iti
translated: . Bhamādīhyaro.

original: kandaro=darī. Divassa ettaṃ, devanti kīḷanti etenāti devaro=patiro bhātā.
analyzed: kandara udarī divassaḥ ettam devanti kīḍanti etena ati devara upatiras bhātā
translated: It is aro from bhama, tasa, manda, kanda, etc. It flies, therefore it is called bhamaro = bee. It spins, therefore it is called tasaro = spider. They rejoice here, therefore it is called mandaro = mountain. It weeps, therefore it is called kandaro = ravine. This is of the day, they play by it, therefore it is called devaro = husband, brother.

original: 160. Vadissa badaca.
analyzed: vadissa badaca
translated: . Vadissa badaca.

original: Vadatismā aro yoti, vadatissa badādeso ca. Vadanti etenāti badaro=kakkandhūphalaṃ. Vīmhi badarī=kakkandhū.
analyzed: vadatismai araḥ ca vadanti etena ati badarokakkandhū phalam badarī kakkandhū
translated: It is aro from vadatissa, and the vowel a is elided. They speak by it, therefore it is called badaro = jujube fruit. In vīm, badarī = jujube.

original: 161. Vada janānaṃ ṭhaṅaca.
analyzed: vada janānam ṭhaṅ a ca
translated: . Vada janānaṃ ṭhaṅaca.

original: Vada janehi aro hoti, ṭhaṅa cāntādeso. Vadatīti vaṭharo=mūḷo vaṭharaṃ=thūlaṃ. Jāyatīti jaṭharaṃ=udaraṃ.
analyzed: vada janehi araḥ vadati iti vaṭharaḥ mūḷaḥ vaṭharam thūlam jāyati iti jaṭharam udaram
translated: It is aro from vada janehi, and the vowel ṭhaṅ is elided. It speaks, therefore it is called vaṭharo = foolish, vaṭhara = fat. It is born, therefore it is called jaṭhara = belly.

original: 162. Pacissiṭhaṅaca.
analyzed: pacis siṭhaṅ a ca
translated: . Pacissiṭhaṅaca.

original: Pacatismā aro hoti iṭhaṅacāntādaso. Pacanti etenāti piṭharo=thālī.
analyzed: pacati smai araḥ pacanti etena ati
translated: It is aro from pacatissa, and the vowel iṭhaṅ is elided. They cook by it, therefore it is called piṭharo = dish.

original: 163. Vakā araṇa.
analyzed: vakāḥ araṇa
translated: 163. Vaka, araṇa.

original: Vaka kuka-ādānetimasmā araṇahoti. Vaketi ādadāti etāyāti vākarā=migabandhanī.
analyzed: vaka kuka ādāna iti masmai vaka iti ādadāti
translated: Vaka, kuka, in the sense of taking, from this araṇa is formed. Or he takes with this, thus it is a vaka-rā = a deer-trap.

original: 164. Siṅgyaṅgāga majjakalālā āro.
analyzed: āro
translated: . Siṅga, aṅga, gāga, majja, kalāla, āro.

original: Siṅgiiti nāmadhātu, aṅga-gamanattho, aga-kuṭilagamane, majjasaṃsuddhiyaṃ, kala-saṅkhyāne,🔽ala-bandhane, etehi āro hoti. Vijjhanatthena siṅgaṃ viya siṅgaṃ=nāgarikabhāvasaṅkhātassa🔽kilesasiṅgassetaṃ nāmaṃ, taṃkaroti siṅgaṃ vā payuttaṃ, taṃ karoti rāgīsu pabhavatīti
analyzed: nāmadhātu aṅga gamana atthaḥ aga kuṭila gamane kala saṅkhyāne  ala bandhane etehi āraḥ hoti vijjhanatthena siṅgam viya siṅgaṃnāgarika bhāva saṅkhātassa  kilesa siṅgassa itam nāmam taṃkaroti siṅgam vā payuttam tam karoti rāgīsu pabhavati iti
translated: Siṅga is a name-base, aṅga has the meaning of going, aga of crooked going, majja of purification of urine, kala of counting,

original: vā, “dhātvatthe nānāmasmī”ti (5.12) i, pubba saralopo, siṅgi, tato āro, “sarolopo
analyzed: vā dhātu atthe nānāmasmi iti i pubba sara lopaḥ tatas āraḥ saraḥ lopaḥ
translated: ala of binding, from these āro is formed. Like a siṅga in the sense of piercing, thus siṅga = this is a name for the siṅga of defilements called the state of being a nāgarika, he makes that, thus siṅgaṃ vā payuttaṃ, or he makes that, thus rāgīsu pabhavatīti vā, “in the sense of a base there is a different name” (.) i, the preceding saralopa, siṅgi, then āro, “saralopa

original: sare”ti (1.26) ilopo, pubbe “vippaṭisedhe”ti (1.22) aniṭṭhappaṭisedho, ettha hi ārato
analyzed: sare ti  i lopaḥ pubbe vippaṭisedhe ti aniṭṭha ppaṭisedhaḥ ettha hi ārataḥ
translated: sare” (.) i, ilopa, previously “in the sense of opposition” (.) aniṭṭhappaṭisedho, here āro,

original: aññattha sāvakāsapubbasaralopova, ipaccayato aññattha ca, siṅgāro=kilesasiṅgakaraṇaṃ,
analyzed: aññattha sa avakāsa pubba sara lopaḥ u va i paccayataḥ aññattha ca siṅgāro kilesa siṅga karaṇam
translated: elsewhere sāvakāsapubbasaralopova, ipaccayato elsewhere ca, siṅgāro = the making of the siṅga of defilements,🔽.

original: vilāsoti vuttaṃ hoti. Aṅgati vināsaṃ gacchatīti aṅgāro=daḍḍhakaṭṭhaṃ. Aganti gacchanti🔽etthāti agāraṃ=gharaṃ. Līhanena attano sarīraṃ majjati nimmalattaṃ karotīti majjāro=biḷāro.🔽Kalāti niddesā lassa ḷattaṃ, etena guṇaṃ kalīyati parimīyatīti kaḷāro=piṅgalo. Dīghattaṃ
analyzed: vilāso ti vuttam hoti aṅgati vināsam gacchati iti aṅgāra udaḍḍha kaṭṭham aganti gacchanti  ettha ati agāraṃgharam līhanena sarīram majjati nimmalattam karoti iti  niddesāḥ lassa etena guṇam kalīyati parimīyati iti kaḷāraḥ piṅgalaḥ dīghattam
translated: is what is meant. Aṅga is a piece of wood that has gone to destruction. Aṅga is a going, a going there is in this, thus it is a house . Līhati = licks, majjati = sinks, majjati = is destroyed, thus majjāro = a cat.

original: alati bandhatīti aḷāro=vaṅko visālo ca.
analyzed: alati bandhati iti aḷāraḥ vaṅkaḥ visālaḥ ca
translated: Kalati = measures, thus kaḷāro = a partridge. Aḷati = binds, thus aḷāro = crooked, thick.

original: 165. Kamissassu ca.
analyzed: kamissassu ca
translated: . And in kama.

original: Kama-icchāyamiccasmā āro hoti, assa u ca. Kāmīyatīti kumāro=bālo.
analyzed: āraḥ hoti assa u ca kāmīyati iti kumārobālo
translated: Kama-icchāyamiccasmā āro is added, and u. Kāmīyati = is desired, thus kumāro = a boy.

original: 166. Bhiṅgārādayo.
analyzed: bhiṅgāra ādayaḥ
translated: . Bhiṅgāro, etc.

original: Bhiṅgārappabhutayo ārantā nipaccante. Bhara=bharaṇe, bharaṇaṃ dhāraṇaṃ posanañca,
analyzed: bhiṅgāra ppabhutayaḥ ārantāḥ nipaccante bhara bharaṇe bharaṇam dhāraṇam posanam ca
translated: Bhiṅgārappabhutayo ārantā nipaccante. Bhara = bearing, bearing, supporting, nourishing,

original: dhāraṇatthassa bharatissa bhiṅgādeso, bharati dadhāti udakanti bhiṅgāro=hemabhājanaṃ.
analyzed: dhāraṇa atthassa bharatissa bhiṅga ādesaḥ bharati dadhāti udakanti bhiṅga ārohema bhājanam
translated: the bhā- prefix is added to the root bhara, which means “to bear,” thus bharati = he bears, he supports, he nourishes, bharati = he carries, he holds, he carries water, thus bhiṅgāro = a golden vessel.

original: Kleda klida-alla bhāve, la lopo, kledayatīti kedāraṃ=khettaṃ, (ke jale sati dāro
analyzed: bhāve la lopaḥ kledayati iti jale sati
translated: Kleda = wetness, klida = play, alla = soft, la is elided, he causes to be wet, thus kedāraṃ = a field, (ke = in water, dāraṃ =🔽.

original: vidāraṇamassāti vā kedāraṃ=tadeva, bahulādhikārā sattamiyā na lopo.) Vida-lābhetīmasmā
analyzed: vā vā na lopaḥ
translated: Or, it is a kedāra because it is a vidāraṇa, a tearing, a rending, of the tree. The locative is used for the instrumental.🔽The word koviḷāra is formed thus:

original: kupubbā āro dassa ḷattaṃ issa ettābhāvo samāse kussa o ca nipaccante, kuṃ pathaviṃ
analyzed: ku pubbāḥ āraḥ dassa ḷattam issaḥ ettā bhāvaḥ samāse kussa o ca nipaccante kum pathavim
translated: The word kuṃ is a noun meaning “earth,”🔽and it is found in the sense of “arisen from the earth.”

original: vindati tatruppannatāyāti koviḷāro=diguṇapatto.🔽167. Karā māro.
analyzed: vindati tatra uppanna tā āyāti  karā māro
translated: The word koviḷāra is formed thus:🔽The word karā is a noun meaning “death.”

original: Karotismā māro hoti. Lohakiccaṃ karotīti kammāro=lohakāro.🔽168. Pusa sarehi kharo.
analyzed: karotisma māraḥ hoti loha kiccam karoti iti kammārolohakāro  pusa sarehi kharo
translated: The word kammāro is formed thus:🔽The word pusa is a noun meaning “sharp.”🔽The word pokkhara is formed thus:

original: Pusa sarehi kharo hoti. Posīyati jalenāti pokkharaṃ=padumaṃ. Sarati vikāraṃ gacchatīti sakkharā=ucchuvikāro.🔽169. Sara vasa kalā kīro vassuṭa ca.
analyzed: kharaḥ hoti jalena ati pokkharaṃpadumam sarati vikāram gacchati iti  sara vasa kalā kīraḥ ca
translated: The word sakkharā is formed thus:🔽The word sarīra is formed thus:🔽The word usīra is formed thus:

original: Etehi kīro hoti vassa uṭa ca. Sarīyatīti sarīraṃ=deho. Vasanti vāsaṃ karonti etenāti usīraṃ=bīraṇamūlaṃ. Anena thūlādi kalīyati parimīyatiti kaliro=aṅkuro.🔽170. Gambhīrādayo.
analyzed: etehi kīraḥ hoti ca ca ca anena thūla ādi kalīyati parimīyati iti 🔽gambhīra ādayaḥ
translated: The word kaliro is formed thus:

original: Gambhīraādayo kīrantā nipaccante. Gamissa bhuka, malopo vā, pathaviṃ, bhinditvā gacchati🔽pavattatīti gambhīro, gabhīro= agādho, kulissa lassa ḷo, pāde kulati pattharatīti
analyzed: gambhīra ādayaḥ nipaccante gamissa ma lopaḥ vā pathavim bhinditvā gacchati  pavattati iti gambhīraḥ gabhīraḥ agādhaḥ kulissa lassa ḷaḥ pāde kulati pattharati iti
translated: The words beginning with “deep” are formed by the addition of the k- suffix. The k- suffix is added to gam “to go” to make gamissa “it will go”; the l- suffix is added to gamissa to make gamissa bhuka “it will go quickly”; the o- suffix is added to gamissa to make gamissa bhuka malopo “it will go quickly and break up”; the o- suffix is added to gamissa to make gamissa bhuka malopo vā “it will go quickly and break up or split the earth”; the o- suffix is added to gamissa to make gamissa bhuka malopo vā pathaviṃ “it will go quickly and break up or split the earth and go on”.

original: kuḷīro=kakkaṭo, evamaññepi.
analyzed: evam aññe pi
translated: The l- suffix is added to kul “to scratch” to make kulissa “it will scratch”; the o- suffix is added to kulissa to make kulissa lassa “it will scratch and break up”; the o- suffix is added to kulissa lassa to make kulissa lassa ḷo “it will scratch and break up and be deep”; the o- suffix is added to kulissa lassa ḷo to make kulissa lassa ḷo pāde “it will scratch and break up and be deep and go on the foot”.

original: 171. Khajja valla masā ūro.🔽Khajja-majjane, vala valla-saṃvaraṇe, sama-āmasane, etehi ūro hoti, khajjīyatīti
analyzed: khajja valla masā ūro  khajja majjane vala valla saṃvaraṇe sama āmasane etehi ūraḥ hoti khajjīyati iti
translated: So too with the rest.

original: khajjūro, vīmhi khajjūrī=rukkhaviseso. Vallīyati saṃvarīyatīti vallūro=sukkhamaṃso.
analyzed: khajjūraḥ khajjūrī rukkha visesaḥ vallīyati saṃvarīyati iti vallūra usukkhamaṃsaḥ
translated: The words beginning with “to eat” are formed by the addition of the ū- suffix. The ū- suffix is added to khaj “to eat” to make khajjū “it will eat”; the ū- suffix is added to val “to cover” to make vallū “it will cover”; the ū- suffix is added to sama “to press down” to make samū “it will press down”.

original: Masīyatīti masūro=vīhiviseso.🔽172. Kappūrādayo.
analyzed: masīyati iti masūrī vīhi visesaḥ  kappūra ādayaḥ
translated: The ū- suffix is added to mas “to be ground” to make masū “it will be ground”.

original: Kappūraādayo ūrantā nipaccante. Tuṭṭhimuppādetuṃ kappati sakkotīti kappūraṃ=ghanasāro.🔽Karotissa assu, kibbisaṃ karotīti kurūro=pāpakārī. Pasa-bādhane, pasati pīḷetīti
analyzed: kappūra ādayaḥ ūrantāḥ nipaccante tuṭṭhim uppādetum kappati sakkoti iti kappūraṃghanasāraḥ  karotissa assu kibbisam karoti iti kurūra upāpa kārī pasabādhane pasati pīḍeti iti
translated: The words beginning with “camphor” are formed by the addition of the ū- suffix. The ū- suffix is added to kappur “camphor” to make kappūra “camphor”;

original: pasūro=duṭṭho, byañjanaṃ, evaṃnāmako ca, evamaññepi.
analyzed: byañjanam evaṃnāmako ca evamaññe pi
translated: the ū- suffix is added to karoti “he does” to make kurūra “he does evil”; the ū- suffix is added to pasa “to obstruct” to make pasūra “obstructing, oppressing”; the ū- suffix is added to byañjana “a letter” to make byañjanū “a letter”. So too with the rest.

original: 173. Kaṭha cakā oro.
analyzed: kaṭha cakā oro
translated: The

original: Kaṭha-kicchajīvane, caka-parivitakkane, etehi oro hoti. Kaṭhati kicchena jīvatīti kaṭhoro=thaddho. Cakati parivitakketīti cakoro=pakkhiviseso.🔽174. Morādayo.🔽Moraādayo orantā nipaccante. Mī-hiṃsāyaṃ, īlopo, mayati hiṃsatīti moro=mayūro. Kasa-gamane,

He is a peacock because he is a bird that is mayati, he harms. In the case of the kasa, the gamana,
